loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin L., 24, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. L. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction supplements to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplements to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 54 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Michael owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Michael has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Michael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Michael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila H. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Mila is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Mila is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann N. is 24 years old, married to Solomon and blessed with one child. Ann runs a retail shop and has been in this business for the last two years. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, and she plans to use the loan to purchase sugar, soft drinks, salt, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, baking powder and rice for her business. The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of her loan. Her hope and dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, salt, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, baking powder and rice

loans.name: Ket

texts.en: Ket C. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a weaver, earning an income of  $1.5 USD per day. Her husband is a electrician, earning an income of $4 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $75 USD on food and $50 USD on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase equipment for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Ruth, tiene 47 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus  tres hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son  mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y trabajan.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, en ella también vende artículos de bazar y helados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, además de esto también prepara almuerzos para vender, nos cuenta que todos los días hasta su local llegan bastantes clientes a servirse los deliciosos platos que ella vende pero que mas clientela tiene los fines de semana. Los productos para su tienda los compra en Manta y algunos  los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio tres años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos como: arroz, azúcar, enlatados, detergentes, carnes, pescado, etc. que también le sirven para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que lo fundaron, es la tesorera del mismo y le gusta por la unión del grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts and renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous "panama" straw hat.

Here we meet Mrs. Ruth who is 47 yeras old.  Several years ago her husband passed away and she was left alone with her three children who are now adults.  Two of them still live at home and work.

She runs a grocery store in her house and also sells bazaar items and ice cream.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and also prepares and sells lunches.  She says considerable customers come for her delicious meals every day but weekends are when sales are at their highest.  She buys the products for her store in Manta.  Some are delivered to her store.  She has been in business for three years and it is going quite well.

This loan is to buy products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, detergent, meat, fish, etc., some of which are also used to prepare food.  She's been a member of the communal bank since it was founded, acting as its treasurer, and enjoys the group's close relationship.

Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned goods, detergent, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, both of whom go to school.

To earn a living, she operates an ice cream sales business. Christine is seeking a loan to stock more ice cream to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to open up a shop with additional profits from her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of ice cream

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He owns a house in Kasese Uganda. The responsibility to provide for his family solely rests on him and his desire is to have a self-sustaining family. He has been in the retail business for eight years. His hardship is debtors who do not pay on time; his  hopes for the future are increasing his financial resources and educating his children. Robert is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a wall.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, Elma has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from fattening pigs. Elma is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store such as shampoo, sugar, and other grocery items. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF.

In the future, Elma aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Iddriss

texts.fr: Jeune papa de 34ans, Idriss est marié à une enseignante. Il est photographe, reporter et en même temps vendeur de portables, CD. Il sollicite ce troisième crédit pour acheter les accessoires de portables, des CD et des pellicules à Lomé. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en: A 34 year old young father, Idriss is married to a teacher. He is a photographer, reporter, and also a seller of mobile phones and CDs.  He is asking for this third loan to buy mobile phone accessories, CDs, and camera film in Lome.  One person helps him in his business.

loans.use: To buy CDs, mobile phones, and other items.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia Puno y departamento Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos estudiando.  Estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria.
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ovinos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco ovinos para engordarlo en un mes y carnearlo para venderlos en la ciudad de Puno y a veces los vende en la rinconada.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos mayores.  Su esposo trabaja.
Su sueño es tener una casa  en Juliaca y tener un carro para el trabajo, esto le facilitará el traslado de los animales que compra.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros, la capacitación y la orientación que les brindan las Promotoras.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de San Jose", located in the district of Manazo in the province of Puno and the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married common-law, and she has 7 children, all of whom are in school. She has a grade 9 education. 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three loan cycles. Her previous loan was in the amount of S/ 500 nuevos soles and the funds were invested in her business, which is the buying and selling of sheep.

This new loan is in the amount of S/ 800 nuevos soles and she will purchase five sheep to fatten and slaughter within the month. She sells in the city of Puno and at times she sells in La Rinconada. Her eldest children help her in the business. Her husband works. 

Her dream is to have a house in Juliaca and to have a work to use for her business. It will help her to transport the livestock which she purchases.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the savings, the training, and the orientation that the promoters offer.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha has been selling handmade women's accessories from her home since 2002. She is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three school-aged children. Her income is barely satisfactory, but she has to continue her business operation to provide her family with extra financial support. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of pearls and necklaces, etc. She is willing to diversify her merchandise collection to attract more customers and, therefore, increase her sales and income. In the future, she is hoping to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of pearls and necklaces.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Al Hashmi- Amman. He is a 49-year-old married male with five children.

Mohammad is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to improve his Dry Cleaning shop and to purchase new equipment for it.

Mohammad is looking to open a new branch of his shop and purchase a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his dry cleaning shop

loans.name: Filomera

texts.en:
She has eight children, five of whom are in school. She is a married woman. 

Filomera has been in the business of selling breads, mandasi, and sapati for three years. She took a loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, breads, and flour

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Merisian, who is in her late 40s, is married, with one child who goes to school. She has been running a fruits & vegetable business for three years now. She works from 5 am to 7 pm each day and is able to make a very small monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase business and paid school fees and household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables and to continue building her house.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Haki Sawa", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To add more fruits and vegetables, and to continue building her house.

loans.name: Antonio Paredes Candia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTONIO PAREDES CANDIA” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Miguelina es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en macramé, carpintería, tienda de barrio, repostería, costura, venta de mantas.

La señora Miguelina,  indica que hace mas de tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus familias.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la ceja y posterior a la elaboración de lo entregará a domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión y el consultorio.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Agustina, ya que se encuentra en consultorio.
texts.en:
The A.C. “ANTONIO PAREDES CANDIA” will begin its 11th loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of its focus on Panamerica. It is made up of 8 members and is governed by a board of which Señora Miguelina is the treasurer. The businesses the communal bank members are involved in are varied and consist of macrame, carpentry, grocery store, bakery, sewing, selling blankets among others.

Señora Miguelina says that she has been working in Pro Mujer for more than 3 years. She was invited to join the communal bank by a demo lady in the area. Currently, she has a crafts shop selling blankets, a craft she learned from her relatives. She has been running the shop for the last 3 years. 

The loan she is taking is to increase her working capital to buy wool which she will acquire in La Ceja and then post production take home.

This work flow allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the meetings and the training.

The photograph does not include Señora Agustina as she is in a consultation.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur libasse habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié et gère une agence d’assurance dans la localité ou il vit. Parallèlement  avec sa profession qu’il exerce depuis 5 ans, il pratique aussi l’élevage de moutons.  Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de l’achat de nouvelles têtes  qu’il compte engraisser pour les revendre pour la fête  de Tabaski prochaine. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité secondaire pour mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Libasse is 35 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married, and for the last 5 years, he has managed an insurance agency in the neighborhood where he lives. At the same time, he raises sheep. He has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since 2003. Libasse is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to buy more animals that he plans to fatten for re-sale at the next Tabaski festival. This loan will allow him to obtain more profit from his secondary activity, to better meet his social expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep to re-sell at the Tabaski festival

loans.name: Kossiwa Mawuto

texts.fr:
Kossiwa Mawuto est une femme  âgé(e) de 25ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Kossiwa Mawuto travaille comme revendeuse de friperie depuis 2006. Elle vend à toutes personnes de façon ambulante après achat au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. 
Kossiwa Mawuto a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des habits (chemises, jupes et autres).
texts.en:
Kossiwa Mawuto is a 25-year old woman. She is single. Kossiwa Mawuto works as a vendor of second-hand clothing since 2006. She sells to all kinds of people, as a street vendor, after stocking up at the Hedzranawoe market.

Kossiwa Mawuto has requested a second-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy clothing (shirts, skirts, and so on).

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and married to her husband Januari. Together they have two children ages one and two years old. She owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past three years.  She earns a monthly income of 45,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from her business.

This is her first loan term in KADET and she will use the loan amount to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra profit from the business to purchase more clothes for resale so as to expand her business. Her dream is to own a boutique wholesale through her hard work.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Enlazando Group

texts.es:
El grupo Enlazando está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Concepción ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años en especial granadillas. Ella invertirá el crédito en semillas, siembra, abonos…etc.
María está casada y tiene seis hijos los cuales le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Ana María vende ropa, fotocopias e impresiones y Alejandra tiene una pulpería e invertirá en arroz, frijoles, azúcar…etc.
texts.en:
The 'Enlazando' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is María Concepción, who has been farming for 10 years, especially passion fruit.  She will invest her loan in buying seeds, manure, etc.  María is married and has six children who help her in her business.

The other members of this group are Ana María who sells clothes, photocopies and printouts, and Alejandra who has a grocery store and will invest her loan in rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo cuenta con 42 años de edad y está casado con la señora yuri, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Roberto, diana y Brenda, de los cuales solo dos estudian, están cursando segundo y tercer año de prepa, ya que la mas pequeña apenas esta por cumplir los tres años de edad, tiene un atienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 5 años.
El dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque buscaba apoyar a su familia, para mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con una buena solvencia económica y así continuar ayudando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió, lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son leche, aceite, azúcar, sal, refrescos, galletas, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para tener una amplia variedad de productos.
El sueño más grande que tiene don Ricardo es el de invertirle mucho mas al negocio, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas su local y poner una abarroteria, puesto que así incrementara sus ingresos, y asegurar la educación profesional de sus hijos.
Dice que está profundamente agradecido con los donadores de kiva y fundación realidad, por este gran apoyo y confianza que les están brindando.
texts.en:
Ricardo 42 years old and is married to Yuri, with whom he has 3 children, Roberto, Diana, and Brenda.  Only two of the children are in school, they are in their second and third year of high school, and the smallest is barely three years old.  Ricardo has a grocery stand, which he has had for 5 years.

He says he decided to start this business, as he was looking for a way to support his family, to improve their quality of life, have good financial standing and continue helping their children with their studies.  Ricardo will invest the loan that he received to buy more goods such as milk, oil, sugar, salt, soda, cookies, toilet paper, soap etc. to have a wide variety of products.

Ricardo's biggest dream is to invest more in the business to make it grow faster, because he wants to expand his site a little and install a grocery store, since this will increase their income and ensure a professional education for their children.

Ricardo says he is deeply grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for providing great support and trust in him.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as milk, oil, sugar, salt, soda, cookies, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Marta mujer trabajadora, vive con su mami, es comerciante su negocio consiste en la elaboración de pan de horno (rosquillas, cosas de hornos, empanadas de hornos, entre otros productos). Con el préstamo anterior incremento sus ventas. Mejorar su nivel de vida son sus planes. 
Esta solicitando este otro préstamo para la compra de materia prima, productos necesarios como: marca de leña, maíz, azúcar sulfitada, galones de leche, canela, queso, manteca, crema, tajos de dulce. Con esta inversión lograra mayores ventas. Agradece el apoyo de la financiera para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta is a hard-working woman who lives with her mom.  Her business is making bread, doughnuts, baked goods, baked empanadas and other products.  With her previous loan, she increased her sales.  Her plan is to improve her standard of living.

Marta is requesting another loan to buy raw materials and products she needs such as firewood, corn, white sugar, gallons of milk, cinnamon, cheese, butter, cream, dulce de leche, etc.  With this investment, she will achieve more sales.  She is grateful to the financial institution for their support in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Or, 54, is married and resides with her husband. Or grows rice and her husband repairs motorbikes for people in his village. Or is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Or would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 42-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 20, 18, and 11.

Elisa has been growing and selling rice for 20 years. She earns 8000 PHP per month from farming. She has requested a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Elisa is a hard-working mother. She hopes her children will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Janobiddin

texts.ru: Джанобиддин более 17 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его добрая жена и любящие дети помогают ему в посеве  и обработки земли. Кроме того он занимается откормом скота. Его бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, и он старается расширить его. С апреля до октября он строил дом для своего сына, все стройматериалы приобретались на полученную чистую прибыль. Он хочет продолжать и расширять свой бизнес в дальнейшем. Джанобиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота, в целях расширения скотоводства. Она надеется на вашу помощь и благодарен всем , кто поддержит его в столь нужное ему время. Спасибо!
texts.en: Janobiddin has been cultivating crops for over 17 years. He is married and has three children. His kind wife and loving children help him with sowing crops and cultivating the land. In addition, he is raising cattle. His business brings him good income and he is trying to expand it. From April through October he was building a house for his son, all building materials were paid for by his net profit. He wants to continue to expand his business in the future.  Janobiddin would like to receive a loan to buy cattle to expand his cattle rearing business. He is hoping for your help and is grateful to everyone who is supporting him in this time of need. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es: Marjorie del Carmen tiene 33 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que dedica es la venta de ropa usada, ella tiene 2 niños que se encuentra a su cargo que junto a su esposo lo han sacado adelante. Marjorie tiene 7 años de experiencia lo cual le ha permitido que sus clientes la visiten por la calidad de ropa que ella les ofrece. Marjorie del Carmen está solicitando crédito para invertir en mercadería en la compra de pacas de ropa usada
texts.en: Marjorie del Carmen is 33 years old.  She sells used clothing for a living.  She has two children who are her dependents and together with her husband have been thriving.  Marjorie has seven years of experience which has allowed her to have costumers that visit her for the quality of the clothing she offers them.  Marjorie del Carmen is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise by buying bales of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib 6Sous Groupe 1

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté6 sous groupe 1 est   un regroupement  de 11  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe de 11 femmes  regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Elles sont représentées par madame   Aissata   qui représente la personne habillée en  marron  avec une voile  sur la tête  sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur du commerce de  tissus  et de la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 15 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus a confectionner et d’autres produits comme sacs et chaussures  dans le but de diversifier ses marchandises.. Son objectif  est d’ouvrir un magasin dans un futur proche.
texts.en:
Al  Ouma Liberté 6Sous Groupe 1 is made up of 11 members who all belong to the same association, a national solidarity group. It is a group of 11 women gathered together in the same sector, miscellaneous trade.

The women are represented by Ms. Aissata, the woman shown dressed in brown with a veil on her head in the photo. For several years, she has been very busy in the fabric and fashion trade. She makes the most of her experience of more than 15 years in this business. She begins her day at 10am, returning home around 7pm.

Ms. Aissata is seeking a loan intended for purchasing fabrics to prepare and other goods, such as bags and shoes, with the aim of diversifying her merchandise. Her intention is to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, bags, shoes and various goods to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe DJEKAFO VII sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans 3 enfants et vivant  toutes dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  région de Ségou.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA  première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes, bananas and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Setuka

texts.en:
Setuka is married with six children. She joined Umoja women group and became a very active member. Due to the growing market in Isinya town for steers, She took a loan of USD 120 and bought two steers. She paid her loan from the milk proceeds. With last years prolonged drought, her family lost some of their herds. Setuka`s family now sees the need to practice the modern methods of livestock management.

Setuka sells steers in cattle markets in Isinya and now she wants to buy 3 medium sized steers. She believes that with the support she receives from her family, the trainings she gets through her group, and the favorable market she will be able to excel in her steers project.

loans.use: Setuka wants to take advantage of the rainy season and buy   steers to be raised for about 3-6 months and then later be sold in Isinya market.

loans.name: Ab.qayom

texts.en:
Ab.Qayom who born in kabul with the age of 53 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Ab.Qayom who has bakery shop near the market, he past the groups loan and now he took individual loan through AFSG to buy more materials for his bakery shop.
Ab.Qayom living with his 7 children's in a rental house he get loan to increase his business and can able to pay the payment of his house and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy wood, flour, yeast

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Mrs Cuc's husband left her for another woman so Au, her first child, stopped going to school and had to work as a daily laborer in HCM city but he only earns enough money for himself. Mrs Cuc is supporting 2 children who going to school by herself.

She doesn't have any land so much depends on Cuc selling pudding and glutinous rice at small market. She has repaid a loan of $50 already and the family income increased $1.5/person/month. Their average income is $10/person/month. This time she wants to borrow a loan of $75.

loans.use:
selling pudding and glutinous
rice at small market

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria is 40 years old. She has five children and she separated from her husband about five years ago due to alcohol and physical abuse. She owns a grocery store at home where she sells salt, sugar, oil and candies. She is part of a solidarity group called Marcos8 integrated by Juana Gomez Gomez, who manufactures colorful "Morraletas" (grocery market bags). Juanita uses rectangular wooden molds of various sizes in order to manufacture the "Morraletas". These molds help shape the final product. Maria Guadalupe would use the loan to purchase various necessary products and Juana would purchase plastic and molds.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA VICTORIA TIENE 40 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, HACE COMO CINCO AÑOS SE SEPARO DE SU ESPOSO POR EL ALCOHOL Y EL MALTRATO. ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE SAL, AZUCAR, ACEITE, DULCES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARCOS 8 Y LO INTEGRA JUANA GOMEZ GOMEZ QUE HACE MORRALETAS (BOLSA QUE SE USA PARA ALMACENAR LAS COSAS QUE SE COMPRAN EN EL MERCADO)QUE SON DE DIVERSOS COLORES. PARA HACER ESTO JUANA UTILIZA UN MOLDE DE MADERA EN FORMA RECTANGULAR DE VARIOS TAMAÑOS EL CUAL SIRVE PARA DARLE FORMA AL PRODUCTO TERMINADO. CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA GUADALUPE SURTIRA SU TIENDA CON LOS PRODUCTOS NECESARIOS Y JUANA COMPRARA PLASTICO Y MOLDES.

loans.use: grocery store supplies

loans.name: Ngheam

texts.en: Ngheam P. is a 43-year-old mother of four school-aged children. She is a market vendor selling vegetables and typically earns around $1. 20 each day, while her husband works as a construction foreman making on average $4 each day. Mrs. Ngheam P. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work, so he doesn’t spend too much on his daily public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex O. is Ugandan by nationality, an Acholi by tribe, and 34 years old. He is married and with his wife, he has five children. Three of them go to school and two are still at home.

In1998, Alex left his village in Acholibur division located in the Pader district because of the danger of the war. He settled at the IDP camp called the Acholi Quarters where he is still staying up to now. While in the quarters, Alex worked in the stone quarry from which he earned some money for himself and his family. Though he was earning some money from the quarry, life was not easy at all. There were a lot of demands in his family and life became nothing but a struggle to earn money so that he can help the family survive.

In 2007, Alex joined Life in Africa Foundation and worked as a guard/watch man. He was immediately put on the salary scale and began earning 90,000/= (90,000 Uganda shillings is about US$ 50) as his salary at every end of the month. Just like a thirsty man in the desert who finds an oasis, Alex’s life became better than it had been in years.

Alex has a good plan for beginning a business selling second-hand clothes in his village. The clothes are in high demand and he is confident that the business will be a success but he lacks the capital to start it up. He heard about Kiva at Life in Africa Foundation and is so excited that his dream may come true. With the money he earns from this business he will be able to send his other two children to school.

Alex is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (about US$ 150). He feels sure he will be able to repay this loan in 5 months.

Below is his budget for the 250,000/=

-Buy a bale of second-hand clothes at 150,000/=

-Transporting of this bale to the place of sale…..60,000/=

-Paying tax in the market place to allow him to sell….20,000/=

-Emergency …………………………………………20,000/=

-Total……………………………………………………250/000/=

loans.use: Buying a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a small entrepreneur dealing in livestock keeping. She is married to Isaya M., who is a retired army officer. She has five children aged 7,12,13,17 and 20 years. She is a hard worker and loves her job. She paid back her first loan and she is asking for a loan to buy water containers and containers for storing eggs. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buy  water containers and containers for storing eggs

loans.name: Almanisa

texts.en: Almanisa is 43 years old and single. She lives in Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Five years ago she started breeding cattle as a business. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy an additional cow to increase her business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cruz del Carmen Diaz Martinez, is married and has two children, one studying in University and the other in high school. Cruz's business is a corner store, a business she has had since she was very young. According to her, she started her business when she observed that her husband's income was insufficient, and she tells us that it was very difficult at first because she had no idea how to start. In a time in her life she was a pork butcher, which gave her an idea on what she was going to do, but butchering pork was only a once-a-week occurence, and she felt that the earnings were too small. Today her greatest need is to invest in her business through the pruchase of products for resale. For this reason Cruz has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years now and she feels very satisfied with the credit that has been granted to her. She has secured higher income that has benefitted the improvement of her business and of her household. Her credit history show 18 past credits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cruz del Carmen D. M., casada, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando uno en la Universidad y el otro en secundaria, el negocio de Cruz es una pulpería, ella desde joven tiene este negocio. Según cuenta, el negocio lo comienza cuando observa que los ingresos de su marido son muy pocos, nos dice que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo comenzar el negocio, en un momento de su vida ella trabajo en el destace de cerdos, esto dice que le ayudo para tener idea de lo que iba hacer, pero como el destace de cerdos lo hacia una ves a la semana, sintió que los ingresos eran pocos. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es invertir en su negocio con la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos es por esta razón que doña Cruz trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que ha obtenido mejores ingresos que le han beneficiado en el mejoramiento de su negocio y por ende de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of products for her business

loans.name: Nhóm Chi Nghien - Cum Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Nghiên is 48. years old. She has 3 children. She raises pigs and sells grocery. Her husband works in their rice paddy. Their family income is 6.25 USD a day. She needs a loan to buy mash to feed her pigs.
Mrs Vân will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Ngà will use the loan to buy grocery to sell.
Mrs Bình will use the loan to buy chicken feed and pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nghiên 48 tuổi có 3 con đang đi học và đi làm. Chị làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng chị làm ruộng và phụ giúp chăn nuôi. Thu nhập trung bình khoảng 100 000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn ăn.
Chị Vân vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn.
Chị Ngà vay để bán hàng tạp hoá.
Chị Bình vay mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà.

loans.use: to buy pig mash, chicken feed, grocery

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., 35, is a mother of six children and works growing rice and beans on plots of land. On average she earns approximately three dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Yem Sophal, 44, supports the family’s income working as motor-taxi driver, making one dollar a day. Two of their children are goldsmiths; one earns $100 a month and the other, $200 a month.

To improve her crops, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers. Any excess money will be used to purchase lumber to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and lumber for house repairs

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Mrs. Benita is a member of the Communal Bank "Villa Turística D. Catac II". She sells groceries and candy for a living; her business is located at the Catac market, in the district of Catac, Recuay province, department of Ancash. With the loan of $750 USD, which will be paid in 8 installments, she will purchase: 2 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of rice, 1 box of oil, 1 pack of salt, 1 bag of semolina, 4 packs of 1.5 liter sodas, 4 bags of noodles, 3 large packs of yogurt, 3 small packs of yogurt, 3 boxes of shampoo, 2 bags of detergent, and 4 packs of toilet paper. She is 48 years old; she is married and has 6 children who are adults and are independent. Her husband picks up occasional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Benita, pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística D. Catac II, se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes y Golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Catac del distrito Catac y provincia D. Recuay, departamento D. Ancash. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos D. azúcar, 2 sacos D. arroz, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 paquete D. sal, 1 bolsa D. sémola, 4 paquetes D. gaseosa D. 1 ½ litro, 4 bolsas D. fideos, 3 paquetes D. yogur granD., 3 paquetes D. yogur chico, 3 cajas D. shampoo, 2 bolsas D. detergente, 4 paquetes D. papel higiénico. Ella tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos ya son mayores e independientes, su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales.

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila was born in 1953 and she is married. She lives together with her husband in the village of Gračanica, near the town Živinice. Her husband works as a self-employed contractor . Najila takes care of the poultry and  she cultivate strawberries. They also earn  additional money by selling milk to the dairy. This is her first loan at MCO. She intends to invest this loan to buy a water-pump which she will use for strawberry watering. Her wish is to expand her strawberry business in order to increase monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To buy water-pump.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Mrs. Nang T., a 30 year old widow with three children, lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is a taxi driver, another attends school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Nang T. is currently in the fish sales business. Despite multiple incomes from family members, her family does not have sufficient income to invest in a rice field. As the value of rice fields is rising, she would like to invest in order to re-sell in the future at a better price. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a portion of rice field.

loans.use: To buy a rice field in order to re-sell it later for a better price.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Mrs. Lai E. is a villager in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Lai E. is a 59 year-old widow with four children, two of whom help their mother while another one is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending school. She is a bed-maker. Since her business has improved, she wants to expand it but has insufficient equipment to do so. Thus, Mrs. Lai E. is requesting a loan to buy more equipment.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Ms. Justina belongs to the Communal Bank “Teresa Ramos”, located in the Jr. Aguyatia # 559 in the district of Yarina Cocha in the Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and her husband is a fisherman. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (US $100), Justina decided to invest in the sale of fish.

Nowadays she continues with her fish business and wakes up every day at 4 o’clock in the morning to purchase her fish in the port of Yarina Cocah to then take to sell in the market of Yarina Cocha.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (US $425), which will be paid off in five months, she will buy two tubs of fish, ice and a net so her husband can catch more fish. The strength and dedication that Justina gives everyday motivates her to be a successful woman who is a fighter. She is very grateful for the unconditional support given to her by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Justina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytía # 559, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, su esposo es pescador. Justina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de pescado. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de pescado, Justina se levanta todos los días a las 4. 00 am de la mañana para ir a comprar su tinada de pescado en el puerto de Yarina Cocha para luego llevarlo a vender en el mercado de Yarina Cocha. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara 2 tinas de pescado, hielo y una red para que su esposo pueda implementarse mas en la pesca. El esfuerzo y dedicación que Justina le pone cada día que pasa le motiva a ser de ella una mujer más luchadora y vencedora, es por ello que esta agradece por el apoyo incondicional que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of fish in bulk, ice, net.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La dama Petronila A. se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo al negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su propia casa de habitación brindando todo tipo de productos los cuales son ofrecidos a sus clientes en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

Desde que inició su negocio de pulpería ha mejorado el status de vida de su familia brindándole mejores condiciones a su pequeño hijo para su desarrollo. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual la señora Petronila llega a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para usarlo en la compra de la mercadería para ofrecerla en su pulpería.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos los anteriores créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.
texts.en:
Petronila A. works with much effort on her mini-market business which is located in her own home providing all types of products to her clients in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Since she started her mini-market her family’s quality of life has improved, providing them with better conditions for the development of their young son. Today the reason why Petronila has come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to use it for the purchase of merchandise to offer it in her mini-market.

It is important to point out that she has been characterized as a loyal client of Ceprodel as she has paid off all of her previous loans on time and according to the conditions established.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai K. H., 41, is the mother of three children, aged sixteen, fourteen and eleven. She has just started her business selling Khmer cake (banana fried with flour, which has a unique flavor). With her business activity, she can typically make about $3 each day in revenue.

To generate more income for the household, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and makes about $10 per day.

Mai K. H. has applied for this loan to purchase more construction tools for her husband, as right now there is shortage of construction tools.

loans.use: To buy more construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She rents a space on Cuzco Street in the city of Ayacucho where she sells soups, breakfast and lunch. She has run her restaurant for the past year and a half; before then she served food at a local school. Dina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy drinks and cooking ingredients for her restaurant. 

Dina has been working with FINCA for one year and is a very reliable client. Her dream for the future is to open a dry goods store next to her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora Gloria V. desde hace 20 años labora en el negocio de venta de mariscos los que son comercializados en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se desempeña. Se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora que para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia se ha esforzado grandemente para sacarlos adelante.

Hoy en día espera que Ceprodel le brinde el apoyo por medio de la obtención de un crédito para la compra de sus mariscos y espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema y así logrará llevar a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
For twenty years, Gloria V. has sold seafood in Chinandega's Central Market. She has worked hard to improve her quality of life and to help her family get ahead.

She hopes that Kiva's partner Ceprodel will support her with a loan to purchase seafood. She is confident that her loan will be granted without a problem and in that way she will be able to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Desarrollo (“Development”) Village Bank.  Irene is 56 years old and married with two children. Irene runs a neighborhood store called Cuzco from her home, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat, perfume, and special order clothing. She also has a call center. She buys her wares in Lima, and runs the store with the help of her husband and children.  Irene needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar and pasta.  Irene dreams of putting a roof onto her house (which is currently covered with corrugated tin) and of owning a car. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo. 
Irene es casada, tiene 56 años y 2 hijos, Irene tiene una bodega bazar llamado Cuzco, ubicada en su casa que esta en el distrito D. Jesús Nazareno,  en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, perfumes, ropa a pedido, también tiene un locutorio, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima, la atención D. su negocio lo realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. 
Irene necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y fideos. 
Irene sueña con techar el primer piso D. su casa y tener un carro.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and pasta

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Курбонова Дильбар проживает В Гиссарском районе. Возраст 36 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Муж не работает , но помогает ей в ее деле. А занимается она торговлей. Имеет подарочный магазин . Он помогает ей поставлять товар и упаковывать подарки. Занимаются они этим бизнесом уже 12 месяцев. Планируют получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот , так как скоро наступают весенние праздники и свадебныйсезон . Погсить кредит сможет втечение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar K. lives in Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 36 years old and is married with two children. She is a high school graduate and owns a store where she sells presents. Dilbar's husband does not have a job but he helps her with her business by supplying products and packing presents. The couple has has this business for a year. They are applying for a loan in order to expand their business, before the spring holidays and the wedding season. They are planning to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Valle Del Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo "Valle del Sol" esta representado por la señora Eufronia y compuesta por 12 miembros  los cuales se dedican a diferntes actividades como a la venta D. cosméticos, licores, tarjetas telefónicas, a la serigrafía y a la venta D. comida rápida. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia y en este tiempo D. crisis mas aun, pero la perseverancia D. los socios hace que sigan adelante sin importar los obstáculos ya que ellos representan el pilar fundamental en los ingresos D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calida D. sus familias. A pesar D. como grupo es la primera ves que obtienen un financiamiento D. Agrocapital en su mayoría las socias integrantes ya participaron en grupos anteriores conformando uno nuevo ahora, en el cual demostraran la misma responsabilidad y cumplimiento con la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Valle del Sol" (Valley of the Sun) is represented by Mrs. Eufronia and is composed of 12 members, some of whom make a living performing activities like the sale of cosmetics, liquor, telephone cards, and fast food. In the business environment that they work in there is a lot of competition., especially in this time of financial crisis. In order to persevere, they must avoid the obstacles and work hard to retain the income of their businesses, which is the main source of income that supports their families. The loan will be used to purchase ingredients and materials so that the members will be able to increase their income and improve their quality of life. Despite the fact that this is the first time that the group receives financing the majority of the members have already participated in similar groups and they were able to prove that they are responsible and trustworthy with repaying loans.

(Translated by Thatcher of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Businesses

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs Khoeurn U., a 44-year-old mother of six children, is from Sophy village in Takeo province. Three of her children attend the local school whilst the other three are in employment (including one in a garment factory and another in a bread shop). Khoeurn U. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr En Van, is a fisherman and also a construction worker. Since En Van works far from home, he usually pays a considerable sum to take a motor taxi to work. Khoeurn U. is therefore asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband in order to reduce her expense. She and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Wolimata

texts.fr: Wolimata D. âgée de 65 ans est mariée. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Palal. Son activité est le petit commerce.  Wolimata  achète et revend des produits divers  Elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Wolimata D., age 65, is married and is a member of the village lending group of Bayouf Palal. She works in small-scale commerce, buying and selling various goods. She wants to bolster her business. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various goods

loans.name: Can

texts.en:
Can L. is a 59-year-old femaL. living in the town of Nam Định.  She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Can works in a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business which specializes in making rice-noodles. So her income comes primarily from manufacturing & selling to local businesses and community members. Can has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4300000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1999, Can joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Can has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Can is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Can plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality & life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation & roL. in society

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Дилрабо

texts.ru: Дилрабо женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест второй раз.Она жительница города Худжанда,, 13 микрорайона.Рядом с домом у неё расположена её точка торговли.Она продаёт продукты питания.Из-за отдалённости данного микрорайона , все жители покупают товары у Дилрабо.Т.к у неё не большая наценка на товары, у Дилрабо много клиентов, и торговля всегда кипит.По бизнесу её помогает её сын, который вместе с матерью закупает товар на оптовом рынке.На снимке Дилрабо в своём ларьке.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a woman who is borrowing from MicroInvest for a second time. She is a resident of the city of Khujand, district 12. She has a sales location next to her home. She sells food products. Because of the far location of her district all the residents purchase products from Dilrabo. Because she has a small premium on her products, Dilrabo has a lot of customers and sales are always brisk. Her son helps her in her business; he purchases products together with his mother at the wholesale market. On the photo is Dilrabo in her store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of food products

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Miss Meena L. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.
Miss Meena L. lives with her father and one brother. Her father works in a private office and her brother is studying in grade 11. 
Miss L. opened a grocery shop three months ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10000.00 to increase the stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She is very much worried about the poor condition of her family and interested to increase the living style of her family.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Mercedes del Carmen  A. Pérez, tiene la edad de 20 años, habita en el barrio la borgoña, junto a sus padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y en futuro seguir estudiando para salir hacia delante y apoyar mas a sus padres, desde hace 5 años, esta joven se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas. Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
The young Mercedes del Carmen A. Pérez is 20 years old and she lives in the neighbourhood La Borgoña with her parents. She would like to improve her family's living conditions and in the future continue her studies so that she can move forward and support her parents more. For five years this young girl has been working in agriculture. Her biggest difficulty has been a lack of finances and a lot of pests. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and materials to apply to her crop in order to have a good harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizers to apply to her crops/Comprar insumos y fertilizante para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie C. is a 39-year old farmer with three children. She grows rice and sells her grains to their neighbors. She started farming in 1994 using the 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm that she inherited from her parents. 

Marjorie would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000. She wants to buy fertilizers to improve the soil condition of her farm. She hopes that this move will help a lot in improving her yield and her income as well.

CEVI is a partner of World Vision Philippines. The reason why Marjorie chose CEVI was that CEVI provides a wide array of services to the poor. It gives not just loans but training and insurance also.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El señor Benedicto tiene su salon de billar al frente de la plaza Ergueta, vive en la misma casa con su esposa y su bebé, viven ellos solos, ya que sus familias viven en el campo, ambos se apoyan mutuamente y son muy unidos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela paño, para cambiar las mesas de billar, es un cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Benedicto has a pool business across from the Ergueta plaza, he lives at home with his wife and baby, their families live in the country, both support each other and are very close. The loan will be invested in buying a special fabric to cover the pool tables, he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pool table felt for his business

loans.name: Leydi Noelia

texts.en:
Señora Leydi, 29 years old and married with two young children, sells eggs. Leydi and her family live in the city of Pucallpa, where her husband works as a driver.

Leydi has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about 1.5 years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends). Leydi used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase eggs at wholesale prices, and she plans to use her new loan of 1000 soles for the same purpose. She works independently and distributes her eggs throughout the city of Pucallpa.

Leydi's goal is to engage further in the market for eggs by eventually obtaining her own post in the commercial area where eggs are sold wholesale. She is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos because the organization has enabled her to invest in her own business.

loans.use: To purchase eggs for sale.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is engaged in hog-raising business. She is married to F. and is a good mother to her children. Her family lives in Barangay San Jose in Santiago City. She is happy that God blessed her with a family that gets along well together because she believes that good relationships are an important part of a successful life. 

The next step that she wants to pursue is expanding her business. However, due to a lack of financial capital, Lorelyn is now asking Kiva lenders for a loan of PHP 5,000 for the continuous growth of her hog-raising business. The amount will be used to buy feed and additional piglet. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Andua

texts.en:
Andua M. is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic, and they have four children, all in school. Andua runs a shop stocked with a variety of items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her shop. With the extra profits stemming from her loan, Andua hopes to expand her business by investing in yet more goods to sell.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, targeted towards war refugees returning to their native homeland, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Chimgee lives with her parents and son in own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school and her mother is retired. Chimgee operates and manages a traditional shoe making business with her father. She makes two different types of traditional shoes, one called Buriad and the other is called Mongol. She started her business in 2006 and at that time only produced the Buriad shoes. As she began gaining more experience and customers, she expanded her product line to include the Mongol shoes. Through her hard work, she has been able to buy tools and rent a small work area. One day, she would like to own her own store where she can sell her products, expand her product line and also attract new customers. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and tools for her shoe making business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and tools

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la compra y venta D. madera rolliza, en esta actividad trabaja junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” desD. hace dos años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en productos D. belleza, en la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será invertido en madera.  La meta D. Edith es tener un salón D. belleza bien implementado.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra-venta de madera para luego venderlo.

loans.name: Yodgor

texts.en:
Yodgor G. is 26 years old. He is married and has one child. A young entrepreneur, Yodgor sells different kinds of detergents like soap, shampoo, tooth paste, shaving cream, washing powder and others in his store. Yodgor is not alone in this business as his wife actively helps him with sales. Yodgor requests a loan of $1000 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Yodgor's main goal is to educate his beloved child so that someday he'll become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase detergents and increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio ROLANDO, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos dos mujer y un varón. La hija mayor estudia en el colegio, la hija menor estudia en el jardín y el varón es un bebe.
 
El alterna sus actividades de con la administración de su pequeña empresa que es una procesadora (molino) de grano y distribuir los productos. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de granos molidos como la cebada, trigo, haba y otros insumos.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rolando is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. He is 29 years old, married, and has three children (two girls and a boy). The older daughter is in school, while the younger one is in kindergarten. His son is still a baby.

Rolando manages a small business that processes grain for distribution. He needs a loan to increase his sale of milled grains such as barley, wheat, beans, and other products. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain for processing (milling)

loans.name: Badegna (Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Badegna, composé de 6 mariées, une veuve et une célibataire, ont en moyenne  36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames traditionnelles à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. 
Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage, de parenté et professionnels. 
L’activité dominante de ces femmes est l’achat vente de tissus accompagné de celui des produits cosmétiques et de la fabrication du savon traditionnel.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle, le groupe Badegna a rapproché l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son  premier  prêt solidaire. 
Le prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pièces de tissus, des paquets de produits cosmétiques et quelques fûts en matière première pour la fabrication du savon. 
La connaissance du milieu a permis aux femmes du groupe de savoir le goût de sa clientèle. C’est pour cela que leur produit est sollicité dans la ville de Koutiala et elles ont de l’expérience dans leur secteur d’activité. La vente du produit est faite de trois manières à savoir sur place à la maison, au marché et en ambulant dans les  quartiers de la ville  de Koutiala.  
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22 815CFA chacune par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser  le prêt et son intérêt, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants. 
Les membres du groupe Badegna ont pour ambition, l’élargissement de leur domaine d’activité en associant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
The eight women in the Badegna ('brotherhood') group, composed of 6 married women, one widow, and one single woman, have an average age of 36 and 2 children, on average. They all live in traditional polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of the prefecture of Koutiala, Sikasso region. They are united by ties of neighborhood or kinship, and by professional bonds.

The main activity of these women is buying and selling cloth and cosmetics, and making traditional soap. Wishing to satisfy their clientele, the Badegna group came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their first solidarity loan. .

The loan will be used to buy 20 lengths of cloth, packages of cosmetic products, and some barrels of raw materials for making soap.

Familiarity with their milieu has permitted the women of this group to understand the tastes of their clientele. For that reason, their products are sought after in the town of Koutiala, and they have experience in their sector and activities. They make their sales in three different ways: out of their homes, at the market, and on foot, walking around the town of Koutiala.

With this loan, they expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,815 F CFA each. This profit will be used to reimburse the loan and the interest, to contribute to the daily family expenses, and help pay the school fees for their children. Their ambition is to expand their businesses by adding on other money-earning activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en:
Tausala is 25 and single with no children.  She works in her mother's business, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Tausala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.  

In 2008, Tausala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tausala's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Tausala's Overall Social Metric Score*:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Ma. Heide V. is 30 years old. She has six children and her eldest is only 12 and studying. Her wish for her children is that they will grow healthy and respectful.

Heide is a fish vendor and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. to be able to sell fish and raise money for a living. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 13,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc to expand her fish selling business and also develop her farm.

If ever she gets a loan, she will buy the farm supplies needed in her farm aside from buying more fish to resell. The loan will not only improve her harvest in her farm but income as well in her fish selling business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase women's winter shoes

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
La sra H. D. G. D. 46 años D. edad vive con sus hijos quienes trabajan independientemente y aportan en la unidad familiar todos viven en Los Florales – Acomayo – Parcona – Ica en casa propia.
La sra se dedica a la venta D. verduras enteras y picadas listas para la preparacion D. comidas tambien venD. fruta en esta temporada ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 20 años y gracias a este trabajo a logrado obtener su casa darles educacion a su hijos ya que ella esta separada D. su esposo desD. hace mas D. 12 años y ella ha sido madre y padre para ellos.
En su trabajo es bien dedicada emprendedora y da muy buena atención a sus clientes por lo que son fieles a ella antes vendia en calle maurtua pero cuando fue la inundacion en 1997 ella se traslado a la Calle Huancavelica donD. actualmente ofrece sus productos.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder invertir más en su negocio ya que estamos en temporad D. uva y mango.
Ella trabaja desD. las 6.30 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y en la tarD. venD. chanfaina en su casa por eso tiene buena acumulacion D. bienes.
texts.en:
H. D. G., 46, lives with her children. They work independently and contribute to the family. All of them live in their own house in Los Florales – Acomayo – Parcona – Ica. She sells whole vegetables that are chopped and ready for food preparation. She also sells fruit this season. She has been in this business for 20 years. Thanks to this work she has been able to get a house and give her children an education. She has been separated from her husband for over 12 years, and she has been mother and father to her children. In her work she is a very devoted entrepreneur. She gives her customers very good attention, and that is why they are loyal to her. Previously, she sold on Maurtua Street. There was a flood in 1997, and that is when she moved the Huancavelica Street. That is where she currently offers her products. She is asking for a loan to be able to invest more in her business because we are in the grape and mango season. She works from 6:30 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. In the afternoon she sells “chanfaina” (a type of stew traditionally maD. from the less-noble parts of the animal - offal). That is why she has a good amount of assets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rebeca Del Carmen
