texts.es: La Sra. Rebeca P. trabaja en el seguro social tengo 6 años de trabajar para esta institución tengo 3 hijos los tres en edad escolar el crédito lo solicito para terminar un cuarto que le estoy construyendo a unos de mis hijos y si me han ayudado mucho los créditos con ceprodel he podido terminar de construir mi casa ya tengo cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel me han financiado 4 créditos los cual me siento agradecida porque podido cumplir uno de mis sueños tener mi casa.
texts.en:
Rebeca P. works for Social Security. She has worked there for 6 years and she has 3, school-age children. The funds will be used to finish building a bedroom for one of her children. Ceprodel's loans have been very useful for they have allowed her to finish building her house. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for four years and has had 4 loans. She is grateful to have met one of her goals: to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn A. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Emmalyn is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Emmalyn owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Emmalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emmalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emmalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hatanbaatar

texts.en: Hatanbaatar is 33 years old and lives with his mother and sibling in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Hatanbaatar operates a religious trading business along with the consumer goods trading with his mother. In their business, his mother sells their goods and Hatanbaatar helps her with purchasing and transporting products. They started their business in 1995 and have steadily expanded their business. Hatanbaatar has been planning to continue this business in the future. Besides operating a religious articles trading business, he operates a taxi service business during the summer. Hatanbaatar is a very hardworking person who is very enthusiastic about the future. He says, “I would like to increase my business profit and purchase own plot of land with a yard and a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent for my family.” Hatanbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to increase his working capital for his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Junila

texts.en: Junila B. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Junila owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Junila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Junila decided to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Cronelio Ramon

texts.es:
el sr. Cornelio Ramon R. es comerciante individual, vende medicinas populares, tiene mas de 10 años 
de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual la realiza de forma ambulante/domiciliar este negocio es una fuente de generacion de ingresos que le permiten darle el apoyo a su familia y cubrir con los compromisos adquiridos. Cornelio tiene muy buena clientela en varias partes de la ciudad y lugares vecinos, tiene 4 hijos que cursan la primaria y secundaria.
Cornelio se siente muy satisfecho con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas medicamentos.
texts.en:
Sr. Cornelio Ramon R. is a private businessman who has been selling traditional medicines for more than ten years. He sells his products in the streets and also visits people's houses. The income he earns allows him to support his family and cover other commitments. Cornelio has a good customer base in various parts of the town and neighbouring areas. He has four children who attend primary or secondary school. He feels very satisfied with his business. The loan will be used to buy more medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is 40 years old and married with four children. He is a tailor and uses his income to educate his children and provide other basic needs. His business is located in Kenyatta open air market. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. He also does farming to earn extra income. He is a member of Faulu Kenya under a group of young entrepreneurs whose aim is to guarantee each other's loans. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy fabric. He hopes to expand his business and employ more people in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Rosalia Tagab Group

texts.en:
Rosalia T. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 68 years old. Rosalia is the group leader of a 2-member group taking out a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalia raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her livestock business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est membre de Bancc Villageois depuis 2005, elle a une ancienneté de 4 ans et demi dans ledit Banc Villageois et a 09 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide ; elle achète  des gousses d’arachide, les décortique, les grille au feu de bois et les transforme en suite en pate. Tous les mardis elle se rend au marché hebdomadaire d’un village distant d’une dizaine de kilomètres du sien pour vendre son produit. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital d’investissement pour mieux mener son activité. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 24-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since 2005. She has 4½ years of seniority in the aforementioned Banc Villageois and has received nine consecutive loans. Aïssatou makes peanut butter and sells it. She buys the peanuts, shells them, roasts them over a wood fire, and then processes them into a paste. Each Tuesday, she goes to the weekly market of a village about ten kilometers away from hers in order to sell her product. Her new loan will allow her to bolster her investment capital for running her business better. Her goal is to help improve her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Nery Paulino

texts.es: Nery es de 25 años de edad, es soltero, se dedica a prestar sus servicios para una ONG, en ASDIR solicita su segundo préstamo para comprar una computadora que le servirá para su trabajo y sus estudios, el crédito anterior lo pago sin problema de atraso, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Nery is a single 25-year old who works for a NGO. This will be his second loan with ASDIR, and he will use the loan to purchase a computer to use for work and for his studies. He repaid his previous loan with no late payments, and his personal references show that he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn R. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old and is single with one infant child. Juvelyn owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In 2010, Juvelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Juvelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie G. is from the village of Tipolo Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products like shampoo, soap and toothpaste, milk, milo, Nescafe, biscuits, rice, soft drinks in the local community. Tessie has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family. 

---------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Analou runs a general store. from which she sells a variety of different products to residents of the local community. Analou has been engaged in her business for over two years. She says one of the reasons she works hard is for her to be able to save for her children's education.

Analou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and the ability to better engage in business activities. Analou is requesting her first loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, which she plans to use to buy additional products to sell.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of taking this loan to supplement her family's income and improve their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Haydee is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Haydee owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Haydee works hard to give her children bright futures.

Haydee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Haydee is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Haydee from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión se encuentra formada por un grupo de 10 mujeres quienes  luchan  día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y entregar a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Viven en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, la actividad económica de este sector es la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población sale a la ciudad  en busca de mejores trabajos para así mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora Carmen vive en el barrio Tres de Noviembre en la parroquia de Cumbe. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga del barrio que pertenece a la banca comunal. Tiene 35 años,  es casada y tiene  2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad. Su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo  en una escuela de la parroquia. Su esposo en busca de un mejor futuro para sus hijos ha migrado  y con su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Tiene una casa pequeña que es de su propiedad pero vive en la casa de su mamá en donde comparten gastos.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la cría de animales, los cuyes y gallinas las que vende en su parroquia, tiene ganado y la leche es para entregar a los carros lecheros, se dedica esta labor hace 15 años, también se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar  y al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales, su meta es  crecer en su negocio.

La Señora María Filomena vive por el barrio la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 39, 37, 25, 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos son casados y tres de ellos viven de manera independiente, solo su ultima hija vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil, gracias al trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María toda su vida se ha dedicado a la cría de animales como ganado, aves de corral y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También labora en la agricultura, siembra maíz, hortalizas los que en su mayor parte es para el consumo de su hogar.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue  invitada por sus amigas del barrio que forman parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras,  su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir en este negocio ya esa es su meta.
texts.en:
The Nueva Illusion ["New Hope"] community bank is a group of 10 women who fight day to day to improve their household incomes and offer their children a better future. They live in the Cumbe parish, a parish with a cold climate whose main economic activities are agriculture and ranching. The majority of the population leaves for the city in search of better work to improve their household income. Carmen lives in the Tres de Noviembre neighbourhood in the Cumbe parish. This is her first loan with the Fundacion. She was invited by a friend in the neighbourhood who belongs to the community bank. She is 35, married and has 2 children ages 13 and 11. Her oldest child studies in a school in the city, and her second child goes to a school in the parish. Her husband migrated, looking for a better future for his children, and he helps the family with his work. She has a small home of her own, but she lives in her mother's home where they share costs. Carmen raises animals; guinea pigs and hens that she sells in her parish. She has cattle, and she provides the milk to milk trucks. She has been doing this work for 15 years. She also does the household chores and cares for her children. Her loan is to be invested in the purchase of food for her animals. Her goal is to grow her business. Maria Filomena lives in the Floresta neighbourhood in the Cume parish. She is 59, married and has 4 children ages 39, 37, 25 and 20. All of her children are married and three of them live independently. Only her youngest daughter lives with her, and they share the household costs. Her husband works as a bricklayer's assistant, and thanks to his work they have been able to build their own home. All of her life, Maria has raised animals such as livestock, barnyard fowl and guinea pigs, which she sells when she has financial needs. She also works in agriculture. She grows corn and vegetables, the majority of which are for her household consumption. This is her first loan in the community bank, and she was invited by her friends in the neighbourhood who are part of this hard-working women's group. She will invest this, her first loan, in the purchase of chickens to continue with this business, which is her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase food for animals and chickens

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria A. is a single woman who lives in Balirong, Naga City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating food vending, BBQ and bakery businesses. Macaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Macaria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her current businesses as well as enough capital to a open a new business so she can continue to save up for her family's future security. Macaria A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Rugiatu.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 6, 10, 14 years. She has no additional dependents.  In 1995, Rugiatu established her pans and plastic utensil business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 600,000SLL every month from this business. Rugiatu has a very good credit history.She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastic utensil for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 800,000SLL.Rugiatu intends to use the proceeds from this business to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Eulalia es una D. los miembros del Grupo L. Familia renacer 3 y 4, compuesto por 10 micro-empresarias, todos están dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta D. alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por elL., su esposo y 3 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es poder terminar L. parte delantera D. su casa, L. cual empezó a construir y aun no ha podido terminar. Le encanta cantar y bailar en sus tiempos libres y también jugar juegos D. mesas en su casa con sus amigas.

Eulalia está muy emocionada D. recibir su quinto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 5 años, el cual inició con un dinero que le dio su esposo para que iniciara a negociar. Eulalia está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en su negocio, en el cual venD. ropas D. segunda mano D. muy buena calidad y comprara 3 paquetes D. estas para revenderlas por piezas. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para comprar una nevera, ahorrar y reparar su casa, su sueño es poder tener una tienda D. ropa bien establecido. Vive en L. ciudad D. S., siendo esta L. segunda mas granD. del país, cuya economía depenD. D. L. agricultura, ganadería y D. L. producción D. tabaco entre otras; también cuenta con una amplia población D. dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos que viven en comunidades D. muy escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Eulalia is one of the members of the “L. Familia Renacer 3 y 4” (To Be Reborn Family 3 & 4) group which has 10 micro businesswomen.  They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc.  Eulalia’s family is maD. up of herself, her husband and three children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is finishing the front part of her house which she started building but hasn’t been able to finish yet.  She loves to sing and dance in her free time and also to play board games at home with her girl friends.

Eulalia is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza Internacional having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth.

She has had her business for about 5 years; she started it with a little money her husband gave her to start.  She is planning on investing the new loan in her business, which is good quality used clothing sales.  She will buy three bundles of clothes to resell by the piece.

She will use profits to buy a new refrigerator, for savings and to repair her house.  Her dream is to have an established clothing store.

She lives in the city of S. which is the country’s second largest.  Its economy depends on agriculture, cattle-raising and tobacco farming, among others.  It also has a sizeable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities of very limited resources.

loans.use: To buy several bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix tiene 59 años. Esta casado con doña Josefina Sotelo quien es ama de casa. Ellos tienen tres hijos mayores de edad.
 Don Félix es propietario de un camión en el cual realiza trabajos de taxi carga o flete. 
Se dedica a esta actividad desde el año 1982. 
Inicialmente trabajaba como chofer para otros taxi cargas, hasta que con ahorros y esfuerzo logró comprar para su camión y otro tiempo después también logró adquirir la para que actualmente ocupa en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.  
 Necesita de este crédito para realizar un mantenimiento general a su camión, pues este constituye su herramienta principal de trabajo. 
 Don Félix desea servir siempre de ejemplo a sus hijos y nietos, mostrándolas  el valor del trabajo. 
También poder heredar a estos su camión y parada para que puedan generar sus ingresos de forma independiente como el siempre lo hizo.
texts.en:
Felix is 59 years old.  He is married to Josefina Sotelo who is a housewife.  They have three adult children.  
Felix owns a pick-up truck and has been providing cargo and package delivery services since 1982.  
Initially, he worked as a driver for other cargo and package delivery service providers.  Then, by working hard and saving his money, he was able to buy a truck. Later, he was also able to acquire the taxi stand he currently occupies in the city of San Lorenzo.
He needs this loan for general maintenance on his truck because this is his primary tool for operating his business.
Felix wants to always be an example to his children and grandchildren, showing them the value of work.
Also, he wants to be able to pass his truck and taxi stand on to his children so that they can generate income independently the same way he has always done.

loans.use: Truck maintenance

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
ZOILA ISABEL G. M..
La señora Zoila Isabel G. M. inicio su negocio desde hace 20 años, solicita un refinanciamiento de crédito, para volver a invertir en la compra de cerdos para la temporada navideña que hay muchas personas que preparan comidas navideñas como por ejemplo  tamales  de cerdo, piernas de cerdo muchos más, como ya tiene de nuevo pedidos carne  que muchas señoras venden para el tiempo navideño  y también necesita el crédito para la compra de algunos adornos navideños para poder vender en su casa, y así mismo poder generar más ganancia. Su meta ahora es poder compra mas cerdos para poder engórdalos y poder venderlos en  la Feria Patronal del Pueblo donde vive, y así mismo no invertir mucho en compra de la misma.
texts.en: Zoila Isabel G. M. has been in her business for 20 years.  She is requesting a loan renewal so that she can invest in buying pigs for the Christmas period.  She needs this investment as there are a lot of people who are preparing Christmas meals such as, for example, pork tamales, legs of pork, etc.  She already has orders for meat that a lot of women sell during the Christmas period.  She also needs the loan to buy some Christmas decorations that she can sell in her home and thereby make more profits.  Her goal right now is to be able to buy more pigs so that she can fatten them and then sell them in the local town market.

loans.use: To buy pigs and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Margarita Agustina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Margarita tiene 70 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda pero de esa relación tuvo nueve hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero seis de ellos aun viven con  ella.

Ella junto a uno de sus hijos  se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y frutas en el mercado de Tarqui en  Manta. Trabaja  los tres últimos días de la semana desde las 04h00 hasta las 15h00 o hasta que haya terminado lo que llevo a vender. En la actualidad piensa poner un negocio de venta de juguetes para aprovechar la temporada navideña ya que la mayoría de las personas compran estos artículos para sus hijos.
  
Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas, legumbres y juguetes para aprovechar la temporada. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 16 ciclos. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en su casa para no tener que viajar más y que le vaya bien en sus nuevas ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank, 3 de Mayo, meets every 2 weeks in the Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a well-known commercial area that is also famous for its traditional fiestas of San Pedro, San Pablo, and for the warmth of its people.

Margarita is 70 and a few years ago she was widowed.  She has nine children, all adults, but six still live with her.

She and one of her children sell vegetables, legumes and fruit in the Tarqui en Manta market the last three days of the week from 4 am until 3 pm, or until they have sold everything they brought.  Now she would like to set up a business to take advantage of the Xmas season selling toys since most people buy them for their children.

She will use this new loan to buy fruit, legumes and toys for the season.  She has been with this communal bank for 16 cycles.  Her dream is to have a big store in her house so that she doesn’t have to travel any more and that things would go well with her new sales.

loans.use: To buy fruit, legumes and toys

loans.name: Débora Herminia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
p>
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Débora, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y el último de 9 años, dos de ellos estudian en Universidad y en escuela, todos viven en su casa. El marido es oficial de un bus de la cooperativa de Montecristi.
 
Trabaja en una empresa en Manta pero además se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las noches, además sus hijas le ayudan con las ventas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que empezó su negocio hace un año con el crédito que recibió de la Fundación Espoir y que le ha ido muy bien ya que ha obtenido un ingreso nuevo que le ayuda mucho con los gastos del hogar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un local para poner una librería.
texts.en: The Por Un Nuevo Amanecer (For A New Dawn) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. It is also famous for making Panama hats. It's here we find Débora, a 42-year-old mother of four children who lives with her common-law husband. Three of her children are adults, while the youngest is 9. All four live with her, and two are attending the university and in school. Her husband is an official for a bus cooperative in Montecrisit. Débora works for a company in the city of Manta, but she also makes a living selling Avon beauty products (cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day in the evenings, and her daughters also help her with the sales. She takes the products on credit, which she pays off every week. She tells us she started the business a year ago with a loan she received from Kiva partner Fundación Espoir and that it has gone very well because she has earned a new source of income that has helped a lot with household expenses. With this loan she plans to purchase perfumes, lotions and cosmetics. This is her third loan with the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a store where she can start a bookshop.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ryan Vennyl

texts.en:
Ryan Vennyl G. is from the city of Baybay Ozamiz City. He is 32 years old. Ryan Vennyl is married. To make a living, Ryan Vennyl owns & operates a business primarily operating a motor transport services. Ryan Vennyl has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ryan Vennyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ryan Vennyl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Ryan Vennyl is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ryan Vennyl from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Luon's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people located in Lekh Buon village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Luon V., a 39-year-old married woman, was selected by the other members as group leader. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows crops. Her husband, Mr. Nuth Baraing, is employed in a garment factory, earning a small salary to support his family. The family doesn't have water for their use. Therefore, Mrs. Luon V. is asking for a loan to dig a well. This couple works hard at their jobs to support their two children, students who also help their mother with the farming.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita B. is from the town of Surallah. She is 61 years old. Jelita is married and has 11 children. Jelita and her husband work hard to sustain their family. They both till land to plant and harvest rice crops. They also grow chickens in their backyard. Jelita hopes to have their own poultry business. She says it would help her family a lot.

Jelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Jelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Maquinto

texts.en: Maquinto T. is in her fourth loan cycle and has been able to pay back her loans with no problems. She is  a good member who has been doing her business for many years. She is engaged in food vending, making Puto Conchenta, and other kakanin (Filipino rice snacks). She has a lot of customers because of the good taste of her product. All her children are in school. Her loan will be use to purchase equipment and as additional capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita O. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Benita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2011, Benita joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARÍA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Violeta; la socia tiene 55 años de edad casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores; la socia se dedica al cuidado de su hogar ella es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta con muchas ganas de seguir adelante al cuidado de su familia y de sus hijos aunque estos ya sean profesionales, la socia siempre está al pendiente de ellos, a la vez la socia alquila habitaciones que tiene disponible en su casa siendo así que también la socia vive de sus rentas, la socia es una persona bien responsable con las ganas de seguir para adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para arreglar el piso de una de sus habitaciones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Nancy Violeta, 55, is a member of the “MARÍA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has three adult children.  She is a housewife and she is quite a cheerful and enthusiastic person with a strong drive to get ahead caring for her family and children. Even though they are already professionals, she is always watchful of them.

At the same time, she rents rooms that she has available in her house and she lives off this income.  She is a very responsible person with the desire to continue forward.

She is asking for a loan to repair the floor in one of her rooms.  She is happy with the loan and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to repair the floor in one of her rooms.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Nilda runs a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. 

Nilda earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC.

Nilda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will  purchase a variety of products such as shampoo, can goods etc. . This will be the second loan taken out by Nilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as shampoo, can goods etc.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Zuena M., is in her early thirties and a single mother with three children.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years now.  She works from 8.00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zuena's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipments and has paid back her loan succeesfully.  She is asking for a loan to to buy a bit stock of salon equipments.  Her dream is to one day be able to take care of her children and manage to send them to good schools.

Zuena will share this loan with her loan group "Hakika" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Zuena is in a red and white dress at the back row.

loans.use: To buy a stock of salon equipment.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagros pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza” D. Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia  y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada y tiene 2 hijos.

Motivada por una amiga, se inicia en la venta de productos de belleza con un capital de S / 500.00 nuevos soles, actividad que en la actualidad le da la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos y aportar así a la economía D. hogar, y como mujer sentirse realizada.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 soles comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Milagros se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Milagros belongs to the Luz y Esperanza (Light and Hope) Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín.  She is married and has two children.  With S/500.00 nuevos soles in capital and motivated by her friend, she began selling beauty products.  Currently, this business gives her the opportunity to generate her own income and contribute to the household budget, as well as feel fulfilled as a woman.

With this loan of S/1700.00 soles, she will buy beauty products for stock such as ladies’ and gentlemen’s perfumes, creams, and powder compacts; talcum powder for both adults and babies; lipstick and nail polish.  In addition, she will purchase another showcase to display her products.  

Milagros is very happy and wishes to continue working toward the implementation of her ideas. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself to have opportunities to develop themselves in the communities where they operate.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfume, creams, powder compacts, taclum powder, etc.

loans.name: Kola Ngo Mudu Group

texts.en:
59-year-old Justine, who operates her pharmacy business from Mukono, says she expects a favorable return in her business operations once she gets this Kiva loan. This good-humored single mother of 3 says she set forth in her business 15 years ago. Justine is a lady with enterprise and initiative. She has always been confident of success. 15 years in this business has solidified and widened her insight and understanding of her type of business. 
The fact that she is nurse has also been playing very much in her favor.

Justine plies her trade from a neighborhood in Mukono where there are few pharmacies. The fact that she cares to get the right drugs and restock her pharmacy often has given her strong leverage in the market.  She says her monthly profits are approximately 350,000 shillings. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Makhmasharif

texts.en:
Makhmasharif is married and the father of five children. He is a hard-working man. He has been running his business selling foods for seven years. He sells eggs, cakes, sweets and other daily products. Makhmasharif purchases his goods from the firms “Shirinohoi sharki” and “Shirin” from Khujand city 2-3 times a week. His son helps him in this business. 

Makhmasharif would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase a new assortment of foods in order to expand his business and increase his working capital. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of foods.

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe SIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 8ans et le moins âgé a 4ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales depuis 3ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (TITA, TOE, LEO).Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de maïs; un demi sac de petit mil; un demi sac d’arachide; et un demi sac d’haricot.

Elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales et économise un peu. Ses ambitions sont d’agrandir son commerce (prendre des tonnes de céréales) et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Pauline represents the group SIDA. She is married and the mother of two children. The eldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 4. One of them goes to school. 

Pauline has two persons to support. She has been selling grains for three years. She gets her supplies from surrounding villages (TITA, TOE, LEO). Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy a sack of corn and a half-sack each of: pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. She helps out her husband with family expenses and saves a bit of money. Her ambitions include expanding her business (grains by the tonne) and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, a half-sack of pearl millet, a half-sack of peanuts, and a half-sack of beans

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 50 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult dependents.

Virgincita sells dried fish to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earn a total average of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 at GDMPC to purchase dried fish to sell. Virgincita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Virgincita hopes to expand her dried fish business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer from Eldoret in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for 15 years. His mixed farm produces potatoes, maize, vegetables, and milk, which are all sold locally. Farming has been his main source of income. He is age 50 and married. He has eight children between the ages of 10 and 27 who all attend school.

John has made a loan request of 62,400 Kenyan shillings (KES) in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to venture into other businesses. His primary challenge has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. He hopes that in the near future his milk production will have increased and he will be the leading supplier of milk to the local market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Badenyaton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BADENYATON 1 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Farabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage et pouvoir faire recours à de la main d’œuvre,  elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe BADENYATON 1 vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Tenin Dibi (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréales et se faire aider dans les activités de labour et de désherbage par la main d’œuvre masculine. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 4 hectares, elle espère produire : 30 sacs de mil, 10 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil et de niébé sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Madame Tenin Dibi à l’instar  des autres femmes du groupe a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten women making up the Badenyaton 1 group are married, with the majority of them living in large traditional families, and they average 40 years of age with four children each. They all live in the village of Farabougou in Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and met through relatives, marriage and neighbors. With the aim of obtaining agricultural inputs at the beginning of the rainy season and being able to pay for manpower, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second farming loan.

The members of the Badenyaton 1 group are going to grow groundnut, millet and "niébé" (a type of black bean). 

Tenin Dibi (who is the lady sitting on the extreme right of the photo) is planning to use her loan to buy two sacks of urea, two sacks of complex cereal and to get additional manpower to help with the labor and weeding. She gets her supplies of agricultural inputs at the fair in Ségou and the manpower from among the village youths. With four hectars of land she is hoping to produce: 30 sacks of millet, 10 sacks of niébé beans and their haulms. Part of the millet and niébé beans produced, as well as the latter's haulms, will be sold in order for her to cover her daily household expenses, while the balance will be consumed by the family. The aim of Tenin Dibi and the other women in the group is to be able to fully provide for all the food in the village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and employ laborers

loans.name: Cristina Berenisse

texts.es:
Cristina es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su familia, administra una farmacia, lleva dos años trabajado para la farmacia, y actualmente necesita cancelar una deuda, con el préstamo podrá quedar solvente y pagar menos intereses.
Este es un gasto personal, pero que le ayudara muchísimo en sus finanzas, pues esta deuda la obtuvo su madre comprando materiales para una panadería que administra, su objetivo es ayudarla e iniciar un historial con esta institución.
texts.en:
Cristina is single, has no children, and lives with her family. She runs a pharmacy. She has worked for the pharmacy for two years, and currently needs to cancel a debt. With this loan she will be able to remain solvent and pay less interest.
This is a personal cost, but it will help her greatly with her finances. Her mother acquired this debt in purchasing materials for a bakery that she runs. Cristina's goal is to help her mother and start a history with this institution.

loans.use: to pay off a payment on materials for her mother's bakery.

loans.name: Douglas José

texts.es: Este cliente es asalariado se desempeña como técnico operador de equipos pesado en una fábrica de cemento, padre de tres hijos dos en edades escolares, casado solicita crédito para hace algunas mejoras de su casa, los créditos solicitados han sido para mejora de vivienda, en total ha cancelado cinco créditos y dice estar agradecido con estas instituciones de finanzas.
texts.en:
This client is a salaried employee who works as a heavy equipment operator at a cement factory. He is married and the father of three children, two of whom are of school age.

He is requesting a loan to make a few improvements to his house. All of the loans he has requested have been for home improvements. In total, he has repaid five loans and says that he is grateful for these types of financial institutions.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a married mother of two children. She earns a living running a general store.

Thuy would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries for selling

loans.name: Bathie

texts.fr: Il est un commercent dans une commune du Sénégal, commerçant de profession Il a une boutique ou il vent des assiettes qu'il gére depuis plus de 20 ans. Avec cette expérience dans le commerce, il veut augmenté sa cantine et d'acheter d'autres marchandises pour alimenter son stock. Le prêt a pour objectif le renforcement de sa boutique en marchandiseset de lui permettre d'avoir un fond de roulement qui va l'aider à satisfaire la demande
texts.en: Bathie is an experienced trader who lives in a district of Senegal. He has been running his own small market store, selling crockery and cookware, for over 20 years. This loan will increase his working capital and enable him to satisfy customer demand by restocking on merchandise, as well as helping him towards achieving his goal of building larger business premises.

loans.use: to restock his store.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is married and has 2 children. She is a fish monger in Elmina. In the photo, Marian is standing close to the traditional oven she uses to smoke the fish. Her husband is a mason. Marian helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children. Marian will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Jeremias 2 Group

texts.en:
Natividad is the coordinator of her group, Jeremías 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. 

She enjoys marketing and the sales; that's why she took a loan and started selling natural medicines and products. A friend invited her to sell these natural products. She says, "With this second loan, my business will increase more, because with just six months doing this business I have done very well."

Natividad will use the profits to reinvest in her business, because she wants to improve it more and save. 

Her most difficult challenge is that her husband can live according to the Christian life. She is dreaming of having a successful business, a new and beautiful house and providing what her family needs especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Les Ver Miguel

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, El señor Lesver Miguel es médico general y labora en un hospital atendiendo a muchos pacientes todos los días siendo un excelente médico que se ha ganado el aprecio y respeto de muchas personas en el hospital.

Acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra directa de medicamentos para los clientes. Es importante destacar que dichos medicamentos son entregados favorablemente a los clientes por lo que le es de mucha necesidad obtenerlos y así seguir beneficiando a otras personas en su consultorio.
texts.en:
In León department, Lesver Miguel is a general practitioner who works in a hospital, treating many patients every day.  He is an excellent doctor who has earned the esteem and respect of many people in the hospital.

Lesver Miguel came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan for the direct purchase of medicines for his customers.  It is important to emphasize that these medicines are given favorably to his customers and so he really needs to obtain them in order to continue benefiting others in his office.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Nydia Sofia

texts.es: Nydia, de oficio sastre, vive en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, madre de familia,lleva alrededor de 10 años trabajando en esta actividad de manera indepeniente,este negocio lo aprendio gracias a un curso de costura que ella estudio despues de terminar su secundadria aprendio a elaborar de todo tipo de trajes pero se especializo en la confeccion de  vestidos para niñas porque segun sus clientas son los mejores diseños que ella hace, tambien  elaborar bolsos de tela , hace almohadas pero su especialidad son los vestidos para niñas.Ella realizo el credito para comprar tela , reglas , tijeras, hilos y repuestos para su maquina de coser. Esta inversion le ayudara adquirir tela a un buen precio y darle un buen mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser. Uno de sus proyectos es poner uns linea de vestidos para niñas y distribuirla fuera de Granada.
texts.en:
Nydia, a seamstress, lives in the city of Granada.  She is 40 years old, married, and has children.  She has been working independently at this business activity for around ten years.  She learned this business thanks to a sewing course that she took after she finished high school.  

She learned to make all types of clothing, but she specializes in making girls’ clothing.  According to her customers, those are the best designs that she makes. She also makes fabric bags and pillows.

She requested the loan to buy fabric, rulers, scissors, thread, and replacement parts for her sewing machine.  This investment will help her get fabric at a good price, and to perform good maintenance on her sewing machines.

One of her projects is to establish a line of clothing for girls and to distribute it outside of Granada.

loans.use: to buy fabric, rulers, scissors, thread, and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 58 лет, вдова, имеет одного сына. Сын живет вместе с матерью, помогает ей по хозяйству. Рыскан на протяжении 26 лет занимается животноводством, разведением  и откормом скота. Начав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Рыскан приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса. На сегодняшний день , в ее хозяйстве насчитывается одна корова,  два теленка, один жеребенок, кормовая база в виде 20 тележек сена, 500 снопов кукурузы  и 1,0 тонны  кукурузы, также имеется скот на осеннем пастбище. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец – молодняка. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует направить на реконструкцию сарая, чтобы улучшить условия содержания скота.
texts.en: Ryskan is a widow and has one son.  Her son lives together with her and helps her with the business.  Ryskan has been involved in animal husbandry, breeding and fattening up livestock for 26 years.  Having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), she put all of her efforts toward growing her business.  Today, her business has one cow, two calves, one foal, a feeding base of 20 carts of hay, 500 corn sheaves, and 1 ton of corn, and also has livestock at the autumn pasture.  In order to further grow her business, Ryskan requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase calves and lambs.  She plans to use the earning from this loan to rebuild a barn in order to improve conditions for keeping livestock.

loans.use: to purchase calves and lambs

loans.name: Luz Veronica

texts.es:
Luz Verónica tiene  19 años de edad  es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Luz se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (cerdos, ovejas). Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudaría a cambiar la situación en el estudio. El sueño es poder viajar a otra provincia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es en los cultivos por falta de dinero para comprar los fertilizantes.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y estudiar o a veces ir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
Luz Verónica is 19 years of age.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.
She is a member of the VRC PANGUA, which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu, Parish Guanujo Canton Guaranda.  The community is 15 minutes from the Office.  The majority of the members of the Pangua group are dedicated to Agriculture and stockbreeding and also to other activities where they obtain greater economic income such as commerce and construction.  Luz is dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She requests the loan to buy animals (hogs, sheep).  With the aid of the loan she will be able to change the situation with her studies.  Her dream is to be able to travel to another province.  The challenges that she faces are with her cultivations for lack of money to buy  fertilizers.  In her free time she likes to rest and to study or at times to go for a walk with her parents.

loans.use: to buy animals (hogs and sheep).

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mr. Soun, 55, is a local farmer as well as a fisherman from Baray district. His spouse is shown in the photo instead because he was unavailable on the day. As usual, Mr. Soun and his wife grow rice crops twice a year because they can get enough water from the nearby river. It is now time to harvest his rainy-season rice crops and start again with his dry-season one. This loan will enable Mr. Soun to start growing his dry-season rice. He’ll use it to buy rice seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer to put on his land. He hopes to improve his living condition. He is very happy and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sorayda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sorayda es una joven mujer de 29 años; es madre soltera de un niño de 11 años a quien ha criado sola. Juntos viven en Latacunga que es una ciudad situada en el centro de Ecuador, constituye un punto de enlace entre la Costa, los Andes y la Amazonia. Posee un clima templado, a veces ventoso y frío. Desde allí se puede llegar a toda la provincia que ofrece a sus visitantes la belleza de sus lagunas, aire puro y una hermosa vegetación. 

Sorayda a pesar de ser maestra graduada en "belleza" no ejerce su profesión y en cambio tiene un puesto de venta de cañas y jugo de caña; la caña es un tallo de donde se fabrica el azúcar. En Ecuador es consumido en su estado natural y su jugo es muy apetecido por su sabor. Aprendió este oficio de su madre y trabaja 8 horas al día cerca de un terminal terrestre de buses. Ella desea invertir comprando un lote de caña y de esta manera obtener un mejor precio y por ende mejores ganancias.

Ella se preocupa por el futuro de su hijo y cada día lucha y trabaja muy duro. Para que nunca le falte nada...
texts.en:
Sorayda is a 29-year-old woman; she’s a single mother of an 11-year-old son who she has raised alone.  They live together in Latacunga which is a city located in central Ecuador and is a meeting point between the coast, the Andes and Amazonia.  It has a temperate climate which is sometimes windy and cold.  From there one can reach the entire province which offers visitors the beauty of its lagoons, pure air and beautiful vegetation.

Even though Sorayda is a graduate in “beauty” she does not practice her profession but rather has a stand where she sells sugar cane and sugar cane juice; sugar cane is a stalk that sugar is made from and in Ecuador it’s consumed in its natural state and its juice is very much enjoyed for its flavor.  She learned this occupation from her mother and works 8 hours a day near a bus terminal.  

She wants to invest buying an entire lot of sugar cane to get a better price and as a result better profits.  She’s concerned for her son’s future so she works hard every day so that he’ll never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane.

loans.name: Eva Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Eva Paulina  es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típicas para mujeres, lleva 4 años de experiencia en este negocio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercaderías: blusas, cortes, delantales, suéteres, ya que quiere surtir su negocio y ampliarlo, espera en el futuro tener un negocio.
texts.en:
Eva Paulina is 21 and single. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She sells traditional clothing for women. She has four years experience in this business. 

She has decided to apply for a loan to purchase more merchandise, such as blouses, skirts, aprons, and sweaters. She wants to supply her business and expand it. In the future she hopes to continue having a business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia is married and has an adult son and daughter. Constancia lives in the village of San Antonio. This is largely an agricultural region of Isabela, where many people are involved in growing crops. Constancia has been involved in growing crops for 20 years. Constancia needs a loan in the sum of P 20,000 to purchase fertilizer and seed. Constancia has enough land and it is comfortable to work there. In the future, Constancia wants to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: T_F_Aedomoru_Martinaemongiro Group

texts.en:
Martina is 41 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Martina is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Martina started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since.

This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Martina’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy cows to supply his butcher shop. Esau still operates a butcher shop alongside farming to earn extra income. With the proceeds, He has been able to improve the standards of living of his family and pay school fees for his children. Esau experiences hardships due to the market's price fluctuations and droughts that affect the quality of animals supplied. However, he hopes to expand his business, educate his children, build a permanent residential house and become rich.
He is requesting a loan to buy cows to slaughter for selling in his butcher shop ahead of this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter for selling in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
My name is Maria Socorro and I sell corn, beans and firewood. I have been working for four years in this business, which I began with my own money. In the rainy season, people look for me so they can buy firewood, because in this area, we do not have electricity. I know that with the help (loan), I will be able to better my family’s earnings.

Loan Use: Buying beans, corn and firewood.

Mi nombre es Maria Socorro y me dedico ala venta de maiz, frijoles y leña. Tengo 4 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, la que inicie con mi propio capital de trabajo. En los meses de lluvia las personas me buscan para comprar leña, ya que esta zona no tenemos luz electrica. Se que con el apoyo que me brinden podre mejorar mi ingreso familiar.

loans.use: Compra de frijoles, maiz y Leña.

loans.name: Nagi

texts.en: Nagi was born in 1949 in Yardimli region of Azerbaijan. He has been working in the joiner's shop since 1982. This old man is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. He has 3 children. He is hard worker. Now he wants to buy the lathe, boring mill and additional materials: mahogany and etc. He applies for the loan $600 from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy the lathe, boring mill and additional materials: mahogany and etc.

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Nop Y. is 58 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her three children and five grandchildren.  Y.’s husband recently passed away, making the family’s economic situation even more difficult.  Y. runs a shop where she purchases clothes, then resells them at a higher price at the market.  She can usually make about $1.50 profit on the average day.  Two of her three children are garment workers at a nearby factory and all of her five grandchildren are students, which leaves the family with a very large tuition bill.  Y. hopes to use this loan to expand her clothing business by buying more clothes to sell at her shop.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothes

loans.name: Shorku

texts.en: Shorku is 44 years old and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is single. She has been farming her own plot of land for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of $375 to buy fertilizer to improve the yield of her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
My husband has been working as a wholesale dealer of toiletries with a big company for many years. He now wants to start his own wholesale business, as this will bring in more money for our family. He has a lot of contacts and potential clients and is confident that his business will do well. We have an eight-month-old daughter whom we want to educate. If my husband can set up his business before our daughter reaches school-going age, we will be financially stable enough to provide for all her needs. We need this loan to set up our business.

Mehnaz B., Pakistan

loans.use: To start a wholesale business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is a Muganda by tribe and a craft maker. She is one of the active members of Life in Africa Foundation. She does many handicrafts like table cloths, wall hangings, etc. She is one of the first Kiva borrowers who took a loan of 800.000/= to buy materials for crafts. Joyce is doing well and from the profits she made, there was no problem with her repayment.

Joyce is now hoping to sell to visitors at the Heads of Commonwealth meeting to be held on the 23 Novermber in Uganda where over 5000 delegates are expected to attend. She is a member of the American Club where most African crafts are sold and has high expectations of excellent sales.

According to Joyce's calculations, this Heads of Government meeting might triple normal sales and so she does not want to run out of stock during this money-making period. Any stock left over will be sold at the regular market.

To make this expansion possible, Joyce is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) and she feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 4 months.

Below is her budget:

Table cloth/materials etc. ..............................................150,000/=

4 rolls of thread.................................................................................80,000/=

Backcloth for wall hangings............................................................20,000/=

Total ....................................................................................................250,000/=

loans.use: Restocking a craft shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a native of the Parco zone in Jauja, since childhood she’s been tied to agricultural activities and now that her parents are older this allows her the possibility to watch over them and satisfy each one of their needs. For personal reasons she has decided not to marry and instead treasure a fruitful life of all the different business ideas she hopes to accomplish. She recently undertook to raising and selling of small farm animals such as guinea pigs and chickens as a formal business. Julia is very charismatic and warm, her personality making her beloved by everyone around her. She believes her place in this world is to help those that need her, always do good, and help your neighbors; all this has made her a leader in her zone. Julia has become the only support of her aging parents and she wishes to give them a successful farm in retribution for all they did for her as a child. Her ambition to keep on succeeding have led her to slowly grow every one of her little businesses in order to commercialize her products and small farm animals at the market in her zone. She asks for this loan to use as investment capital to improve the farm conditions for her animals and buy more fertilizer and seeds for her fields. Let us help a noble heart full of hope to realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es natural de la zona de Parco en Jauja, desde muy pequeña estuvo ligada a las actividades agrícolas y ahora que sus padres están muy ancianos esta actividad le otorga la posibilidad de velar por ellos y satisfacer cada una de sus necesidades. Por razones personales ella ha decidido no casarse y atesorar una vida llena de experiencias fructíferas en los diferentes negocios que tiene en mente realizar.Hace poco ha emprendido el negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores tales como el cuy y los pollos de manera más formal. Julia es una persona muy carismática y acogedora, su manera de ser hace que sea bien querida por todos los que la rodean y siempre dice que su función aquí es poder ayudar a quienes la necesitan y siempre hace el bien y contribuye con sus vecinos; es por ello que es toda un líder por su zona.Julia ahora se ha convertido en el único sostén de sus padres ya ancianos y quiere darles una decorosa estancia en este mundo en retribución a lo que ellos dieron cuando ella era niña.
