Los deseos enormes de seguir progresando la han llevado a incrementar cada uno de sus pequeños negocios para comercializar sus productos y animalitos en la feria de su zona.Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlos como capital de inversión y mejorar la granja de sus animalitos adicionalmente comprar mayor cantidad de abonos y semillas para los campos que cultiva.Apoyemos a un noble corazón lleno de esperanza a concretar sus nobles ideales.

loans.use: To repair the chicken coop and buy larger quanities and varieties of seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest.

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati is 37 years old and has a small grocery store where she sells household necessities such as cooking oil, rice, eggs, etc. Her husband, H., has no fixed income. Ati usually earns about US$ 1.50 per day in profit.  She is a member of MBK and needs a loan to buy more inventory for her store. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Francisca Eufemia

texts.es:
Francisca Eufemia S. Navarette is a woman is dedicated to her business in beef meat sales, and has been running the business for the last 17 years. She tells us that 17 years ago she was widowed and given this situation she started her business to be able to support her family.

With a great deal of difficulty she has been able to make her business a success and has been able to support her family. Her major need is to purchase beef meat for resale, and it is for this reason that she seeks the help Ceprodel that has given her credit since last year. She feels very satisfied with the credit that has been granted to her and always at the right time, helping her to fill her business' requirements and provide what her clients need every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca Eufemia S. N. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de carne de res, tiene 17 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta desde hace 17 años quedo viuda y por este motivo inicia este negocio para poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.

Con muchas dificultades ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio y ha podido mantener su núcleo familiar. Su mayor necesidad es la compra de la carne de res para su debida comercialización, por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace 1 año ha recibido créditos de manera que hoy en día se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudándole así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is 25 years old. Khalil is a single young man who lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Khalil sells home appliances. This is the second time that Khalil has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. The micro credits are helping him buy merchandise to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 49-year-old mother of 6 children. Her husband is a school teacher. She has operated her bakery for nearly 30 years. She has 1 assistant, who helps her prepare her bread. The proceeds of the loan will go toward buying additional supplies and toward a new electric oven. Her traditional oven, pictured here, is made of clay and is deteriorating.

One of Mary's children has just finished secondary school with top marks and is planning on attending medical school. To achieve this dream, Mary hopes to be able to set aside more savings from her business to help with the significant expenses.

Mary is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Mary is pictured on the right placing some loaves into her oven. On the left is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and to begin saving for an electric oven

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 38 years old and is married with three children, 16, 11and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, aged 31 and 22.

Mwanahamis is a clothes seller, a business she has been in since 2000. She works from 9am to 6pm daily and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Aného (Lacs prefecture), Akouavi B. attended school through the 9th grade. After earning her middle school diploma, and due to a lack of financial support, she couldn't continue. After finishing her training in sewing, she became an excellent seamstress. Single and without children, she has a nephew in her care. The meager income from her poorly-equipped dressmaking shop is not enough to cover expenses.

To meet the demands of her customers and to hold onto them, Ms. B. need to get better equipment. This is why she is requesting a loan for buying other sewing machines and cloth to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Then her income will increase in order to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1980 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mlle B. Akouavi a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de troisième. Après son BEPC, par manque de support financier elle n’a pas pu continuer. Après sa formation en couture, elle est devenue une excellente couturière. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a en charge un neveu. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges.

Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et la maintenir, Mlle B. Akouavi a besoin de mieux s’équiper. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and cloth

loans.name: Nikutusya K.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Nikutusya M.. She is married and has four children aged between 2 and 10. In 2005, Nikutusya established her rice-selling business. Working four days a week, and one to four hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. Nikutusya requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Selmira

texts.en:
Selmira is a young woman living in the village Soko, near Gračanica. She is 21 years old, married, with no children yet. Her husband works abroad in Croatia, and Selmira supports herself by working on her farm. This is her 1st loan request, in the amount of 600 KM (US$ 500) and she will use this to support her farming business.

Selmira grows a lot of corn and will be using it to make silage, which she will later use as feed for her animals. Silage is made from grains like corn and is produced in the summer so that livestock will have plenty of food to eat come winter. This process is time intensive and complicated, so Selmira may need to hire someone to help her, as well as paying for the use of machinery that will aid in the process. This loan from Kiva will help pay for that.

loans.use: To rent machinery needed to make silage from her corn

loans.name: Maria Elmira

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the “Corazones Valientes II” (brave hearts II) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Shilcayo. Her house is located in Mz B Lt 5 Las Margaritas. She sells food in a tent of the Banda del Shilcayo market, where she attends clients daily, such as locals or visitors to the market and even other merchants from the market.

With the loan of $275 USD (S/.800) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood to build her own tent, she will also buy ingredients to prepare dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, vegetables, grains, spices, etc.

At 43, Maria is an enthusiastic and energetic woman, she does well in the business, has a lot of clients thanks to the good service she provides, the type of food she prepares (only with a few spices, mostly fresh) and the variety of the dishes prepared daily. Her goal is to have her own and better location because she is currently renting.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Corazones Valientes II”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, su casa esta ubicado en el Jr: las margaritas Mz B Lt 5, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú en un kiosco del mercado de La Banda de Shilcayo, allí acuden diariamente sus comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitante que acuden al mercado y paraderos interprovinciales que se encuentran muy cerca de su kiosco.

Con el crédito de S/ 800.00 que pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará madera para construir su propio kiosco así como también comprará sus insumos para la preparación de los platos que a diario ofrece a sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, verduras, menestras, condimentos, etc.

Maria a sus 43 años, es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, le va muy bien en el negocio, no le falta clientes, ella refiere que es por el trato que da, el tipo de comida que ofrece (no muy condimentada, casi al natural) y la variedad de sus platos, que cada día prepara, su meta es tener su propio kiosco para implementarlo mejor, por que ahora esta vendiendo en un kiosco alquilado.

loans.use: Purchase construction material (wood) and purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is a villager in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder.  

She usually sells her pigs after four months when they are big enough to sell. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to purchase more pig food to feed them. 

Her husband, Mr. Hon Hai, is a construction worker who does not make enough income to support his family. Mrs. Srey S. is 34 years old and the mother of two children -- one is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy five piglets for breeding and more pig food.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha S. is 29 years old and lives with her 28-year-old husband in a small village outside of Phnom Penh and across the Mekong River.  She married her husband in 2000, and together they have raised one daughter who is currently in school.  Tha has worked as a silk weaver since 2001, after learning the trade from her sister-in-law, and her husband builds wooden houses and caters for weddings and other ceremonies in their village.  Tha sells the silk she weaves to a merchant, who then distributes the cloth in Phnom Penh.  In order to expand her business and purchase a motorcycle for her husband's construction business, Tha is requesting a loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase more silk weaving and to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.en:
Marisabel is a member of the Solidaridad ("Solidarity") Village Bank. She is 27 years old, lives with her husband, and does not yet have any children. She has a small store in her parents' house in the Asociación 16 de abril where she sells dry goods, vegetables, and meat. She works every day and her husband helps her out in his spare time. Marisabel wants to start selling anticuchos (beef heart kabobs) from her store as well.

Marisabel needs a loan of 800 soles to buy drinks and a grill for the anticuchos.

Marisabel's dreams are to expand her business, offer a wider variety of products, and have a child.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Marisabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.

Marisabel es conviviente, tiene 27 años y aun no tiene hijos, Marisabel tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres que se ubica en la Asoc. 16 de abril en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en sus tiempos libres. Marisabel tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su tienda.

Marisabel necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una parrilla para preparar los anticuchos y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Marisabel son ampliar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y tener un hijo.

loans.use: Buy a grill and drinks

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida C., a 33-year-old member of Mangrove 1 Center, is making a living from fishing and selling seafoods. Her husband never misses a single day to have a catch, just to make sure to provide for the family. Their children, aged 10 and 9, are doing well in school. The couple works a lot. They know that if they do not save enough, it will be harder for them when heavy rains and winds hit the sea.

To augment their situation, they applied to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a PHP 20,000 loan. They wanted to purchase three additional fishing nets and invest in a motorized pumpboat. Now, they only rent a pumpboat.

In the future, they really hope to own number of motorized pumpboats. They also look forward to seeing their children establish their own careers.

They cannot have imagined how life has changed because of Paglaum MPC, they shared.

loans.use: Purchase 3 fishing nets and invest a motorized pumpboat

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Desde pequeña trabajó en diversas actividades ayudando a sus padres, entre estas actividades aprendió a vender cerveza al por mayor, y está dentro de este negocio hace 10 años, se siente muy a gusto con la actividad que realiza, ya que el comercio es lo que más le agradó realizar desde niña. Gracias a que este negocio es rentable por las diversas fiestas patronales y compromisos festivos en su ciudad puede vender grandes cantidades de cerveza y sus ganancias son muy buenas. Con el tiempo espera ser una gran distribuidora o por lo menos, ser la más reconocida dentro de su entorno. Tania está en su segundo préstamo con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando como hasta hoy, a base de mucha responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y aprovechar las fiestas para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Tania is 32 years old, single and lives with her parents and brothers. Since she was a little girl she worked at different activities helping her parents. Among these activities she learned how to sell beer wholesale, and has been in this business for the last ten years. She feels very content with this business, since she has liked the trade business since she was little. Thanks to the lucrative aspect of this business, particularly thanks to the many community events that take place in her town, she can sell large quantities of beer at very good profit. In time she hopes to become a great distributor, or at least be well known in her circle. Tania is currently on her second loan with MFP, and she expects to continue to work as she has been, with great sense of responsibility and a good repayment record. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more boxes of beer with which she hopes to increase her sales during the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de la cantidad de bebidas que vende

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia L. and her family are living a simple life in the village of San Manuel Naguillan, Isaebla.  She is married to Rodolfo, a tricycle driver.  Their three children are all married: Precy, the eldest is 34 years old, a midwife graduate and now working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Efren, 32 years old, vocational course graduate, working in Qatar and Roden, 30 years old, a graduate of Police Technology. 

In order to earn  their daily living, Rodolfo works as a tricycle driver while Ignacia is working as a calamansi vendor. Calamansi is a citrus fruit native to the Phillipines.  They strive to work to sustain their daily needs because they do not want to depend on their children financially since they all have their own families.  Some of their income from their tricycle operation and vending business was invested in their piggery business as an alternative source of income.  

Ignacia is asking for a loan of $275 that she will use for the continuous operation of their small businesses.  They have been in business for 25 years and it has assisted them in sending their children to school.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Marta Cecilia tiene la edad de 37 años, reside en laureles norte con dos hijos de 14 y 18 años que estudian la secundaria, el negocio que tiene es una pulpería que desde hace trece años administra, comenzó con prestamos y ha ido surtiendo su venta con productos variados, sus planes  a futuro es convertirla en un mini súper donde pueda ofertar todos los productos y verduras. También desea tener salud para ayudar a sus hijas a que tengan una buena educación, con esta solicitud de crédito va a comprar más inventario de productos de consumo diario para ofertar a sus clientes, y atraer otros clientes y crecer para obtener sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Ms. Marta Cecilia L. is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Laureles Norte with her two children, ages 14 and 18, who attend high school. She has been running her own general store for the last three years. She started out with loans that have allowed her to stock her shop with an assortment of products. Her future goal is to convert her shop into a mini market in which she will sell all types of goods and vegetables. She also hopes to have good health so that she can provide her children with an excellent education. With this loan, she will purchase more basic need goods that she will offer to her customers, as well as bring in new customers and grow so that she can reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need items

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a farmer in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman. Her husband, Mr. Lounh Sou, is a construction worker and helps with his wife’s business. Now Mrs. Mom P. is applying for a loan to buy two cows. She will breed them to earn more income and will also use them to plow the field. She is 33 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and plowing a field

loans.name: Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
El comité POJOAJU(MANOS UNIDAS) nace hace 3 años exactamente. Se forma a partir del contacto con la sra. Bernardita (ña nita) quien es miembro de un comité de la zona b' Mbayue de la ciudad de Limpio. 

El comité Pojoaju en estos años ha demostrado mucho crecimiento tanto grupal como individual, las actividades mas fuerte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras es el comercio vanta de merceria (ropas, calzados, entre otros) tambien estan las vendedoras de carbon que con muchos años sacrificio hoy dia estan viendo sus frutos. Demostrado en la venta de sus productos elaborados por ellas misma.

El comité se encuentra ya en el 6º ciclo gracias al crédito que le otorga la Fundación Paraguya y Kiva ellas pueden obtener acrecentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida suyo y de su comunidad.

1 Del Rosario P.,venta de carbon 
2 Virginia R., ciber, cabina 
3 Ma. Nilsa O., carniceria 
4 Estela P., peluqueria 
5 Martina M., ventas de ropas 
6 Perla P., venta de carne 
7 Antoliana R., despensa 
8 Rosa R. B., heladeria 
9 Natividad E., despensa 
10 Rosa T.,venta de bebidas 
11 Isidora A.,despensa 
12 Sunilda C., vendedora en gral.  
13 Liliana A., comerciante 
13 Andrea M.,venta de prod. Avon, carnes, entre otros 
14 Irene R.,vendedora ambulante 
15 Victoria D., vendedora 
16 Luz Barboza, venta de carne, detergente 
17 Rosa Z. M., vendedora
texts.en:
The group Pojoaju (United Hands) was created three years ago exactly. It started through their contact señora Bernardita, who is a member of the group in the b'Mbayue area in the city of Limpio. In these three years, Pojoaju has demonstrated a lot of growth in the group as well as individually. The main activity of this group of enterprising women is selling merchandise (clothing, shoes, etc.). There are also members who sell charcoal who have sacrificed for many years and are now seeing the benefit. They also sell products they make themselves. This group is on their sixth loan. Thanks to the credits offered to them by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, they can increase their income and improve their own quality of life and that of their community. 1 Del Rosario P., Charcoal sales 2 Virginia R., Internet café and phone service 3 Ma. Nilsa O., Butcher shop 4 Estela P., Salon 5 Martina M., Clothing sales 6 Perla P., Meat sales 7 Antoliana R., Grocery store 8 Rosa R. B., Ice cream store 9 Natividad E., Grocery store 10 Rosa T., Beverage sales 11 Isidora A., Grocery store 12 Sunilda C., General sales 13 Liliana A., Saleswoman 13 Andrea M., Avon product sales 14 Irene R., Street vendor 15 Victoria D., Saleswoman 16 Luz Barboza, Meat and detergent sales 17 Rosa Z. M., Saleswoman

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The group will use the credit to buy merchandise, clothing, shoes, and prepaid cell phone cards

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Mr. Herman R. is 36 years old and a resident of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines. Mr. R. is married with three children. He is a well-motivated man who wishes to bring a bright future to his family. He started up his mini grocery store when he received his first loan from HSPFI.

At this moment, because his store can hardly accommodate the demands of his customers, he wants to access additional capital of PHP 11,000. This will be used to buy additional stock for his store, like canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and beverages. Mr. R. and his family extend their thanks to KIVA and KIVA lenders, who will be the bridge to the success of his plans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for sale, like canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and beverages.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yanacocha Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios del banco comunal  “YANACOCHA”, son vecinos D. la zona D. surquillos, situado en el distrito D. Calca en la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 1:30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, teniendo como principal actividad la agricultura y  ganadería, en las épocas D. siembra, en resto del año ellos alternan sus actividades agrícolas con los diferentes negocios, que son, la crianza D. aves D. corral,  la compra y venta D. semillas, D. verduras, D. frutas, D. tiendas D. abarrotes, negocio D. mecánica y reparación. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para poder incrementar más sus productos y así tener mayor productividad.

Ellos se encuentran sumamente agradecidos con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifican su deseo D. trabajo duro para poder cumplir sus metas y también se comprometen al pago total D. su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "YANACOCHA" are residents of zona D. surquillos, which is situated in the Calca district in the province of Cuzco, one and a half hours away from the city of Cuzco.

The group members are involved in different activities. During the sowing season their primary activities are agriculture and raising livestock. For the rest of the year they supplement their agricultural activities with other businesses. These businesses incluD. raising poultry, buying and selling seeds, vegetables and fruits, general stores, mechanic work and repair. The group members are soliciting this loan to buy more products with the intent of becoming more productive.

They are very thankful for the help they receive through these means and have all pledged to work hard to reach their goals and pay back their loan within the defined repayment term.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and run their businesses and farms

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is venturing into a little eatery business in her village at Barangay Gadu Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and is trying her best to earn a better livelihood. She is married to Ernesto Gunsa,t who is a Barangay councilor in their village. They are blessed with three children. Their eldest daughter, Christine Mae, is 21 years old and in her fifth year in college, studying A.B. legal management. Cherry Ann, 19 years old, is in her third year of college and is a business administration student. Christopher is 16 years old and is now in his first year of college, taking up education. Celia and her husband struggle to earn enough income to support the college education of their three children.

With her small village eatery business, Celia is thankful that she is able to earn a daily income. She has even expanded her offerings to include cooked snacks, such banana cue, “pansit,” and rice cakes. These additional products help her to increase her income. She is thankful that her husband is also doing his best to provide for many of their needs at home, especially in terms of their children’s tuition fees.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will soon lend her the amount she has recently requested, a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. She intends to utilize these funds to further improve her eatery business.

loans.use: To improve her eatery business

loans.name: Maria Delicia

texts.es:
La señora María Delicia B. D. R.  tiene 63 años, vive en la calle San Pablo Nº 620 del distrito D. la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria  Incompleta, no tiene  hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
María se dedica a la elaboración D. vestidos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa y sale a vender al mercado.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra D. hilos, telas para elaborar los enagües.
El crédito D. 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos como hilos, telas para elaborar vestidos para niñas.
María tiene como sueño tener su tienda D. ropa para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
María Delicia B. D. R. is 63 years old and lives at 620 San Pablo Street in the lower part of the district of Esperanza in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She did not finish elementary school and does not have children that depend on her financially. María dedicates herself to making dresses in her home, and she goes out to sell them in the market. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she invested in buying threads and fabrics to make the dresses. She will invest this loan of 500 soles in purchasing products such as threads and fabrics to make dresses for little girls. María's dream is to have her own clothing store and to grow her microenterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as threads and fabrics to make dresses for girls

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr:
D. Claire est née vers 1986 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Claire est célibataire sans enfant et vit  avec ses parents  à Avotrou, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou. Claire vend à Avotrou des pommes de terre, des feuilles de salade, de concombres, de poivrons, de carottes, etc. 

Claire est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a eu plusieurs crédits de ALIDé. Claire est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité dans le but de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Claire sollicite un nouveau prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Claire was born around 1986 in Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Claire is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in Avotrou, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Cotonou. In Avotrou, Claire sells potatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, green peppers, carrots, etc.

Claire is a long-time client of ALIDé who has received several loans from ALIDé. She is a good client who repays her loans correctly. To increase the volume of her business so as to better respond to the needs of her clientele, Claire is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lettuce, vegetables, carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Luz Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera.  No tiene hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.  Vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganados menores (ovinos y chanchos).  También comprará material (totora y chillihua) para la fabricación de quesanas (tejas, calaminas).

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the Las Totoritas Community Bank, which is located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 19 and single. She does not have children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Chimu Central community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. With her initial loan of 300 PEN she bought small livestock (sheep). She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy small livestock (sheep and pigs). She will also buy material (reeds and wood) to make “quesanas” (a type of rush mat). Her wish is to keep working. (About her community bank) She likes the savings and the sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and material to make “quesanas” (a type of rush mat)

loans.name: Irma Esther

texts.en:
Irma sells undergarments and also works as a teacher in the small town of Masisea, located along the shores of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  In this photo, Irma appears with her little daughter, Daniela, showing the few pieces of clothing that remain after a recent period of good sales.  Irma is twenty-five years old and is a single mother.  She works hard for the sake of her young daughter.  

Irma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about five years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  Irma invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the business of selling beauty products.  This business partially financed her university studies. She plans to use this loan of 2500 soles to purchase undergarments and basic grocery products to sell in Masisea, where she works. Irma spends most of her time in Masisea but returns to Pucallpa at the end of every month to collect her teacher's salary.  

Irma's goal is to design undergarments and to have her own boutique from which to sell them.  She is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos because the organization gives loans without much bureaucracy and paperwork, unlike most other banks.

loans.use: Fabric and sewing notions for making undergarments; basic grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio B. is 58 years old and owns a 3-hectare farm in Trento, Agusan del Sur. He has been farming since 1960. He has six children and a supportive wife who also helps him with managing the farm. He is a proud CEVI client. He said he has been requesting loans from CEVI for a quite long time already and is currently hoping to get his seventh loan.

He told CEVI that he needs additional capital to run his farm. He said that he definitely needs PHP 15,000 to be able to buy good quality rice seeds and to pay the laborers who help prepare the land.

He is pleased with services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. He still would want to request its services in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for his farm and be able to pay laborers

loans.name: Madukani Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Madukani borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 23,20,14 and 10 years old.

Sophia has owned a cafe business selling food for 15 years. She works 14 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Sophia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 TSh in order to buy more rice, cooking oil for her business,

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sophia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Joyce is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: T buy more commodities

loans.name: God Help Us Group

texts.en: Around the Police Station, Foyah District, Lofa County, Saah lives with 2 children whose ages range from 1 and 3 years; their education level is daycare. He has sold dry goods for about 2 years now and with this activity he caters to his children and supports them in school. His challenge has been the lack of finance over the years, but is successful in attracting his customers by words of encouragement. He dreams of a bigger business to adequately support his children.

loans.use: assorted dry goods (batteries, toothburshes, manpo, etc)

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia es una socia dinámica y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 54 años y es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, ella  se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y preparación de chupetes, pues vende en su casa, también es propietaria de un motocarro que lo alquila diariamente, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es operador de maquinarias pesadas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” desde hace ocho años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, en la actualidad  Hortencia necesita un préstamo de 1500 que será utilizado una parte en gaseosas para vender y otra parte será utilizado en la compra de repuestos para su motocarro para dar mantenimiento. La meta de Hortencia es arreglar su casita y seguir adelante en el trabajo.

loans.use: Invertirá en una parte en gaseosas y otra parte en la compra de repuestos para su motocarro

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.en:
R. Ikhtiyor is a family man who wishes to increase his business to be able to better support his family and offer them a better quality of life. Eight years ago, Ikhtiyor started by selling blankets and counterpanes (bedspreads). His business has grown little by little and now offers greater variety and fashions. Today, Ikhtiyor has been working with Kiva partner IMON International for more than three years and feels very satisfied with the support offered to him because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers and support his family. Ikhtiyor is asking to borrow $1,500 USD in order to purchase new goods. He wants to develop his business and increase his income to save money and create a better life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new retail goods.

loans.name: Carmen Carolina

texts.es: Carmen Carolina tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este trabajo, por lo que este negocio era anteriormente de su Mama, mas tarde ella decide hacerse cargo del negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, Carmen ha tenido un sin número de problemas como fue el estudiar y mantener su negocio, ya que lagunas veces tenía que trabajar todo el día y por las noches tenía que estudiar porque algunas veces tenia examen y es una persona muy dedica a sus estudios. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que será para la compra de pañales para bebe, ropa interior, sandalias, camisetas entre otros productos. Su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Carmen Carolina is 24 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than 4 years. This business previously belonged to her mother, but Carmen later decided to take over because she is a strong-willed and enterprising woman.

She faced a myriad a problems such as balancing her time between studying and managing her business. Sometimes she had to work all day and then study at night because she had an exam. Carmen is very dedicated to her studies. The loan she is requesting will be use as operating capital to buy baby diapers, undergarments, sandals, t-shirts, and other items. She hopes to finish her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Hadiza

texts.en: Hadiza is married with four children. She is 33 years old. She sells drinks in front of her house. She is a very hard working woman. With her profits, she helps her family. She wishes to increase her stock during this season but her greatest challenge is funding. If she is given a loan of 100,000 she will be able to purchase drinks directly from the company van. She believes she will get a better price from the company. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Imylenda

texts.en: Imylenda H. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Imylenda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish as well as ready-to-wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Imylenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a rice farmer. She owns a small field and hopes it will provide her family with enough income to buy an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basics. She has three children.  Editha is working very hard to be the best mother to her children. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 14,000 from community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies. This will help her grow her crops and have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty-three years old. She is a widowed woman and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Elizabeth is a trader, trading in gari, a local delicacy from cassava flour. She procures her goods from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community.

Elizabeth has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more gari to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia I. is an entrepreneur and a married Tanzanian woman. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (Batick and Khanga) at the Karume city market shopping center. She purchases the business goods from the Mnazi mmoja traditional clothes shopping center. She has been in the business for five years. 

The business income enables her to meet her family's daily demand and capitalize the business. She needs a loan of 1,400,000 Tanzanian shillings to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
María Laura tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y vive junto a su esposo en el sector Angolo II, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 14 años, ella nos comenta que esta es una de las actividades más comunes en la zona y que es de mucha ayuda para solventar los gastos familiares de los hogares debido a que la mayoría de hombres se dedican al trabajo agrícola y este no les ofrece suficientes ingresos.

María Laura es consciente de que debe seguir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar. Por ello hace un año instaló también una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Estos negocios son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un créidto de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

María Laura es una mujer responsable, activa y muy emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les asegure un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Laura is 30 years old, is married, and has 5 children in her care. She lives together with her husband in sector Angolo II, Mórrope district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. María Laura has worked raising animals for 14 years. She tells us that this is one of the most common activities of the zone, and is a great help in meeting the household costs, owing to the fact that the majority of men work in agriculture and this doesn't offer sufficient earnings. María Laura is conscious that she must continue to move forward and support her husband in maintaining their home. Because of this, one year ago she also installed a small grocery store in her home. These businesses are a great help to the family's economy. María Laura wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals, but doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action. For this reason for the first time she saw a need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuveos soles, which will permit her to achieve her objective. María Laura is a responsible woman, active and very hard-working. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education which will assure them of a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to increase business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Delia is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Рачабов Махмадали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en:
Mahmadali R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. Mahmadali fattens and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma R. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Emma owns and operates a business providing transport services in the local community. Her husband has been the driver of their small jeepney (small bus) for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for jeepney maintenance as well as to buy other needed materials to provide better service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Emma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her jeepney as well as to buy other materials needed to provide better service

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo Antonio, tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, por lo que son menores y están a su cargo. El señor tiene un negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, en su casa de habitación. El inició con este negocio desde que termino de hacer su casa hace 8 años con una habitación, ahora tiene 5 habitaciones y le va muy bien. Este crédito solicitado por el señor quiere invertirlo en la compra de muebles variados y hamacas, ya que nos encontramos en una fecha de bastante alquiler, ya que su casa está localizada en una zona muy concurrida de turistas. El señor sueña con tener algún día un hotel, si es posible en una playa cercana y poder dejarle un legado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gerardo Antonio is 45 years old, he is married and he has 2 children who are minors and are still in his care. His business is renting rooms out of his house. He started out with this business after he finished building his house 8 years ago. He has 5 rooms to rent and it has been very profitable. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of various furniture items and hammocks. Currently it is a tourist season and his house is located in a locale frequented by tourists. His dreams are to one day have a hotel, if possible on a beach near by and to leave it as a legacy for his kids.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Zeleba

texts.fr:
Madame Zeleba D. est une femme mariée de 39 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Morodiambougou, un village situé à 6 kilomètres de Ouelessebougou.
Madame Zeleba D. n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école moderne, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente de fruits et légumes.  Elle a appris cette activité auprès d’une amie. Avec 10 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité.
Afin d’améliorer son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Après 1 prêt  solidaire bien remboursé, elle décide d’aller en prêt  individuel.
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt individuel, des chargements de charrettes en fruits et légumes suivant les périodes.
Elle s’approvisionne à Morodiambougou et dans les villages environnants. Ses légumes sont vendus à Bamako et à Ouelessebougou, au comptant et souvent à crédit aux revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui  lui permettra  d’améliorer davantage son entreprise et à payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Zeleba D. is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.  She lives with her husband and their children in Morodiambougou, a village located 16 km from Ouelessebougou.  She did not have the opportunity to attend modern schools.  Zeleba soon got started in income-generating work, notably in buying and selling fruit and vegetables.  She learned this business from a friend of hers.  With ten years of experience, she has a command of her business.  In order to improve her business and to satisfy her customers, who are more and more numerous, Zeleba decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  After one solildairy loan, which was repaid, she decided to take out an individual loan.  She intends to use this loan to buy cart loads of fruit and vegetables in season.  She gets her supplies in Morodiambougou and from surrounding villages.  Her vegetables are sold in Bamako and in Ouelessebougou.  She accepts cash and often credit from retailers.  With this loan, Zeleba plans on making a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will enable her to improve her enterprise further and to cover the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Akosiwa Enyonam

texts.en:
Madame Akosiwa Enyonam A. owns a general store in the Kegue region of Lomé, Togo. She is 24 years old and has one child. Her husband is an architect.

Akosiwa has been in business for only a year and this will be her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 150,000 CFA to purchase all sorts of goods for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 43 años, convive con Delia de 34 años y su hijo político José de 12 años, a quien quiere como si fuera su propio hijo, esta familia vive en su domicilio propio, ubicado en una zona céntrica del centro poblado “Sanchirio Palomar “ - La Merced. Anteriormente comercializaba productos naturales, pero al ver que sus ganancias eran regulares, decidió tener sus propias plantaciones de plátano en terrenos arrendados, las que ahora cuida con esmero y dedicación, generándole ingresos económicos que le permiten obtener mayores oportunidades y bienes, que mejorarían su calidad de vida. Por otro lado trabaja de operario en chacras ajenas, recibiendo S/. 20.00 por día. Lleva dos años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es retirar la maleza de su chacra, de esa manera facilitaría el crecimiento de sus plantas, es por ello que espera comprarse sus terrenos propios con los ahorros que tiene guardado y así obtener mayores ganancias. Por el momento plantará frutos que crecen en esta zona de la selva del Perú, además tiene casi listo todo para instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta satisfecho de trabajar con su grupo comunal, ya que las personas son muy colaboradoras en cada actividad que desarrollan. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un terreno de varias hectáreas y para el cual estuvo ahorrando todo este tiempo, por ello está feliz porque verá su sueño cristalizado.
texts.en:
Raúl, age 43, lives with Delia, age 34, and her polite son José, age 12, whom he treats as his own child. This family lives in its own home located in a the central “Sanchirio Palomar “ zone of La Merced.

Previously, he sold natural products, but, upon seeing the possibility for fairly good profits, he decided to have his own banana plantation on leased land. He now looks after this with extreme care and dedication producing income that allows him to obtain greater opportunities and benefits that are improving his quality of life. In addition, he works as a laborer on someone else’s small farm receiving 20 soles per day.

He has been engaged in this business for 2 years, and what he likes most is clearing the undergrowth from his own plantation and in this way facilitating the growth of his crops. This is why he hopes to purchase his own fields with the savings he has set aside and, thus, obtain better earnings. At present, he plans to plant fruits that grow in this area of the Peruvian jungle. In addition, he is almost ready to open a food shop in his house.

This is the second time he has had a loan with MFP, and he is pleased to be working with his communal bank since the members work collaboratively in each business that they develop. With the loan that he is applying for he will buy a field of several hectares for which he has been saving for a long time. He is happy to see his dream coming true.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy a plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La  Sra. Nancy está casada con el Sr. Agustín  y tienen 1 hija  menor está cursando la escuela primaria.
Nancy tiene una farmacia en su casa desde hace varios años. 
Ella es muy conocida en su barrio por sus conocimientos hacia los medicamentos. 
Ella se inicio en otro trabajo donde trabajo como farmacéutica y con el correr de los años decidió abrir su propio negocio. 
 Su marido es camionero y con esos ingresos le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. 
Hemos confiado en Nancy en otros créditos anteriores  y ha cumplido con total cabalidad con sus compromisos. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is married to Sr. Agustín. They have a young daughter who is attending elementary school. Nancy has a pharmacy in her house that she has managed for several years. She is well-known in her neighborhood for her knowledge about medicines.

Nancy started at another job where she worked as a pharmacist, but after a few years passed she decided to open her own business. Her husband is a truck driver and his earnings help with the household expenses. Nancy has utilized previous loans and completely fulfilled all of her commitments. She is a very responsible person who desires to succeed. Nancy is known for her jovial and enterprising spirit. She is requesting a loan to buy medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
This village loan is made up of 14 people who live in Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. Mrs. Pheap A. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of the group will use his or her loan to support a different purpose.
Mrs. Pheap A. is a 42-year-old farmer who works very hard to support her six children, while her husband, Mr. Dorn Lorn, is a horse and cart driver who also supports his wife on the farm. In order to increase her income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Pheap A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and a cow for breeding. The couple has six children; two are laborers on the Thai border and four attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Myriam Maritza

texts.es:
Myriam B. vive en el municipio de Arjona en el departamento de Bolívar muy cerca a Cartagena, ella es la propietaria de la tienda la  Fe de Dios; tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 37 y 41 años  y son empleados de empresas importantes.
Desde hace 5 años cuando empezó su tienda, con un dinero que le regaló su hermana y su ex cónyuge inició su gran sueño de ser independiente.  El Hacer crecer su tienda ha sido su desafío constante, pues vive sola y sostiene su hogar con este negocio y dinero que  le dan sus hijos. 
Este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y con ellos su negocio ha cogido fuerzas,  ha diversificado sus productos y ahora siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan gracias a Dios y a esta organización. En la actualidad solicita un credikiva que lo invertirá en la compra de víveres, abarrotes, arroz, azúcar aceite, plátano, yuca verduras, refrescos, condimentos  y productos de aseo, que es lo que más compra su clientela.
Su deseo es que ahora Kiva la siga apoyando porque sus intereses son más económicos y su tienda pueda crecer cada día más;  adecuar su local es su sueño, así como también comprarse un enfriador para conservar sus productos perecederos y carnes, por eso tiene como meta que con sus utilidades comprará un televisor nuevo, porque el actual proyecta una imagen deficiente y esta es su gran distracción.
texts.en:
Myriam B. lives in the municipality of Arjona in the Bolivar department close to Cartagena. She is the owner of the Fe de Dios store, has two children ages 37 and 41 who work at important companies. Five years ago she opened her store with some money from her sister and ex-husband with a dream of being independent. Growing her business has been a constant challenge since she lives alone and has to try to keep up her home with the business and some money that her children give her. This is her fourth loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and with it's help her business has strengthened and she has diversified her products. Now thanks to God and this organization she always has what her customers need. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan to purchase various goods, rice, sugar, plantains, cassava, vegetables, beverages, condiments and cleaning products which are the good her customers buy most. Her hope is that Kiva will keep helping her because their interest rates are more affordable and so her store will grow more every day. She also dreams of remodeling the store and buying a refrigerator to keep perishable items and meats. Her goal is to use her profits to buy a new television because her current one is damaged and it serves as a great distraction.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various goods, rice, sugar, plantains, cassava, vegetables, beverages, condiments and cleaning products which are the good her customers buy most

loans.name: Villaflor

texts.en:
Villaflor P. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Villaflor is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Villaflor owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Villaflor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Villaflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Villaflor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Villaflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B. is 50 years old and lives with her husband in Tuv province in central Mongolia. They have no children and live together in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Tungalag operates a 'ger'-bracing supply production business. She produces ropes, belts, and straps used in 'ger' construction. After producing her products, she transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell at a large outdoor market. Her customers consist mainly of large wholesale buyers. 

Tungalag started her business in 2000 and has gained much experience as a maker of these products over the years. In 2006, she partnered with 4 others and established a business group. This enabled her to expand her production capacity and grow her customer base. The business group has proven quite successful over the last 5 years and has provided Tungalag with enough income to remodel her home. Today, her average monthly income exceeds 200,000 MNT. 

Tungalag is a kind and gentle person. She is a diligent worker and hopes to continue to grow her business to the point where she can have her own workplace. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase horse manes and tails in order to produce ropes and straps.

loans.use: To purchase horse manes and tails

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio C., from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan, is 58 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Inocencio owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Engaged in his business for over 40 years, he earns approximately 20000 PHP per harvest.

Inocencio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, he is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Inocencio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of his family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Los Tres Pino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Tres Pinos lo conforman Margarita del Carmen B. de 47 años, María del Carmen V. B. de 32 años y Pedro José E. de 40 años, 3 personas esforzadas y trabajadoras que comparten su solidaridad entre sí. Margarita, quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura en especial maíz, frijol y yuca; María, se dedica igual a la agricultura pero en especial a la compra y venta de cosechas; finalmente Pedro, vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 4 años a sus familiares, vecinos, conocidos y personas que le han sido recomendada por quienes son sus buenos clientes.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Pinos” (The Three Pine Trees) communal bank’s members are: Margarita del Carmen B., 47, María del Carmen V. B., 32, and Pedro José Enríquez, 40, three hard working, determined people who are mutually supportive. Margarita, who is the group coordinator, has been a farmer for the last 10 years especially of corn, beans and manioc. María is also a farmer but focuses on buying and selling crops. Finally, Pedro has sold clothing and cosmetics for the last 4 years to his friends, neighbors, acquaintances and people who have been recommended to him by his good customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used in corn, bean and manioc crops.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey T. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. He is 36 years old. Jeffrey is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jeffrey owns and operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his business. Jeffrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which he will use to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the third loan taken by Jeffrey from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support family members. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Jayne

texts.es:
Jayne I. Q. D. M. está casada hace mas D. 15 años y tiene 3 hijos. Tanto ella como el marido trabajan en diferentes áreas mientras los hijos se quedan con la madre D. la Jayne. Jayne y su familia vive en Cochabamba en la zona norte en un barrio conocido como Pacata Alta. 

Jayne se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda D. barrio mientras su esposo trabaja como Analista D. Sistemas en la creación D. software y al mismo tiempo da clases D. Sistemas informáticos. Es para la tienda que Jayne tiene que necesita el crédito, pues la zona donD. está la tienda está más poblada y la demanda se incremento considerablemente en los últimos años y ella necesita capital para comprar más abarrotes y poder abastecer mejor su tienda.

Jayne y su marido que el único sueño que tienen es poder darle todo lo que puedan a sus hijos y poder verlos profesionales algún día.
texts.en:
Jayne I. Q. D. M. has been married for 15 years and has three children. She and her husband work in different areas while their children stay with Jayne’s mother. Jayne and her family live in the northern area of Cochabamba in a neighborhood known as Pacata Alta. Jayne works selling groceries at her neighborhood store, while her husband works as a systems analyst in software creation and also provides classes on information technology. Jayne needs the loan for the store because the area where the store is located is more populated and the demand increased considerably in the past few years. She needs money to purchase more groceries and to better stock her store.

The only dream that Jayne and her husband have is to be able to proviD. all that they can to their children and to be able to see them as professionals one day.

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Don Víctor Manuel, un señor trabajador de 60 años de edad, trabaja en la alcaldía Municipal de El Transito como barrendero, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de él. Residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de Usulután,  cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en su trabajo con un horario de 8:00am á 4:00pm.
Don Víctor está en proceso de reparar su vivienda ya que la cocina tiene malo el techo, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar este trabajo, ya que con esta ayuda estará mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda y su familia está más segura, tranquila y sin preocupación por algún accidente domestico.
El quiere ofrecer a su familia una vivienda segura y administrar bien el presente crédito para tener la confianza de seguir trabajando de esta manera.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is a hard-working, 60 year-old man.  He works for the city of El Transito as a street sweeper.  He lives with his wife and two children aged 18 and 16 who are financially dependent on him.  They live in San Rafael Oriente in Usulután department.  He has 30 years of experience in his job and works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.

Víctor is in the process of repairing his house since he has problems with his kitchen roof.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will allow him to carry out this work.  With this help he will be improving the conditions of his house and his family will be safer, more relaxed and won't have to worry about domestic accidents.

He would like to offer his family a safe home and manage his present loan well so that he has the confidence to continue working in this way.

loans.use: To buy building materials

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rose Aba Bagyina

texts.en:
Rose Aba Bagyina E. is divorced and has six dependants. She is a baker at Abura. She regularly bakes bread and other pastries. She sees to the general well-being of her family.

Rose will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the increased profits from her expanded business Rose plans to reinvest in her bread business.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Gerardine is 27 years old, and is married with four children who are between two and five years old.  She is the presidente of a group called “Twizamure” is a third person in the left hand  and she owns a beauty salon. She has been in this business for about four years. She works from 7 in the morning every day of the week and she currently employs six people. 

Gerardine and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for her salon and upgrade her facilities. With the use of this loan, Gerardine hopes to earn more profit and reinvest it back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase salon products and improve facilities

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada hace 4 años pero aun no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta. Para ella este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le agrada porque con los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta bajo pedido y cobra semanalmente, dice que lleva dedicada a esta actividad por tres años y que le encanta ya que se gana muchos premios.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros. Sus sueños es algún dia tener un bebé.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the Santa Martha Community Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city renowned for its diverse regional products, including the straw hats and shawls that are known throughout the country and beyond.  

It is here that we meet Angela. Angela is 21 and has been married for 4 years but has not had any children yet. Her husband works in a factory in the city of Manta. This is her second loan cycle with the Community Bank and she tells us that she is happy with the loans she has taken out with the bank because it has allowed her to set up her business.

Angela sells Yanbal products, including beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women. She works every day selling door-to-door from 8:30am until 5pm, taking orders and receiving weekly payments. She says she has been working in this field for three years and she loves her work as she has won many awards.  

Angela will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, including perfumes, creams and cosmetics, amongst others. Her dream is to have a baby some day.

loans.use: Purchase creams, perfumes, cosmetics, costume jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Yvy Evelyn

texts.es:
Yvy es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente  frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un carrito sanguchero en donde ofrece en venta al público en general salchipollos (plato de comida rápida que consiste en una mezcla de frituras de pollo, papas fritas y hot dog). Ella ofrece en venta estos productos los fines de semana por las noches. Su esposo trabaja en el vecino país de Ecuador. Los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad le sirven para agenciarse de algunos ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia.

Yvy desea adquirir más insumos para poder ampliar su producción y percibir mayores ingresos que le ayuden a satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Yvy is a mother, she is 22 years old and she lives together with her husband and their two children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a temperate region that is a major producer of fruits such as mangos, lemons, and passion fruit. It is within the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. 

She has a sandwich cart from where she sells to the general public a national dish known as salchipollos (a fast food consisting of a combination of fried chicken, fries, and a hot dog).  She sells her products on the weekends in the evenings. Her husband works in the neighboring country of Ecuador. The income that she earns from her business is enough to help her support her family. 

Yvy wishes to purchase more ingredients in order to increase production and improve her profits. She will be able to satisfy client demand. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.  This loan will let her reach her goal.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia M. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergents & toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.
