In 2008, Inocencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods & canned goods. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang S. was born in 1979. She is a married woman and a villager who lives in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Son Sroeun, are fish sellers in the markets. They are able to earn a little income to support their family living. Since this business is doing well, they want to expand it. So Mrs. Heang S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this loan, they hope to increase their income to improve the family living. This couple is working hard with their business to support their two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Ms. Wilma V. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and still single. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a snack vending business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for four years already and earns approximately Php 3,000 a month from this business activity. 

In 2011, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, and she is  now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as her first loan, which will be used as additional capital for her snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, possible product innovations, and business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 40 years old. Reynilda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Reynilda owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Reynilda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Reynilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Reynilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Reynilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital to make clay pots for sale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad T. is from the village of Balila, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Soledad is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Soledad owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & food seasoning in the local community. Soledad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Soledad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soledad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Soledad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents & snack foods

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; la socia tiene 39 años de edad casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura sembrando verduras como zanahoria, lechuga y cebolla entre otros ,esta actividad la socia lleva años realizando y mediante esto la socia saca a sus hijos adelante , la socia lleva sus productos a vender a las ferias sabatinas en el mercado de huancaro ubicado por el centro de la ciudad, la socia desea construir su casita conjuntamente con su esposo desean acceder a este sueño.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar a su capital para poder terminar de construir su casita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; la socia tiene 39 años de edad casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura sembrando verduras como zanahoria, lechuga y cebolla entre otros ,esta actividad la socia lleva años realizando y mediante esto la socia saca a sus hijos adelante , la socia lleva sus productos a vender a las ferias sabatinas en el mercado de huancaro ubicado por el centro de la ciudad, la socia desea construir su casita conjuntamente con su esposo desean acceder a este sueño.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar a su capital para poder terminar de construir su casita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Jazira's Group

texts.en:
Jazira B. is the leader of this group. She is 30 and married to a private entrepreneur. She has a daughter and a son, both of whom are preschool age (under seven).  In order to earn additional money to meet her family’s needs, Jazira started breeding livestock eight years ago with an initial investment of 4000 soms. By reselling her livestock after fattening them, she earns an additional 10,000 soms per month.  She has requested this loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for further reselling. In the near future Jazira wants to increase her business’ revenue, and then in the autumn she plans to purchase a truck.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.   If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Modesta; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y gallinas y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra hortalizas como zanahoria, repollo y lechuga y después lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de hortalizas y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y semillas para su tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Modesta belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro de Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has seven children. Modesta divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs and chickens. She also has a plot of land on which she grows vegetables such as carrots, cabbages, and lettuce. Modesta sells her produce at the market in Urubamba as a street vendor. Through these businesses, she has been able to help her children move forward. Modesta wants to expand both her businesses of selling vegetables and raising animals. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy animals and seeds to plant on her land.

Modesta is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase animals and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Dorca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dorca lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Olivia de 54 años quien tiene una fritanga y realiza postres como atol, arroz de leche etc. el cual vende de manera ambulante desde hace 8 años.
Ella es madre y padre para sus tres hijos de 17, 10 y 7 años e invertirá el crédito en adquirir un tramo en el mercado. La meta de la señora Olivia es poner una panadería ya que tiene un horno con capacidad suficiente pero le falta la materia prima y unas mejoras para lograrlo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la señora Yuridia de 21 años quien tiene una fritanga y su meta es tener un puesto fijo, y la señora Aracely de 27 años quien vende nacatamales y postres tradicionales.
texts.en:
The group Dorca is made up of three hard working and enterprising women. One of these women is Olivia who is 54 years old and makes desserts such as porridge, rice pudding, etc. which she has been selling as a street vendor for eight years. 

She is both mother and father to her three children who are 17, 10 and 7 years old. She will invest this loan in acquiring a stall in the market. Olivia's goal is to establish a bakery since she has an over that would have a sufficient capacity. However, she lacks the raw materials and some improvements in order to achieve this. The other members of the group are Yuridia who is 21 years old, has a small restaurant and whose goal is to have a fixed stall and Aracely who is 27 years old and sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and traditional desserts.

loans.use: to acquire a stall in a market.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes du groupe BENKADI 2  sont  toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne  5 enfants et vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à N’gona, un situé à environ 40 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc.
MARIAM compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women belonging to this group, BENKADI 2, are all married. They have an average age of 33 with five children, on average, and live with their husbands and their children in N’gona, a village situated about 40 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
These clients are on their fifth rural loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their average need for agricultural supplies and intrants. Their prior loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, peanuts, and okra, etc. 

MARIAM intends to buy one sack of urea (fertilizer) and use the remainder of the loan for plowing costs and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 10,000 F CFA which will be used for the day-to-day expenditures of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural intrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For over 10 years, he has operated a polythene bag-selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. He sells polythene bags to shop owners, hotel operators and retail shop operators. He faces a major challenge of theft and high cost of transportation in his business. Silas dreams of purchasing a motorcycle for transporting goods from one place to another in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 he wants to purchase sacks of polythene bags for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of polythene bags for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité trabajan activamente en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto hacia las demás.
Ellas se unieron con el propósito de llevar a sus casas un mayor ingreso y proveerles a sus familias una vida decorosa y sin privaciones como ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Señora Rosa es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a las ventas de bebidas en su domicilio. ella se dedica a esto hace mucho tiempo, por lo mismo ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Manifiesta que los fines de semana es cuando mas ventas tiene, y por lo general sus mercaderías no dan abasto a la demandas. Ella sueña con algún día ampliar su negocio y poder llenar mas su local.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas bebidas para su local, tales como whiskys, gaseosas, cervezas, energizantes, jugos y demás. Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Luchadoras", meaning "Overcoming Women", was formed through a union of several neighbors in the city of Mariano R. Alonso. All of the members of the group actively work in a cooperative environment and in a mutually respectful way. 

They came together with the goal of earning a better income for their households in order to provide their families with a decent life, not having to deprive themselves and they once had to. 

Rosa is one of the members of the group. She sells drinks from her home. She has had her business for some time, which is why she has a well established client base. She says that she gets the most business on the weekends and most often her merchandise is not enough to meet the demands. She dreams of expanding her business some day and to have a better inventory for her store.

She requests a loan to purchase more drinks for her store, such as whisky, soft drinks, beer, energy drinks, juices, and others. She has her hopes set on getting a loan which will be a great source of help.

loans.use: to purchase whisky, soft drinks, beer, energy drinks, juices, and others.

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya is a supportive lady and sells clothes to financially support her family. Her clients include her community members who give her regular orders every month. Her husband has a business making plastic bottles. He receives orders from different factories and fulfills their orders on time to earn a profit. 

She has given birth to seven children. Three of them study and the others stay at home. Ruqqiya couldn’t provide education to all of her children due to financial constraints.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s bottle manufacturing business. With the loan, he will buy plastic and other material (used in making of plastic bottles) in larger quantity that will enable him to fulfill the orders on time. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Ruqqiya hopes that an investment will bring even more profits to him.

loans.use: To buy plastic & other required material for making plastic bottles

loans.name: Roueida

texts.en:
Roueida is a married woman, mother of three children, who has worked selling shoes and bags since she was 14. She is working hard on improving her business and developing the quality of products she sells. Roueida is a hard-working woman who is well known in the region. Her customers are neighbors and relatives who encourage her to improve herself more and more.

Roueida is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase her shop's inventory of new summer goods. She is getting ready for Eid El-Fitr — a three-day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting, when most people work hard to provide their children new shoes and clothes to celebrate these holy days. In addition to shoes, Roueida also sells bags that attract customers' attention. She plans to make a big glass door for the shop that will show her products better.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inveotory of new summer collections

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 25 years old, has been selling movies and DVDs for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more movies and DVDs for sale.

In future, he hopes to grow his business and be a leading supplier of movies in his area.

loans.use: To re-stock his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kola nut and empty bags

loans.name: Duilio Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente ejerce la ardua labor de la enseñanza como maestro de educación secundaria, es padre de tres hijos todos en edades escolares, solicita crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, con la institución es el crédito número once los cuales los ha pagado de forma satisfactoria y espera continuar trabajando con estas micro financiera porque esta es la única forma de hacer algunas mejoras en el hogar.
texts.en:
This client works hard at his job as a high school teacher. He is the father of three school-age children. He is requesting a loan for improving the condition of his home.

This will be his 11th loan with CEPRODEL and he has repaid all of his loans in a satisfactory manner. He hopes to continue working with microloans because they are the only way for him to make a few improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Mesumbat

texts.en:
Mesumbat is 38 years and married. She has two children who are sixteen and fourteen years old.  She has been selling livestock for the last three years, making a monthly profit of KES.24,800.

She plans to use the loan to purchase more livestock for resale.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to establish a dairy farm and to supply and sell to top residents.  She hopes to be selling her milk to the KENYA CREAMERIES COMPANY in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for sale

loans.name: Jibek

texts.ru: Жибек  - 56 летняя пенсионерка.  Жибек и ее муж Мукай воспитали девятерых детей и сейчас являются счастливыми бабушкой и дедушкой 25 внуков.  Жибек с мужем начали свой бизнес в животноводстве в 1980, стартовав с суммы в 15,000 сом. На сегодняшний день хозяйство Жибек, насчитывающее 1 корову, 10 овец, 16 коз и 1 лошадь, дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS).  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жибек обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение численности скота и накопить деньги на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Jibek is a 56-year-old pensioner. Jibek and her husband Mukai have raised nine children and are now happy grandparents of 25 grandchildren. Jibek and her husband started their livestock business in 1980 with a sum of 15,000 KGS. Today, Jibek's farm, totaling one cow, 10 sheep, 16 goats and a horse makes a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. For the further development of her business, Jibek turned to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep. With income after the loan, she plans to invest in a further increase in livestock and to save money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old and married to Esther who is a teacher. He is a father to three children. He runs a retail shop, which he has operated for a period of three years. He earns an income of KSHS 20,000/= per month.

He joined KADET recently and he has applied for his first loan, which he will use to buy dairy cows for milk production and resale. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Francis Janethe

texts.es:
La señora Francis Janethe es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene dos negocios tiene un pequeño bar en un colegio donde vende chiverías, gaseosa, jugos, emparedados, tajadas con queso y vende ropa interior. Ella invertirá en ambos negocios pero principalmente en la ropa porque es época de temporada alta.
Francis tiene tres niños de 21, 13 y 10 años que están en la escuela. El mayor de sus hijos le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Francis Janethe is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has two businesses. She has a small stand at a school where she sells snacks, soda, juice, sandwiches, and plantain slices with cheese. She also sells undergarments. She will invest in both businesses, but mainly in the clothing business because it is the high season.

Francis has three children, ages 21, 13 and 10, who are in school. Her oldest helps her with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business selling undergarments.

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama cañaveral y se integra de tres personas,  la señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llamas Rogelina, ella es casada  con el señor Arsenio y con quien procreo cuatro hijos  quienes dos ya están casados y dos aun están a su responsabilidad, es de un lugar pequeño y bonito.

    Ella es ama de casa y solito  el préstamo para  invertirlo en la compra  inventa de pollos de granja para luego venderlo destazados  y asados, en donde  lleva trabajado  treinta años y ve que le va bien ya que primero inicio con  la venta de pollos de rancho y después se cambio a los de granja y los dos le dieron bue n resultado.


   Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fue su esposo quien es el  que trabajaba en el rancho y tienen suficiente espacio para criarlos ella se animo y comenzó a criar y venderlo le dio buen resultado y así sigue trabajando.

   Lo que desea es que con el préstamo ella pueda mejorar más sus ingresos, para  seguir apoyando a su hijo que están estudiando.
 
    Las señoras que integran en el grupo son: la señora Guadalupe quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos de Fuler  y así también la señora Aveysilda  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
This group is called Cañaveral  and has three members.  The lady who gave the interview is Rogelina.  She is married to Arsenio and they have four children: two married and two still with them.  They live in a small and pretty village.

Rogelina is a housewife and is requesting the loan to buy poultry to then cut up and roast.  She has been doing this work for thirty years and she sees that it is going well.  She first started the business with yard raised chickens but then she changed to chickens kept in coops,  and both worked out well.


Her husband was the one who gave her the idea since he works on the farm and they have enough room to raise them.  She became interested and started to raise and sell them and since she did well, she continues. 

What she wants from the loan is to improve her business so that she can keep helping her son who is in school.

The other women in the group are: Guadalupe, who will use the loan to buy Fuler cosmetics, and also Aveisilda, who will buy clothing.

loans.use: to buy chickens to cut up and roast

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
GUDELIA 
  necesita otro crédito para la inversión en compra de nateria prima para la confeccion de tejidos y en la venta de ropa típica  Güipiles, Blusas y Cortes  que tiene en su domicilio y así mismo  tener diversidad de  labores y colores ya que en estos últimos meses crecen las ventas en ropa  y también  poder invertir en adornos navideños que tiene ubicada en el parque de su comunidad donde ofrece su producto quien tiene a una persona que le ayuda en atender ese negocio  y en la venta de ropa típica ella  se encuentra atendiendo   así mismo pueda generar mas ganancias  y poder  surtir en la misma su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando  con su venta ya que muchas personas la conocen y la buscan para la compra de su producto  su deseo personal es seguir adelante  para apoyar a sus hijos en  lo que necesiten  agradece a fape  por la confianza que tiene en ella .
texts.en:
Gudelia needs another loan to invest in buying raw materials to make hand-woven items and in the sale of traditional clothes such as güipiles, blouses and skirts she has in her house, and also have a greater variety of items and colors, as clothing sales increase during the last months. She also wants to purchase Christmas decorations to put up in her community park where offers her products.

Se has another person who helps her run the business and sell regional clothes, and she also attends to customers herself. She wants to increase revenues in her business and be able to supply the business. Her greatest wish is to keep selling her products because many people know her and come to her to buy her products.

She wants her business to get ahead so she can help her children get what they need. She thanks FAPE for placing trust in her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make hand-woven items and buy regional clothes.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 47 years old and has three adult children. For the past five years, she has run a restaurant where she sells instant noodles, noodles, and breads for dinner. Ngan earns a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and has punctually repaid her previous loan of 8,736,000 VND. 

Ngan is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy more tables, chairs, and other things for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en:
Fuamata is a 21-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Samata I Uta.  She is single and has no children.  To make a living, Fuamata owns and operates a business venture.  The business operates in the services sector.  The main purpose of the business is operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members.  Fuamata has been engaged in this business for over three years.  From these activities, Fuamata earns approximately 1000 WST a month.

In 2010, Fuamata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Fuamata is requesting a loan from SPBD for the second time.  Her previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1350 WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.  Fuamata plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mrs. Nou is now 69 years old, a widow who has been residing in Baray district. Presently, she lives with two children. Both of them are working to contribute to sustaining the family. At home, Mrs. Nou just takes some time to sell snacks, sweet things and biscuits to small children in the village. However, the main activity of her business is cultivating rice and other crops according to the season and the market demand.

With the loan of KHR 1,000,000, she will buy crop seeds and fertilizers to put on her farmland. In the future, she hopes that she will be able to expand her farmland and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds and fertilizers to put on her farmland.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and lives in Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte. She is married with 7 children. 
Alma has a boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase a material to be used for house repair. 
Alma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her living situation and to be able to support her family especially in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase materials to be used for house repair

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia vive en la zona de Alto San Isidro que esta ubicado a veinticinco minutos del centro de la cuidad, ella esta casada con don Romualdo que trabaja como albañil constructor y juntos tienen cinco hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad y los tres menores se encuentran en edad escolar.  Lucia se dedica al tejido manual de mantas de hilo y lana de alpaca.  Estas mantas son artesanales y se venden a un buen precio pero se llega a tardar una semana en realizar una manta completa más sus flecaduras.  Lucia solicitan el préstamo de dinero para la compra de hilos y lana de alpaca para el tejido de mantas ya que tiene un pedido que entregar, su deseo más grande es poder ver a sus hijos con una profesión y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the Alto San Isidro zone, which is located 25 minutes from the center of the city. She is married to Romualdo who works as a construction worker. Together they have five children, two of which are adults while the three minor children are of school age. 

Lucia makes a living hand weaving cloth and alpaca wool fabrics. These are artisan fabrics and she sells them at a good price. However, it takes her a week to make a complete piece of fabric and more for the fringe.

Lucia is requesting the loan to buy thread and alpaca wool to weave fabric as she already has an order to fulfill. Her biggest dream is to see her children have a profession and be good people.

loans.use: to buy thread and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en: Firdos  is a widow woman. She is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns along with pearls and beads for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase value to the milk.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is a rancher and farmer from Salitre. He has owned his land for over 25 years, but he has lived in the rural area his whole life. Although he has a limited education, he has been able to be successful farming. He is seeking the loan in order to invest in rice now that the rainy season is making the land apt for cultivation. He has five children that he has been able to educate. Two of his children are making their way through college and Tirso wants to keep supporting them.

Tirso is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despite its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention force.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Cultivate rice on his land

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman is local of the town of Beylagan. She is 50 years old and has two childen. She rents a small booth at the local market where she sells womens clothing. Her business in quite new as she started it in 2005. She is still short on her own capital. She wants to increase the variety of clothes she sells, which will help her develop the business. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of $700 from the Normicro Beylagan Branch.

loans.use: to increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz has been running her business for 4 years. She started working in a packaging company, where she managed to save money to start her own business. She was motivated by a friend to start selling these products. She works every day of the week visiting her clients in the area where she lives. She works from 9am to 4pm. Besides, she keeps another business in her house where she sells colas and drinks.

She will invest this loan in purchasing cosmetics and jewelry. And another part of the loan she will invest in supplying her house business with colas, drinks and juices.

Luz is a single mother. She has 5 children who are all studying. She's been able to pull her family through thanks to her work. Her children are very happy with how her mother is facing her responsibility. She wishes to be able to finish building her house little by little. And in this way provide her children with a better living environment. She hopes she can make their dreams come true, with the support she provides them with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Luz tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Se inicio trabajando en una empacadora de donde logro ahorrar dinero para poner su propio negocio. Por medio de una amiga le motivo para trabajar vendiendo estos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana visitando a sus clientes por el sector. Su horario es de 9 a.m. hasta las 16:00 p.m. Además en su domicilio se dedica a la venta de colas y bebidas.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y bisutería. Otra parte del crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio de venta de colas, bebidas, jugos.

Luz es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos los que estudian. Ella ha base de trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Los cuales están contentos con el acto de responsabilidad de su madre. Su deseo es poder poco a poco terminar de construir su casa. Y de esta manera darles un mejor ambiente a ellos. Espera con la ayuda que se le brinda poder cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and drinks

loans.name: Ram Payari

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Payari Napit, 47 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur.  She lives in a single family household with her husband and three sons.

Her husband, Mr. Badri Man Napit, and her 3 sons make traditional idols.  In Nepal, idol making work is very famous and the demand for idols is also increasing.  They now need money to buy raw materials to make more traditional idols to fulfill the demand for idol.

So, she seeks $300 to buy raw materials for making traditional idols.

loans.use: To buy materials for her work

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh N. T. is the mother of 5. Her husband works as a day laborer and she plants rice. Their three children are 6, 9, and 11 years old in school. The family’s average income is $12.50 a month per person, and they would like to apply for a loan of $75 to raise chickens. This would not only provide a source of income for the family, but also provide enough money to continue to educate their children. They will pay back their loan in the next 4 months.

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is a 52-year-old single mother of five children, three girls and two boys. Her boys work in the town as farmers. Her daughters are housekeepers.

For more than eight years, Petrona has been running a small general store. She sells different kinds of foodstuffs, such as bread, butter, seasoning and spices, vegetables and fruits. With her small business, she manages to make a living and take care of her children.

Petrona hopes she can enlarge the store and offer more products to her clientele. She is requesting a loan to buy more goods to sell. Additional income will help the entrepreneur keep on improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Suzan's Group

texts.en:
Suzan L. wants a loan to invest more money in her retail shop. She will also use the loan to open up another shop in order to increase her sales and earn more income in the business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To open up another shop

loans.name: Phoak

texts.en: Mrs. Phoak N., 26, is married and lives with her husband, her parents, and two nephews in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband work as massagers, together making around $8 each day in revenue. Mrs. Phoak N. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. In the future, she would like to save a lot of money to open a grocery store in her area.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima was born in 1987 and she is married. Her husband  works as a waiter and his monthly income is US$ 188. They live with his mother  and their  only income source, beside his salary, is  his mother's pension. They have  a child one year old. She intends to buy chickens with this loan  in the amount  of US$ 750. Her wish  is to became  financially independent.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is a gregarious 31-year-old mother of 2 children. She has been operating a small food stand at the Atasemanso market for 3 years. With her first loan, she was able to increase her inventory and increase her sales. With this second loan, she hopes to begin selling more rice, a staple in many Ghanaian dishes.

In addition to increasing her sales, Augustina hopes to begin saving more for her children's education. She also expressed a dream of building her own house in the future.

Augustina is a member of the trust group God's Mercy. The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Augustina is pictured in the black shirt. Next to her is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for her small food stand

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou Thou, a 42-year-old widowed farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province in Cambodia, started her business in 1980 and earns approximately $1.50 per day. She lives with her two children, both of whom work as goldsmiths earning around $3 per day.


Chou is requesting a loan to diversify her business by purchasing a horse-drawn cart, which she can use to transport goods between villages.

loans.use: To purchase a horse-drawn cart.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị L. is 38, she joined TYM fund in 2002. Her 3 children are attending school. At first she invested in raising livestock. The money was decent. After a few years, with all their savings she and her husband opened a wood supply shop. There are a lot of constructions going on so their business is growing strong. On average, they make 200 USD a month. Because the economy is going strong so it is very favorable to her business. She is requesting a new loan of 1125 USD to buy timber

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. 3 con của chị hiện đều đang học phổ thông. Thời gian đầu chị vay vốn chăn nuôi và cũng thu được một khoản lợi nhuận kha khá. Sau vài năm, chị cũng tích cóp được một số tiền và muốn tận dụng tay nghề mộc của chồng nên chị đã mở một xưởng mộc tại nhà. Hiện nay các công trình xây dựng mọc lên nhiều nên hàng đồ gỗ nhà chị bán rất chạy. Bình quân mỗi tháng chị L. cũng thu khoảng 200USD. Việc kinh doanh tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng vốn tới chị L. xin vay 1125USD để mua thêm gỗ làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Mrs. Doung S., 33, sells groceries from her house and also grows crops. She earns approximately $3 per day from these activities. Her husband, Mr. Sun Seat, is 33 years old. He makes wine and raises pigs, earning approximately $4 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young and in school. The family lives in Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province. They request a loan of $600 to buy more grocery inventory and additional pigs to raise for sale in the market.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory and additional pigs to raise for sale in the market

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru:
Zulhumor Ganievna O. lives in the Gissar region. She is 26 years old and has secondary education. Zulhumor lives with her parents who are retired. She does tailoring and sews national Tajik clothing and wedding gowns. She has been doing this for more than six years. At this time she wants to buy fabrics and beads for sewing of dresses and costumes. She took the advice of her family and decided to apply for a loan with a 10 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Орзукулова Зулхумор Ганиевна жительница района Гисаар.Возраст 26 лет, образование среднее.Зулхумор живет вместе с родителями пенсионерами.Клинтка занимается пошивом и реализацией национального платья и свадебных нарядов.Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 6 лет .В данное время клиентка хочет закупить ткань и бисер для пошива платьев и нарядов. Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредить сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma is a member of the Esmeralda ("Emerald") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin where she operates a general store. The store is located in a space at her house. She started the business to help her husband with household expenses. With his help, she's managed to grow and maintain the business. She started selling on a simple table and she now has a wiD. range of products, a well-stocked inventory and a good customer base who come by from early in the morning to buy her products.

With this loan of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy products such as pasta of various types and brands; canned food; rice; sugar; cooking oil in liter bottles; eggs; canned milk; soft drinks of various types and sizes; toiletries; and detergents, all products demanded by her customers.

Yrma, 49, lives with her husband and 2 children who are the reason she struggles and perseveres at her business each day. She considers herself free to make decisions for and manage her business because she alone is responsible for it. Her charisma and good nature attract customers and she believes that having a well-stocked business also guarantees sales. Her goal is to first develop an appropriate setting for her business at her house and then grow it to be a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yrma es socia del Banco Comunal “Esmeralda “ vive en la región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Sinchi Roca No 370. Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad D. generar sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos D. la casa, con su esfuerzo, ha logrado que su negocio crezca, y se mantenga, comenzó vendiendo sobre una pequeña mesa, actualmente su negocio es muy variado y surtido, tiene buena cantidad D. clientes, quienes acuden desD. muy temprano a comprarle sus productos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, con dicho capital comprará productos como: fideos D. distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas D. litro, huevos en javas, Leche en cajas, bebidas gasificadas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, productos D. aseo personal y detergentes debido a que estos artículos son muy requeridos por sus clientes .

Tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos, motivo D. su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio, por que sola maneja su negocio. Por su carisma y amabilidad en la atención atrae a sus clientes, cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas, su meta es arreglar en su casa un ambiente apropiado para su negocio, quiere llegar a tener un minimarket.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for retail store business.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sharifa J. from Mwanza. She is married with six children between the ages of 3-15. Sharifa has been running a cereal business since 2006, selling rice, maize, flour, and beans. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sharifa currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$350 in order to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Sharifa thanks you for her support!
                                            
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima has been in business as a bicycle taxi owner in Dodoma, Tanzania, for five years. She is now looking to take out a loan to buy an additional bicycle which she will rent out to a driver. Bicycle taxis are a common way of getting around in rural Tanzania, with the passenger sitting on a cushion that is added behind the driver's seat. The business currently nets a profit of approximately $70 each month, but Halima hopes that by adding another bicycle to her business this profit will increase. With the increase in profits, Halima hopes to continue to invest in her business to aid its expansion.

Halima is 44 years old, married and has two children, aged 22 and 7. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will share this loan with her fellow group members, Melea and Fatuma.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle to rent out as a taxi.

loans.name: Deepa

texts.en:
Mrs. Deepa M., resident of Thecho, lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Radhay Shyam M. and he works in a printing press. Her son is now studying in pre-primary school. Mrs. Deepa opened her cosmetic shop two years ago to help her husband to increase their living standards. She sells different varieties of cosmetic goods in her shop, such as face-wash, creams, glass bangles, etc.

Now Mrs. Deepa is requesting a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods for her shop. Mrs. Deepa wants to save her income to provide better education for her child.

loans.use: To buys cosmetic goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in more clothing to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Vu

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Vụ năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại chồng và con trai lớn của chị đang đi lao động tại nước ngoài còn chị Vụ ở nhà chăn nuôivà buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán và sự hỗ trợ của chồng, con kinh tế gia đình chị  Vụ đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị Vụ mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Vu is 42 years old, and joined TYM fund since 1996. Her family consists of 3 children, 1 of which is now grown. Currently her husband and her eldest son are doing labor work in another country. Ms. Vu stays home to raise animals and run a grocery store. With income of 287 USD from raising animals, her grocery store and assistance from her husband and son, her family economic situation is expanding and getting more stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to purchase additional merchandise to meet the customers' demands.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is a lovely 54 year old woman, who lives with her 3 children. She runs a small fabric selling business where she offers to the market, a variety types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thereby improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day, but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Khosiyat and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods for resale

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo " San Martín " esta representado por la señora  Inés y conformado por 13 miembros dentro de los cuales se pueden encontrar un parentesco entre la señora Maria Delcy y su hermana Dica Patricia ellas son casadas y tienen sus ingresos independientes una de la otra. En su mayoría los miembros del grupo se dedican al comercio de productos como la ropa, comida, cosméticos, artesanías, condimentos, venta de productos en bazar y al servicio de transporte público de pasajeros. Dentro del rubro comercial existe mucha demanda de productos pero también existen quienes las ofertan, por lo que los clientes se inclinan es a un producto de buena calidad y a un bajo precio, es por este motivo que las socias desean el crédito para poder ofrecer ese tipo de productos y mejora así sus ingreso y poder mejor así la calidad de vida de sus familias. Entre las socias hay quienes tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios y otras que reciben su primer financiamiento pero se sienten capaces de poder cumplir con su grupo y con la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda la oportunidad de un financiamiento con grandes ventajas.
texts.en:
The " San Martín " group, represented by Mrs. Inés, has 13 members. This includes two sisters - Mrs. Maria Delcy and Mrs. Dica Patricia - but they are both married and each of their incomes is independent from the other's. The group's members run a variety of businesses, driving taxis or selling products like clothing, meals, cosmetics, crafts, and sauces.There is a high demand for these products but there is also a large number of people selling them, so customers are naturally inclined to purchase only those products that are of the best quality and that are being sold at the lowest price. This is why the group's members are requesting this loan, so that they have the working capital needed to offer the best products at the lowest price and thus, increase their incomes and their families' quality of life. Some of the group's members have a lot of experience with communal banking and for others this is their first loan, but they feel capable, as a group and as clients of the Agrocapital Foundation, of making their payments punctually and taking advantage of the great opportunities this loan will bring.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng C., 46, and her husband Mr. Sokhan Sao, 49, were married in 1992. They have five children, two sons and three daughters. One of their daughters works selling Chinese noodles in Phnom Penh. The other four children still attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phnom Penh is the capital city of Cambodia.

Sokheng has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who them takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a chef. He cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in his village and in the nearby village.

Sokheng does not have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan of $150 to use so she can buy more silk weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Guadalupe Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe M. originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega con mucho sacrificio se dedica a trabajar para llevar a cabo su obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda la cual hoy en día requiere de su inversión por lo que su vivienda ha atravesado muchos problemas como lo son fenómenos naturales y desgaste de los materiales.  

Port al motivo es que ella espera confiadamente en Ceprodel para así obtener la pintura para la vivienda y algunos materiales para construir y seguir adelante siempre brindado buenas condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe M. is from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. With a lot of sacrifice she has dedicated herself to work to carry out her labor of reconstruction of her home. The home currently requires investment because it has come across a lot of problems such as natural disasters and the wearing out of materials.

For that reason she hopes confidently in Ceprodel to obtain paint for her home and some construction materials, and to keep moving forward providing good living conditions for her family that needs so much of her support.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint for her home

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa M. is 54 years old, a widower and has three children to support. She has been engaged in her buying and selling business for two years now. She buys raw banana, copra and raw potatoes in neighboring villages. With the help of her children, she delivers her products to the city every Friday.

Josefa wants to open up a mini-grocery store to cater for those slack days she has. With HSPFI's micro-finance program she was able to gain access for funding. She has already finished her small stall behind her house ready for her mini-grocery store business. To start her mini-grocery store, she needs an amount of PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To finance a mini-grocery store of her own

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cristina  Toribio

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente sin hijos, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el MMR desde medio año inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió iniciar su negocio de compra de alpacas vivas. 

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio ya que ella compra animales vivos luego los comercializa como carcasa, lo cual le permite incrementar su capital, de la misma forma agradece al MMR por la confianza y el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres para poder apoyar a su familia económicamente.  Su mayor deseo poner una tienda y culminar la construcción de su casa, asi mismo decea poner un criadero de truchas, le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 35, in a common law marriage, and has no children. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood. She completed elementary school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for half of a year. She started with a loan for 500 PEN, which allowed her to start her business of buying live alpacas. She currently needs a new loan for 800 PEN to expand her business. She buys live animals and later sells the meat. This allows her to increase her capital. She is grateful to MMR for the confidence and support they give women so that they can support their families. Her biggest wish is to have a store and to finish the construction on her house. For herself, she would like to be able to have a trout farm. She likes the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell small livestock like sheep and pigs

loans.name: Rahmatullah

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Rahmatullah the son of H.. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 and has 25 years of experience in agriculture.

He would like to progress and bring some new changes to his business. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase more seeds and tools for farming.

He is happy that through these effective processes the entrepreneurs can solve their problems and can develop their businesses as well.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and tools

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay A. is from the village of Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old, is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to improve his business. Jay repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, which he used to purchase tires and other accessories. Jay is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and pay the school tuition for his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

location.town: Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат Зокирова проживает  в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Саломат более 18 лет, занимается изготовлением "набада" , т.е. национального варенного сахара. Клиентка просит кредит, дял закупа сырья и увеличения производства.
texts.en:
Salomat Z. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Salomat has been making nabad or traditional cooked sugar for over 18 years. Our client is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials and increase production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 55 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida en un colegio de su localidad. Todas las mañanas cocina en su casa y lleva las porciones al centro educativo que se encuentra cercano a su casa. La comida que prepara es para los profesores y alumnos, permaneciendo en la institución hasta las 3 de la tarde y en otras ocasiones hasta las 5 de la tarde. De esta manera, Esther se genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, además disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar y sigue activa para apoyar en la educación de su hija que estudia en la universidad. Esther sueña con tener un restaurante y atender durante todo el día. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal y siempre infunde en las demás integrantes la responsabilidad. El préstamo que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para seguir preparando sus comidas.
texts.en:
Esther is 55 years old. She lives with her daughter in a house she owns. She's been selling food at a local school for three years. Every morning she cooks at home and takes the meals to the school near her house. Her food is for the teachers and students, and she stays at the school until 3 in the afternoon, sometimes until 5. Esther is able to earn enough this way to cover her family's living expenses. She also enjoys her work because she likes to cook. She still helps support her daughter, who is studying in the university. Esther dreams of opening a restaurant and working there during the day. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the founders of her communal bank and she always inspires more responsibility in the other members. The requested loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk for the meals she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 38-year-old father of four who sells second-hand clothes on the streets of Nairobi. He has repaid three other loans successfully and is now requesting a fourth loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy additional trousers for his inventory. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper and enable him to educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and diligent.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Through the initiative and patience of Margarita she is able to improve her mushroom production business that is located in the village of Isidro Paredes of Diffun Quirino. The business is situated in their backyard that is why she is able to maintain it well to produce more kilos of mushrooms every week. In connection with this she is asking for financial supports from Kiva lenders to be able to further improve her business and sells bigger amount of mushrooms to her costumers. She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 as additional business capital. 

Margarita is already 45 years old. She is married to Francisco M. Sr. They are blessed with four children, one is already married. Her youngest child just finished a two- year course in college. Margarita expects a higher income in her next harvest and hopes that with the financial support from Kiva lenders, her mushroom business will grow.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Menjani Group

texts.en:
Rael is a member of the Menjani borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 48 years old woman, she is married and a mother of 6 children. Her children are 25,23,20,13, and 11 years old.

Rael has  owned a maize business for 15 years. She works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rael`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania, she requested the amount  of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rael hopes to save money and expand her business.

Naitoboak is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the loan amount 200,000 In order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells tiger nut pudding; she buys tiger nuts and process it to get her pudding at Elmina.  Elizabeth has received junior high school education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. Elizabeth has been selling tiger nut pudding since 1997. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more tiger nuts to prepare her pudding for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more tiger nuts to prepare her pudding for sale.

loans.name: Khazi

texts.en:
Khazi K. is married with two children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.
Khazi has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of confectioneries. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise nine years ago with starting capital of $200. Over time he expanded his business and it has now become domestic as his family helps him with it.

Today, Khazi needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase and diversify merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating his retail shop in Naivasha for the last 10 years.  He is 64 years old, married to Ann Wairimu and has 2 children who are still in high school.

John was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his second loan.  He paid off his first loan in full, which he used to expand his business premises. With this loan, John will purchase more cereal to sell in his shop.

In the future, John wants to expand his business and supply cereal at both the retail and wholesale level.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from their website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to customers

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosita del Carmen tiene 39 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que cada financiamiento que se le ha otorgado ha logrado cambiar un poco la situación económica de su hogar. Rosita tiene 2 hijos sus edades son de 20 y 8 años. Su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida, cuando ella dio inicio a este negocio su esposo no tenía trabajo y ambos buscaron una fuente de ingresos, y todo surgió con una idea y Rosita le gustaba mucho la cocina por lo que aprovecharon esta especialidad, y así los fines de semana algunos vecinos le encargaron sus platillos. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, plátanos, maduro, azúcar y verduras. Sus sueños son de establecer un restaurante en donde el ambiente sea familiar.
texts.en:
Rosita del Carmen is 39 years old and has worked with the Foundation for a long time. With each loan that she has received, Rosita has been able to make small improvements to her financial situation. She has two children, ages 20 and 8.

Rosita prepares and sells food. When she started this business, her husband was unemployed and both of them were looking for a source of income. Rosita came up with this idea because she enjoys cooking and had to take advantage of her specialty. On the weekends, a few of her neighbors request that she prepare her dishes for them.

She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains (such as rice), beans, ripened bananas, sugar, and vegetables. Rosita dreams of establishing a restaurant with a family atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy ingredients

loans.name: Tuichiboy

texts.en: S. Tuichiboy is a father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past six years, cultivating corn, potatoes and onions.
