His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits, so that his 4 children can continue their education. Tuichiboy has dreamed of extending his lands and wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Colita

texts.en:
Colita C. is from the town of Bugayong, Binalonan Pangasinan. She is 47 years old. Colita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Colita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including dried fish, shrimp, and fish sauce in the local community. Colita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Colita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Colita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Colita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San Rose

texts.en:
San Rose P. is from the village of Taboo in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. San Rose is married and has one young child. To make a living, San Rose makes and sells chicken and hotdog barbecue in the local community. San Rose has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, San Rose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. San Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her food. This will be San Rose's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food that she makes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To establish her shop

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita M. N., tiene la edad de 47 años, es soltera, y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 14 y 16 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca.El proyecto básicamente consiste en hacer almácigos de café. Ella desea hacer los almácigos de café, luego sembrar una parte y vender la otra  a otros agricultores. El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitirle tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron, dice que esto le ha ayudado a sacar adelante sus proyectos.Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos los estudios y una mejor calidad de vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita M. N. is 47 years old. She is single and has two children who are her main priority. The children are 14 and 16 years old, respectively. She wants this loan in order to help her farm. The basic project consists in making seedbeds for coffee. She wants to make the seedbeds, then plant part of them and sell the rest to other farmers. By maintaining the plants adequately, she will have a better harvest and then she will have greater economic earnings. This is not her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the opportunities given. She says that this has helped her make progress with her projects. She hopes in the future, she will give her children an education and a better quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm assistance

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Colector del distrito D. San José, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.                                                                                             
Se dedica a la ganadería desD. hace más D. siete años, cría vacas para comercializar la leche que estas producen, actualmente tiene tres vacas en producción, las cuales le producen un promedio D. 26 litros diarios, los que venD. a una empresa acopiadora a un precio D. 0.90 céntimos el litro.

Adicionalmente cría ovejas y cuyes para venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente recorren la zona. Ella nos comenta que estos negocios le ayudan a solventar los gastos familiares, ya que lo que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no es suficiente para sostenerlos.

Maximina se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la refacción del techo D. su vivienda, ya que las lluvias D. esta temporada veraniega ha causado estragos en el.

Ella es una madre trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una adecuada educación. En la fotografía Maximina nos muestra una D. las ovejas que cría, ya que sus vacas se encontraban pastando en un terreno alejado del lugar.
texts.en:
Maximina is 44 and married. She lives with her husband and their four children in the Colector sector in the San José district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chilayo. She has been working with livestock for over six years. She raises cows in order to sell the milk that they produce. She currently has three cows that produce milk. They produce an average of 23 liters daily. She sells them to a wholesale business for the price of 0.90 céntimos per liter. She also raises sheep and guinea pigs to sell to the merchants who visit the area. She tells us that these businesses help her pay the family expenses. What her husband receives as a farm worker is not enough to support them. Maximina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to use it to repair the roof of her house. The summer rains have wreaked havoc on it. She is a hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to get her children ahead and give them an adequate education. In the photograph Maximina is showing us one of the sheep she is raising because the cows are grazing in a remote field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Rosa Amleia

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca  es conocida por su gran producción ganadera y lechera, también su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura pues en gran parte los jóvenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades del Ecuador o fuera del país en busca de mejores días para toda la familia por lo que ahora podemos apreciar muchas extensiones de tierra abandonados puesto que ya no hay quien las trabaje, es por eso que ahora encontramos a las mujeres agrupadas en grupos de trabajo para salir adelante en su propia  tierra.

Rosa G. es socia de éste banco  es una mujer  que siempre nos llena con su alegría en todo momento, esta cursando su segundo ciclo en el banco comunal, ella  posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 8 años  laborando todos los dias  de 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero siempre agradece a Dios por el trabajo diario, también se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos la cual la realiza en su misma casa.

Ella vive en la parroquia Cumbe en el sector 24 de Mayo Alto, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada  pero solo vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 11 años pues su esposo hace tres años migro del país para brindarles una mejor educación y estabilidad económica, gracias al trabajo y apoyo de pareja ahora cuentan con su casa propia, con el crédito solicitado abastecerá su tienda de abarrotes  comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, articulos de cuidado personal, etc.,

Su mayor sueño es que su  esposo regrese para estar toda la familia junta.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso communal bank is found in Cumbe parish to the southeast of the city of Cuenca. It’s know for it’s large cattle and milk production. The adults also work in agriculture. The young people have mostly migrated to the big cities of Ecuador or out of the country looking for better days for the whole family. That is why we can observe many extensions of land abandoned since there isn’t anyone to work it. This is why we now find the women grouped in work groups to get ahead on their own land. Rosa G. is a member of this bank. She is a woman who always fills us with her joy at each moment. She is in her second cycle with the communal bank. She has had a small grocery store for the past 8 years. She has worked every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She tells us there are good days and bad days but she always thanks God for the daily work. She also raises and sells chickens which she does from her own home. She lives in Cumbre parish, section 24 of Mayo Alto. She is 33 years old. She is married but lives alone with her two children who are 14 and 11 years old. Her husband migrated from the country three years ago to offer them a better education and economic stability. Thanks to work and the support of her husband, she now has her own house. She will stock her grocery store buying rice, sugar, oil, personal care products, etc. with the loan she applied for. Her biggest dream is that her husband returns so the family is all together.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, pasta and personal care products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
H. Abdulatif is 22 years old and makes a living by providing taxi services. He has been in this business for the last two years and has gained a lot of experience in that time. Abdulatif has always worked hard to provide quality service at an attractive price. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable because he is the main bread-winner for a large family and must work from early morning till to late at night in order to keep his current customers and win new ones. He is applying for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to repair his car. Abdulatif thanks everyone for their interest and support, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner because he is so committed to expanding his business and improving the well-being of his family.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Adedoyin

texts.en: Adedoyin is a 40-year-old married mother of five children, all attending school, and this gives her joy. Her husband also works to meet the basic needs of their family. Adedoyin lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with her customers. Adedoyin is now requesting a loan amount of 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nora Helen

texts.es:
En el sector  Lomas del Viento en la parroquia Andrés de Vera de la ciudad de Portoviejo   se reúne el banco comunal del mismo nombre.  Sus integrantes tienen un  gran compañerismo y responsabilidad con sus pagos, conversamos con varias socias entre ellas la señora Nora,  ella está casada desde hace 17 años y  tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es docente con el que  mantiene una muy buena relación en el hogar.

Nuestra socia es comerciante informal de productos de belleza en las marcas de Yanbal y Esika en este último recién ingreso para probar como le va con ésta nueva línea de cosméticos, lleva  ocho  años  en ésta actividad y lo hace para aportar  económicamente  a su familia y además porque siempre le han gustado las ventas.

Con los prestamos que recibe de la fundación ha podido hacer crecer su capital, con el nuevo crédito invertirá en perfumes, maquillajes, cremas, y bisutería, puesto que  cada 15 días tiene que cubrir los pagos de los productos y por ello ha decidido comprar al contado la mercadería  y así darles  más tiempo de  crédito a sus clientes fijos,  por lo general de lo que invierte gana el 30 % y eso lo invierte  para incrementar su negocio. 

La señora Nora ha tenido que pasar por momento difíciles que no le han permitido terminar sus estudios secundarios por eso ahora estudia por las noches para lograr el bachillerato y luego seguir sus estudios superiores  y alcanzar su máximo sueño que es ser profesional.
texts.en:
The Lomas del Viento area in the Andrés de Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo is where the communal bank of the same name meets. Its members are very compatible, and responsible with their payments. We talked with several of the members -one of whom is Mrs. Nora. She has been married for 17 years and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher and they have a good familial relationship. Our member sells beauty products but not in a store. The brands that she sells are Yanbal and Esika. She has only recently started handling Esika and she is seeing how this cosmetic line works out. She has been in this business for eight years and she does it to help with the financial support of her family and also because she likes sales. With the loan she has received from the foundation she has been able to grow her capital. With this new loan she will buy perfumes, makeup, creams and costume jewelry. She has to pay for the products every 15 days and that is why she decided to purchase the merchandise with cash. That way she can give her regular customers more time to repay her on credit. In general when she sells, she earns 30% and that she reinvests into increasing her business. Mrs. Nora has had some difficult times that didn’t allow her to finish secondary school. This is why she now studies at night-so that she can get her diploma and continue with higher studies so that she can achieve her biggest dream of being a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, makeup, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila M. is a small business owner and married woman. She runs a business as a food vendor (café) in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. She sells different kinds of cooked food, fried food and soft drinks. She purchases the food items from the food shops and food market at the Buguruni food market shopping center. She has been in the business for five years. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods so as to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to expand the business

loans.name: Zaratou

texts.fr: cette jeune femme est célibataire, afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens, elle a entamé l'année dernière le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle dresse son étalage de marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. Elle veut agrandir son étalage de marchandises, pour cette raison, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour agrandir son commerce avec divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and, in order to meet her daily needs, started a business last year selling cosmetics. She sets up her stall in front of her house. She wants to increase the size of her stall and for this reason is requesting a loan from WAGES so she can add miscellaneous dry goods to her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ndeff Leng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NDEFF LENG est créé depuis 3 ans, il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, elles sont âgées de 30 à 50 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. La proximité du marché hebdomadaire, marché situé dans le village, contribue beaucoup au bon déroulement des activités commerciales du groupe et des femmes en général. Une aspect qui contribue également au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités consistent  la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Saye D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en écharpe jaune  est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de mil décortiqué elle mène cette activité depuis 04 ans. L’objet de son nouveau  prêt est de renforcer sa production. Et son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
Le groupe de solidarité, en sus de ses remboursements réguliers, mobilise mensuellement des épargnes.
texts.en:
The NDEFF LENG group was created three years ago. It consists of ten women, all from the same village. They came together through personal affinities, are from 30 to 50 years of age, and have at least two children. The proximity of the weekly market located inside the village, contributes greatly to the well-functioning of the group’s commercial activities and that of women in general. It also contributes to the economic development of the village and its surrounding area. The new solidarity loan will enable the group to strengthen its economic activities and diversify them. Their activities currently include the sale of local grain cereals, sea-food products, ground nuts, and ice cream for those in possession of a freezer. Mrs Saye D., the president of the solidarity group (on the left of the photo wearing a yellow scarf), is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children. She specialised four years ago in the sales activity of hulled millet grain. She will use her new loan to increase her production. Her objective is to increase her profits and participate in improving her family’s living conditions, providing food and health and educational coverage for her children. Despite its regular loan repayments, the solidarity group insists on monthly savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's economic initiatives

loans.name: Clementina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora clementina V. es casada y con 2 hijos los cuales están en escuela secundaria, su esposo tiene el oficio de albañil y carpintero y trabajo por cuenta propia, viven en la comarca los zanjones Nº 2 Posoltega y es en la misma comarca donde Clementina trabaja, ya que ella es maestra de educación primaria y labora para la Escuela Julia Martinez Toruño desde hace 23 años.
La profesora Clementina esta siendo beneficiada por un organismo el cual les va facilitar 1,500 palitos de eucalipto por manzana para reforestación y es para dicho proyecto que ella solicito su tercer crédito en Ceprodel, ya que con una parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insecticidas y pago de la limpia del terreno y el resto para otros gastos en su casa de habitación.
Con Ceprodel trabaja desde el año 2007 y hasta el momento tiene un buen record crediticio, ya que ha sabido ser responsable con su obligación.
texts.en:
Señora Clementina V. is married and has 2 children who are in secondary school. Her husband is a builder and carpenter and works for himself. They live in the region Los Zanjones Nº 2 Posoltega and in the same zone where Clementina works. She is a primary school teacher and has worked for the Julia Martinez Toruño school for 23 years. Profesora Clementina is being favoured by an organisation which is going to provide her with a block of 1,500 eucalyptus seedlings for reforestation. It's for this said project that she is seeking her third loan with Ceprodel. She will invest part of the money in the purchase of insecticides and to pay for the land to be cleared, and the rest will go towards household costs. Clemetina has been working with Ceprodel since 2007 and has a good credit record with them, as she knows about being responsible with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reforestation of 2 Mz of eucalyptus (purchase insecticides, pay for clearing of 2mz of land)

loans.name: Nanecia

texts.en:
Nanecia B. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Nanecia owns and operates a balut or special cooked-egg business. Nanecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nanecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanecia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nanecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Everlito

texts.en:
Everlito G. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. He is 53 years old and married with 5 adult children. To make a living, Everlito has run a motorcycle transport service for over 10 years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.  He recently joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everlito is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a business transport vehicle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock pairs of shoes and saddles to sell.  Rose is 49 years old and widowed. She has seven children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

loans.use: Stock pairs of shoes and saddles to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen M., 69 years old, owns a small shop next to her house where she sells food to people who come across the road. She typically makes around $3 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. Although she is now a single woman, she is a fantastic mother who has tried to ensure that her children have suitable jobs. 

Pen M. is running her business well because she has skills in communication that she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Pen M. wishes to have more money to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her profits

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel L. is from the village of Sinait. He is 45 years old. Noel is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Noel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Noel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Noel is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Katiuska Giomar

texts.es:
Katiuska de 31 años, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña dulcería. Vive en una zona suburbana en Guayaquil con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo. 

Para generar dinero y hacer una actividad que a ella le guste inicio con la venta de dulces y bocaditos que ella mismo elabora, para que la conozcan ella fue a dar una charla en el Municipio de Guayaquil para que la gente pruebe los dulces. Por esa buena decisión ella tubo suficiente clientela para continuar con su negocio y elaborar dulces y bocaditos de todo tipo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar confites, galletas y harina para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y su negocio en un buen local.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 31, and has a small sweetshop in her house. She lives in a suburb of Guayaquil, with her 4 children and her husband. To make money and do something she enjoys, she started selling the sweets and snacks that she makes. So that people would know about her, she went to give a talk in the City of Guayaquil and gave people the chance to try her sweets. Because of this good decision, she has plenty of customers to maintain her business and can keep making sweets and snacks of all kinds. With the loan she wants to buy candies, biscuits and flour for her business. In the future she would like to have her own home and business in a good location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy, flour, cookies

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: The young woman in the photograph is Srey T., age 29, who lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, which is the best territory for farming. Srey T. is a married woman. Srey T. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She and her husband are local farmers who have spent almost their whole life in the fields. They are able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. This rainy season, she doesn’t have funds yet to use on her farm. So, Srey T. is looking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus padres y trabaja cada día para que no les falte nada. Este carismático hombre aprendió desde muy joven todo sobre cosmetología. Luego de varios años de trabajar en diversos negocios, con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar su propio salón de belleza en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad donde no había competencia. Es así como adquirió gran cantidad de clientes que hasta hoy en día  lo visitan pues confían en la calidad del servicio de corte y arreglo personal que él ofrece. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues se entretiene conversando con sus clientes de siempre; además obtiene regulares ganancias que le han permitido mejorar su negocio para la comodidad de sus visitantes. Aunque trabaja sin ayuda, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, no se cansa y tiene muchos planes para en el futuro mejorar el negocio ya que quiere comprar los implementos modernos que le hacen falta. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Miguel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un vaporizador y algunos implementos que le hacen falta en su salón de belleza, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Miguel is 40 years old and lives in his own home alongside his parents.  He works every day so that they don't need for anything.  This charismatic man has learned all about cosmetology from a young age.  After several years working in different businesses, he made a lot of effort and managed to set up his own beauty salon in a densely-populated neighborhood in the north of the city where there was no competition.  This is how he acquired a large number of customers who still come to see him since they trust the quality of the haircut and hairstyling services which he offers.  He likes his work a lot because he has fun chatting to his long-standing customers.  He also makes regular profits which have enabled him to improve his business for the comfort of his customers.  Although he works without help from 8 in the morning until 9 in the evening, he doesn't get tired and he has many plans for the future.  He would like to improve his business since he wants to buy modern tools which he lacks.  This is the first loan which he has had with MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner since he doesn't want to let down those people who are making the loan possible.  The loan will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Miguel plans to invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of a hood dryer and some other tools which he needs in his beauty salon.  In this way he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy a hood dryer and tools for his beauty salon

loans.name: Silvia Zoila

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, con cinco hijos y con grado de instrucción primaria completa.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.500. 00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas y coca en hoja.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio de venta de golosinas y de hoja de coca. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es el ahorro y sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the “Micaela Bastidas” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 68 years old and a widow.  She has five children and completed her primary education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she invested in her business selling candies and coca leaf.

She is now requesting a new loan for 500 nuevos soles which she will invest in her business selling candies and coca leaf.

Her dream is to get ahead in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the savings and her profits.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling candies and coca leaf

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever vive en casa de su hermana en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, el señor trabaja en la construcción en viviendas particulares, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene, es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito que solicita es para la construcción de una habitación en la casa de su hermana, para poder vivir más confortablemente, pues actualmente está incomodo.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ever is single and lives in his sister’s home in the Llojeta zone, of the city of La Paz.  He does construction in private homes and supports himself with this income.  This is his first loan request.

He is asking for this loan in order to build a room in his sister’s home, so that he can live more comfortably, since he is not very comfortable now.

His socioeconomic status qualifies him for a new loan.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: Osman tiene 3 hijos él es un padre luchador y responsable. Su actividad es una pulpería, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, porque ha sido  ingreso necesario para su hogar. El dio inicio a su negocio hace 7 años, pues siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a su familia. Tiene cierta experiencia con los créditos y con su negocio, pues ha sido muy gratificante para el obtener un medio de vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y grano básicos.
texts.en:
Osman has three children and is a hardworking and responsible father. His business is a general store. His has been working with Fundación León for some time, as he has needed funds for his home. 

Osman started his business seven years ago, as he has always wanted to help his family get ahead. He has significant experience with business loans and with business, and it has been very gratifying to make a living this way.

This loan will be used to buy cookies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and basic staples for the store.

loans.use: Cookies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and basic staples for general store.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus seis hijos en el centro poblado menor Motupillo, del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace más de 30 años, el tiempo que lleva viviendo en la zona, usualmente siembra caña, maíz y yuca. Actualmente planea instalar un cultivo de maíz para solventar la economía de su familia. 

Este negocio no es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta, ya que es consciente de que los ingresos que percibe por agricultura son temporales, por ello también se gana la criando y vendiendo cuyes  para consumo humano, el  cría sus animales en su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive.

Tomás desea adquirir financiamiento para instalar su cultivo de maíz, además de brindarle un buen mantenimiento para asegurarse una buena producción. Por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Tomás ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también solicitó el crédito para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz y gracias a ello puedo obtener una buena cosecha, motivo por el cual se encuentra bastante agradecido con la comunidad de prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Tomás, age 62, lives with his wife and three of their six children.  They live in center of a small town called Motupillo, in the Pítipo district.  It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has worked in agriculture for more than thirty years, the whole time he has lived in the area.  He usually grows sugar cane, corn and yucca.  He is now planning to plant corn in order to pay the family expenses.

This business is not his only source of income.  He is aware that the income he receives from farming is seasonal, which is why he also raises and sells guinea pigs for human consumption.  He raises his animals at his home in order to sell them to the
businessmen who usually visit the area where he lives.

Tomás wants a loan to plant his corn crop.   He also wants to provide good maintenance in order to assure good production. For this reason he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles to help him achieve his objective. 

Tomás has had a loan from Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and their Capital Semilla (Seed Capital) project.  With that opportunity he also asked for a loan to provide maintenance on his corn crop.  Thanks to the loan, he was able to have a good harvest.  That is why he is very grateful to the community of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expenses to plant and provide maintenance on his corn crop

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
65-year-old Zakaria G. is a farmer in Nyamira town, western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years and employs one farmhand. His main products are tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He also owns and operates a kiosk in the same region. He is married with seven children who are all adults.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring at least three quality dairy cows that will improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun V., 48, is married and lives with her three young children in the Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than US $1 each day, while her husband works in a garment factory making US $10 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Yun V. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to purchase more farmland to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Ruzahon's Group

texts.en:
Ruzahon S., 18, is the treasurer of this group. She lives with her family. Her father works at a school and her mother is engaged in farming. She has two brothers, the first works in construction and the second is at school. In order to earn money Ruzahon sews Kyrgyz national cloth and sells dressmaking supplies. In this way she earns 2500 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Ruzahon wants to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of seeds for farming. In the future she wants to open a sewing workshop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Deoun

texts.en: Deoun Y., 57, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. Deoun and her husband are farmers and raise pigs to sell, earning an income of USD 5 each day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Deoun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 30 years old and single. He takes care of one child who is five years old. For two years, he has owned a small restaurant and pub which sells food and drinks. His business is open from 6 am until 12 pm every day and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more food and drinks for his restaurant and pub. He hope to earn more profits. He expects to reinvest his profits in the business.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant and pub

loans.name: Gundash

texts.en: Gundash, 26, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. His wife works at a gas station and his older daughter attends a local primary school, while his youngest daughter goes to a kindergarten. Gundash began operating a transportation business in 2008. He transports coal and other goods by his mini-truck. He is trying to increase his profits and improve the living situation of his family. He is a modest and hardworking person who said, "I would like to build a bigger house with heating where we can have a comfortable life." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
Beteliana A. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Beteliana is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Beteliana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells items such as canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and bread in the local community. Beteliana has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beteliana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beteliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Beteliana is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods, snack foods, and instant noodles. This loan will be Beteliana's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, snack foods, and instant noodles

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is 30 years old.  She is currently in the business of selling food.  She is married to a farmer and they have three children, all of whom are in school.  Her future goal is to buy more goods.

loans.use: stock more food

loans.name: Nohy

texts.es: Nohy, de 20 años; es un responsable hijo. Pues cuida y apoya a su mamá Rosalinda, su papá César y sus 2 hermanos. Con quienes vive en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Con la seriedad que lo caracteriza, cuenta que hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura. Desde muy joven asumió las responsabilidades de sus terrenos agrícolas, decidiendo que nuevos frutos sembrará y la distribución de los ingresos, juntamente con sus padres, a los que apoya incondicionalmente, con la ilusión de poder verlos descansar y brindarles la tranquilidad que necesiten. De los terrenos agrícolas que posee, tiene 2 hectáreas propias, que le fueron heredados por sus padres. Donde siembra papa de todas las variedades; los cuales después de un buen cuidado y mucho esmero los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus cultivos. Por ello más adelante desea mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, invirtiendo mayor capital de trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo que le brindaron. Nohy, tiene sembrado 20 sacos de papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales (guano de corral), para asegurar el crecimiento de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nohy, age 20, is a responsable son.  He takes care of and supports his mother, Rosalinda; his father, César; and his two siblings.  He lives with his family in his own house, which is located  in the rural community of Cayan.

With his characteristic seriousness, he has been farming for five years.  Ever since he was very young he has assumed the responsibilities for the farmland.  He decided that he would plant new fruits and share the income with his parents, who he supports unconditionally.  He hopes to be able to see them rest and to offer them the peace of mind that they need.

He has two of his own hectares of the farmland, which were inherited from his parents.  He grows all varieties of potatoes.  After taking good care of them with much dedication, he sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  What he likes the most about his work is being able to see his crops grow.  Later he wants to improve the quality of his crops by investing more working capital.

He belongs to the Unión por el Trabajo (Unity Through Work) Communal Bank.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the support given to him.  Nohy has planted 20 sacks of the “yungay” (similar to a yellow potato) variety of potato.  He will use the requested money to buy sacks of natural fertilizer (guano) to assure the growth of his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer like guano.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Tessie is married and has six school-aged children. 

To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tessie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and breads. This will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and breads.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group A

texts.en:
There are downsides in every kind of business one involves himself or herself in. 

38-year-old Joseph says that, though his business is fraught with lots of competition and other operational uncertainties, he is still a good credit risk, owing to the fact that he has been in this business for nine years. This, he says, is not an easy feat in his kind of business.

He says he is still going strong and he always goes to any length to ensure that his business is making progress. 

Joseph is an enterprising business man who says he buys timber from as far away as Mbale in eastern Uganda. Though he has enough in his reserves, he is still pitted in competition in his business against many other already established and up-and-coming timber sales business men.

His advantage has always been that he is able to sell his timber to more flourishing timber markets in Kampala. 

The happily married father of three says it's a business he began with savings from his erstwhile charcoal sales business. Hard work is the key to success in any business undertaking, Joseph says.

Monthly, this business generates him 350,000 shillings as sales profits and he says with this Kiva loan, he is going to purchase more substantial amounts of timber to resell.

loans.use: to buy more timber to resell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is 46 years old. She has 5 children who are between 9 and 17 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Stephanie sells a local drink called Ubushera, made out of sorghum. This business has enabled her meet her needs and feed her family as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and continue making more Ubushera. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa cuenta con quince miembros. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. El comité surge a consecuencia D. que una D. las integrante oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, y como les gusto mucho la idea se organizaron y D. allí surgió el comité.
Estas mujeres se denominan a ellas mismas como personas muy trabajadoras que luchan cada día por brindarles a sus familias el sustento. Ellas aseguran que todo el sacrificio es por sus hijos y familiares y quieren, para ellos,  una vida mejor D. las ellas tuvieron.
La Sra. Angelina se dedica a la venta D. ropas D. todas las estaciones, por medio D. este digno oficio ella ha podido brindarse y brindarles a sus familiares una vida decorosa. Esta orgullosa D. que por medio D. su trabajo los que dependan D. ella puedan acceder a un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. mas ropas, para la renovación del stock, para su posterior venta. DesD. ya agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee has fifteen members. All of them are friends and neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso. The committee arose because one of the members had heard people talking about the program for entrepreneurial women, and since they liked the idea a lot, they organized themselves and formed the committee. 

These women describe themselves as very hard-working people who struggle each day to proviD. sustenance for their families. They affirm that all of their sacrifices are for their children and family members; they want to proviD. a better life for their families than the one they experienced. 

Angelina works selling clothing for all seasons of the year. Through this valued profession, she has been able to proviD. a decent living for herself and her family. She is proud that thanks to her work, the people who depend on her will have access to a better future. 

She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing, in order to renew her stock for future resale. She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 42 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a business buying and selling Nipa palm fronds in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Nipa palm fronds to sell. Elma has been in this business for two years.

In the future Elma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Nipa palm fronds to sell.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.ru:
Гарник родился в 1951 г. в селе Агарак, окончил сельскую среднюю школу и Капанский Горный техникум, где получил специальность геодезиста. Женат имеет сына и три дочери; все дети имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Жена  не работает. Гарник работает на Зангезурском Медно-Молибденовом комбинате оператором, жена занимается домашним хозяйством. 
Начиная с 1995 г., параллельно со своей работой на комбинате, Гарник  занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Шхаршик (Shgharshik village): разводит пчел, а также занимается куплей-продажей и обработкой шкур крупного рогатого скота.  Полученный мед Гарник продает на Капанском городском рынке, а обработанные шкуры продает своим постоянным клиентам  в Ереване.
Сумма кредита в 1,000,000 драм необходима Гарнику для приобретения большой партии шкур, а также для покупки новых ульев, рамок, парафина и т.д.
Данный кредит является третьим по счету и Гарник всегда выплачивал свои кредит без опозданий.
texts.en:
Garnik was born in 1951 in the village Agarak. He graduated from a rural high school and Kapan Mining College where he studied land surveying. He is married with one son and three daughters. All of the children have their own families and live separately from their parents. His wife does not work. Garnik works at the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Plant as an operator.  His wife does housework. 

Since 1995, along with his work at the plant, Garnik has worked in agriculture in Shgharshik village.  He raises bees as well as buys, tans, and sells cattle hides. Garnik sells the honey at Kapan city market and sells the processed hides to his regular customers in Yerevan. 

Garnik needs a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to purchase a large consignment of hides, as well as to buy new hives, frames, wax, etc. 

This loan is his third and Garnik has always paid his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy batch of cow's skin and also to buy some new beehives, frames and wax for his beekeeping

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with three family members.

Wissam has been an owner of a farm for rearing calves and cows since 2005. He inherited this farm from his father where he worked with him since he was child so he gained a good experience and a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is becoming well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 loan to make a fence for his farm and to buy cattle feed. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a fence for his farm and to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Yolanda tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos, la socia trabaja en agricultura y ganadería, la socia se dedica ahora al engorde de ganados y comercialización de productos secos. La socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella todo el año está trabajando y variando sus actividades principales según la época del año, la socia está sembrando productos de maíz blanco y amarillo, también compra y vende ganados y animales pequeños, ella en esta ocasión esta criando y engordando animales vacunos y también está con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de productos secos y en la alimentación balanceada de minerales que les dará a sus ganados vacunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el alimento de sus animales vacunos y para la compra de productos secos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Yolanda belongs to "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria" community bank in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 37 years old, married and has five children. She works in agriculture and livestock, and right now makes a living raising cattle and selling dry goods. Yolanda is very hard-working and does it throughout the year, varying her principal activities depending on season. She is planting white and yellow corn as well as buying and selling cattle and smaller animals. At this time she is raising and fattening cattle and is working with her business buying and selling dry goods. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of dry goods and balanced feed to give to her cattle. She is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle and to purchase dry goods.

loans.name: Maria Clelia

texts.es: Maria  Clelia, D. treinta y nueve años D. edad vive en casa D. un familiar, en zona urbana, junto a su esposo y su menor hija, el pariente les ha cedido el derecho D. habitarla gratuitamente y sólo con obligación D. cuidarla, gracias a esta gran ayuda son varios años los que llevan D. vivir D. esa forma. Ella ha aprovechado el tiempo D. vivir en esta zona D. mucho comercio para dedicarse a la fabricación D. ricos tamales D. gallina en la misma casa, lo que la ha distinguido por más D. 10 años en la zona. Ahora Clelia recientemente se encuentra comerciando con productos D. belleza vía venta por catálogo D. varias marcas reconocidas, esta versátil mujer tiene tiempo aún para dedicarse al cuido D. su hija, ella se esmera cada fin D. semana para elaborar sus ricos tamales, desD. muy temprano compra los insumos frescos para la preparación D. los mismos y tenerlos listos para su reparto D. forma ambulante y por ella misma en lugares cercanos a su localidad. D. lunes a viernes ella se concentra entre sus habituales actividades D. ama D. casa y la visita a potenciales clientes D. los productos por revista que normalmente son lociones, cremas, shampoos, y otros mas D. belleza. Clelia a encontrando en éste último negocio una importante oportunidad para poder obtener mayores ingresos y colaborar con los ingresos del hogar, es por esto que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL un préstamo con el que pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza solicitados por los clientes e insumos para preparación D. tamales que son: gallina, maíz, tomates, especies y gas propano. Espera poder contar con esta importante ayuda y continuar colaborando con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.
texts.en: Maria  Clelia, age 39, lives with her husband and their young daughter in the home of a family member in an urban area. The relation has allowed them to live there for free and only requires them to keep the place up. This is a great help and they have lived this way for several years. Maria Clelia has taken advantage of living in this highly commercial zone in making rich chicken tamales in her home. This has set her apart in the area for over ten years. Clelia has recently started selling beauty products from various well-known brands through a catalogue. This versatile woman still has time to take care of her daughter. She puts a lot of effort every weekend into making her rich tamales. She buys the fresh ingredients very early in the morning so that she can have the tamales ready to sell in the streets. She sells them herself in areas close to her home. From Monday to Friday she focuses on her regular duties as a housewife.  She also visits potential clients for her cosmetics, which normally incluD.: lotions, creams, shampoos and other beauty products. This cosmetics business has given Clelia an important opportunity to obtain more income and help out with the household costs. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL. With it, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of beauty products which her clients are requesting, as well as ingredients for making tamales: chicken, corn, tomatoes, spices, and propane gas. She hopes to be able to count on this important assistance and to continue helping to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and ingredients for making tamales: chicken, corn, tomatoes, spices, and propane gas.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu is a 57 years old, married, and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past six years, Tu has been making an income to support her family by selling basic foods and household necessities from her general store. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of foods and goods to sell to her customers in her store. She hopes that this will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses. Tu hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of basic foods and household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme marié mère d'un enfant de quatre ans.Avec l'appui de son mari enseignant, elle a acheté un réfrigérateur ce qui lui a permis de faire du commerce de créme glacée.Elle vend aussi des parfums à crédit.Ses revenus lui permettent non seulement d'améliorer l'alimentation de la famille mais aussi de satisfaire ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f auprés de l'UIMCEC pour acheter trois caisses de parfums ainsi que du sucre et des produits agricoles pour préparer de la créme .Elle ambitionne d'ouvrir une cantine au marhé central de sa localité.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman and the mother of a four-year-old child. With the support of her husband who is a teacher, she bought a refrigerator which has allowed her to go into the business of selling ice cream.  She also sells perfumes on credit.  Her income allows her not only to improve the quality of food for her family but also to meet her own needs.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs. through l’UIMCEC to buy three cases of perfume along with sugar and agricultural products for making ice cream.  Her ambition is to open a small restaurant at the main market where she lives.

loans.use: to buy three cases of perfume along with sugar and agricultural products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and is married with two children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed four people. Previously, she used to run a grocery. She has been able to grow her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  

She has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por la comunidad de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las mismas que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió, su gente es amable y mantienen la  cultura y tradiciones de su pueblo, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades regresando a sus hogares en la noche.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los que tres de ellos son casados e independientes, cuatro de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, tiene una casita propia pero en el campo y por su trabajo ahora vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende, con este trabajo lleva 2 años, también se dedica a la venta de carne la cual obtiene del ganado que sacrifica. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la cría  de pollos, cuyes y chanchos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es ampliar más sus negocios y ponerse una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the El Arenal community bank in Sayausi, a neighborhood of Cuenca.  The city is surrounded by mountains, the outstanding feature of an already-beautiful countryside.  The climate is cold. The local people are friendly and committed to preserving their culture and traditions.  Most earn their livings from commerce, raising animals and farming.  Some work in the city and live in the country.

Our member, Dona Maria, 53, is married and has 8 children, three of whom are married and living away.  Four others work and help Maria with household expenses and the youngest is still in school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They own a small house in the country, but they're renting in the city because that's where they work.  

Maria owns cows and sells their milk.  She has operated the business for 2 years.  She also butchers cows and sells their meat.  Along with cattle, she raises chickens, cuyes and pigs.  

Maria has been a member of the community bank for a year and she will use this loan to buy feed for her animals.

Her goals are to expand her animal business and open a corner shop.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora magdalena tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con el señor Luís quien es maestro, con el cual tiene 3 hijos miguel, pedro y estela, de los cuales el mayor estudia, el segundo año de secundaria y los dos mas pequeños quinto y sexto año de primaria, ella tiene una farmacia, desde hacen 3 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, por la falta de oportunidades de trabajo, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para gozar de un mejor estilo de vida, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: analgésicos, jarabes, vitaminas, alcohol, algodón, gasas, etc. ya que así contara con una amplia variedad de artículos.
Una de las metas que tiene doña Magda (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad), es la de hacer crecer aun más el negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local para tener bien establecida su farmacia, y así mejorar e incrementar las ganancias.
Estoy muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y la empresa, por todo el apoyo y confianza que nos está brindando,  ya que gracias a esta ayuda contamos con un mejor negocio y forma de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalene is 34 years old and is married to Luís who is a teacher and with whom she has 3 children called Miguel, Pedro and Estela. The oldest is in in the 2nd year of secondary schools, and the two younger ones are in 5th and 6th grades in primary school. 

She has had a pharmacy for 3 years. She says that she decided to begin this small business because of the lack of work opportunities, in order to help her husband with the house expenses and the education of her children, and also in order to enjoy a better life style. 

She plans to use the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as painkillers, syrups, vitamins, alcohol, cotton, gauze, and other products so that she will have a wide variety of items.

A goal of Magda's (as she is known as in her community), is to grow her business, so she wants to build a facility in order to have a well established pharmacy, and thus to improve and to increase her earnings.

“I am very grateful to the Kiva loaners and the community bank, for all the help and the trust given us, and thanks to this help we have a better business and way of life.”

loans.use: to buy painkillers, syrups, vitamins, alcohol, cotton, gauze, and other products

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
La Alegría se llama el comité formado por 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 9no. Ciclo. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa, tratan de que por medio de su trabajo puedan salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común.
Una de las miembros es la señora Paulina, ella por medio de la peluquería que tiene ayuda a su familia con todo lo que ellos necesitan. Su negocio, sumado a su trabajo y buena atención hace que le vaya muy bien y genere buenos ingresos. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de kiva y de la fundación. .
Desea comprar los insumos indispensables para su salo, como ser: tintes, sprays, tijeras, peines, batas para los cortes y otros. Agradece de antemano a kiva y también a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
This committee composed of 16 women working in their 9th cycle is called “La Alegría.”  They work together and in a mutually supportive way in the program.  They try through their work to help their families get ahead.  They all carry out fundraising activities and help each other reach common goals.

One of the members is Paulina who helps her family with everything they need through her beauty salon.  Her business added to her work and the good service she provides, have resulted in her doing very well and earn good income.  She wants to continue investing in her business so is asking for help from Kiva and the Fundación.

She wants to buy indispensable supplies for her beauty salon like: hair coloring, sprays, scissors, combs, client gowns for haircuts and others.  She thanks Kiva and the Fundación ahead of time for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: John Thuku

texts.en: John is married and has three daughters whose ages range from 5 to 11 years old. John has operated a general store for the last three years. His business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to increase its stock. John will use this KES 15,000 loan to buy maize and wheat flours and other items. Within the next five years, John wants to run a supermarket and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy maize and wheat flours

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene 7 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 18, 16, 13, 9, 7,4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAS se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, tiene sembríos de maíz, trigo, cebada, lenteja, cebolla, además tiene 2 ganados lecheros, y se dedica también a la construcción.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para destinarlo a la siembra de maíz  compra de abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la producción. El sueño es poder comprar un lote de terreno y construir una vivienda.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la presencia de lanchas en los cultivos de papas y plagas en el maíz, enfermedades en el ganado.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear, hacer deporte y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 40 years old, married with 7 children. He lives with his wife and children who are 18, 16, 13, 9, 7, 4 and 2 years old. They live in the Guaranda Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the communal bank VRC VENTANAS which is located in Guantuncoto in the parish of Julio Moreno in the canton of Guaranda, 30 minutes away from the office. The residents of the area work in various sectors such as: agriculture, livestock, animal breeding (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction.

Segundo grows crops and breeds animals. He grows corn, wheat, barley, lentils, onions and in addition has 2 dairy cows. He also works in construction.

He buys and sells in Guaranda. He is asking for the loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop. With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve production. His dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

The challenges he has faced are potato blight and pests in his corn as well as sickness with his cows.

In his free time he likes to go for walks, sports and enjoy the festivities of the carnaval.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 34 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for the last six years.

He learned about KADET from other registered KADET groups. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on preparing land for maize and wheat planting. These two crops have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to improve living standards for his family, save for the education of his children, and expand his business.

His dream is to prosper in the business of farming tomatoes, which he plans to plant next season in addition to the maize and wheat. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve the goals he has set.
