Paul has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk which he sells to a local cooling plant, and vegetables, which he sells locally. He also earns income from his poultry project and rental houses in the same region.

He has requested a loan of 41,600KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to purchase another piece of land to pursue extensive dairy farming.

Paul is 52 years old and married with 6 children, whose ages range from 8 to 24 years. Four of his children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria P. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a carinderia (local eatery) and a fishing business.  Her husband Roy, who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 7 and 13 years old. Renilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Renilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she will have enough revolving capital to buy more ingredients and be able to offer a wider variety of food in her carinderia (small restaurant) and she also intends to use part of the loan to sustain her fishing activities. Renilda is working hard so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her businesses. Renilda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Shiela May

texts.en:
Shiela May is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 11 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.
Shiela May is a farmer and raises pigs. She helps her husband in planting rice crops and weeding. She also makes sure the pigs she grows are healthy. She does her best to help sustain her family. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Rosale

texts.en:
Rosale is 37 years old and married, with five children. Rosale works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Rosale has already repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from entertainment (Videoke).

Rosale aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 60 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, shampoo, soap & detergents in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Anita is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, snack foods, beverages & detergents to sell. This loan will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snack foods, beverages & detergents to sell

loans.name: Johnny Yoel

texts.es:
Johnny es un cliente de 24 años de edad, casado y tiene un hijo menor. Él y su familia viven en la zona rural del distrito Mochumi- Lambayeque. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla Johnny, desde hace 5 años, es la  crianza y  comercialización de animales menores como cerdos, ovejas, pavos y patos cuyo corral esta situado en su domicilio. Johnny  aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Sin embargo las ganancias que obtiene Johnny con este negocio no le son suficientes.

Johnny solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que usará para completar la compra de una unidad motorizada. Con la compra de este mototaxi (moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera para transportar pasajeros) Johnny podrá ofrecer un servicio de transporte público que le ayudará a tener ingresos adicionales que beneficiaran a su familia, en especial a su menor hijo.

Johnny,  es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Johnny, 24 years old, is married with one young son. He and his family live in the countryside around Mochumi, Lambayeque, a small community of approximately 200 families.

For the past five years, Johnny has made a living raising and selling farm animals such as pigs, sheep, ducks, and turkeys, which he keeps at his home. Johnny learned the business from his parents and knows it well. Nevertheless, he is unable to earn enough money from his efforts.

Johnny is requesting a loan of 2500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to purchase a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a compartment attached to carry passengers). He will use the mototaxi to earn some additional money transporting passengers, which will be of great benefit to his family, especially his little son.

Johnny has been a client of Edpyme Alternativa for a long time and has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase a motorized vehicle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and she is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy garment accessories and tailoring materials for her tailoring business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garment accessories and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISSEME 1 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Blendio dans l’ex cercle de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles exercent la culture d’arachide de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de riz, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Blendio et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TERNIN la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Jiguisseme 1 group consists of married women from the village of Blendio in the former circle of Niéna, in the Sikasso region, which is the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women live in large, traditional families extending to their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. Their average age is 34, and they have, on average, five children each.

They grow peanuts, rice and millet.

Hoping to make their agricultural work more profitable, the members of the Jiguisseme 1 group decided to take part in the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. The current loan will be used to purchase a sufficient quantity of seeds for peanuts and rice, as well as small equipment and soil inputs for cultivating the plants; these will be purchased exclusively at the large market of Blendio and the city of Nina. After wintering over, the harvests are stored for some time to build their value before being sold at the large market in Niéna and the surrounding markets. They are sold retail (and often wholesale), over the counter to customers who generally come from large cities.

The group president, Ternin, plans to use her loan to purchase one bag of urea and two bags of complex fertilizer, with the remaining amount going towards costs of labor, including hoeing.  She is aiming for an average profit of between 50,000 and 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay off interest on the loan and for her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soil inputs and cover costs of labor.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto hombre soltero que tiene como actividad laboral el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi) cabe mencionar que es de nuestra entera satisfacción saber que lucha y pasa los obstáculos que la vida le pone en frente todo para darle una buena y mejor vida a su madre y para mejorar sus ingresos decidió solicitar otro préstamo en la institución para emprender un nuevo negocio que llegaría a ser la venta de almendras al por mayor  lo que el comprara con el dinero del crédito es almendras,  tiene una competitividad baja en el mercado por eso el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento que puede tener gracias al crédito otorgado en la institución, de manera sacrificada pero rentable y obteniendo buenos resultados el rendimiento es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, para que el y en compañía de su madre puedan tener una mejor calidad y forma de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Humberto is single and offers taxi service. It is of great satisfaction to us knowing he works hard to overcome any obstacles life presents him to offer his mother a well and improved life. To increase profits he decided to request a loan to start a new business where he sells wholesale almonds and will use the loan to buy almonds. There is a low level of competition in this market which is why he plans on investing the loan in this business. The hard work he does every day is valued for the profitable and well results he gets so that he and his mother can have a better quality of life and higher standard of living.

loans.use: buy almonds for his new business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 21 años de edad, está cursando la carrera de Bioquímica. Empezó la carrera hace dos años, y comenta que no es una carrera muy fácil, que tiene sus complicaciones. El cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres quienes cuentan con panadería propia, con mucho esfuerzo están logrando cubrir los gastos de su facultad como matricula, materiales didácticos y otros.
El define a sus padres como personas muy trabajadoras que luchan por darle siempre lo mejor. El trabajo de ellos siempre fue muy sacrificado. Jorge a pesar del poco tiempo que tiene igual ayuda en la pequeña micro industria familiar, realizando reparto de los productos.
El solicita el crédito para costear las cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma aligerar un poco a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jorge is 21 years old and is studying for a degree in Biochemistry. He began his studies two years ago and says that it is a very difficult field. He is supported by his parents, who own their own bakery. With a lot of hard work, they are able to cover some of the costs of his schooling, including registration fees and books and other materials. 

Jorge says his parents are very hard-working and have always fought to give him the best of everything. They have always sacrificed in order to provide for him as best they could. Although he has very little free time, Jorge helps out at their small family-run business, delivering products. He is asking for a loan in order to pay his university fees and in this way lighten his parents' burden.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Annie Lou

texts.en:
Annie Lou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Annie Lou has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Annie Lou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Annie Lou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabenty” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mosses. Mosses is age 51 and was born in Makeni city, where he is currently living with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman and  his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For four years, Mosses has been selling plastics shoes and sandals. He has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to add to his business.

loans.name: Suhaila

texts.en:
Suhaila is a 54-year-old woman, she is married and has one son. Her husband owns a store that sells mobile phones which is located in an area of high population with high demand for these products. Suhaila's husband wants to expand his business; he thought of adding mobile phones accessories and spare parts. 

Suhaila's husband doesn't have enough money in cash now, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband pay the entire amount needed. 

Suhaila is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed in the store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones for the store.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Candelaria tiene 57 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia trabaja en el comercio minorista de mana, la socia compra maíz amarillo y los lleva a una pequeña fábrica en la cual entrega el maíz y en una tostadora grande se cocina a una temperatura adecuada y revienta convirtiéndose en mana por el cambio de presiones, es un cereal muy conocido y rico en Perú, la socia lleva años trabajando en la compra de maíz y venta de mana, ella tiene una pequeña carreta en la cual transporta su producto, la socia también lleva eventualmente habas, quiwicha y otros cereales y mediante un método llamado soplete se convierte en cereal.  La socia solicita el préstamo en la compra de maíz para convertirlo en mana y venderlo.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the Communal Bank “Tesorito” (Little Treasure) which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 57 years old, single, and has three children. Candelaria works as a small retailer selling “mana” (sweetened popcorn). She buys yellow corn and takes it to a small factory that roasts the corn at a safe temperature. The kernels of corn pop due to the change in pressure, creating a delicious snack that is known throughout Peru. Candelaria has worked for many years, buying corn and selling “mana”. She has a small cart for transporting her product. Candelaria also carries beans, amaranth, and other grains and then uses a method called “torching” that converts these products into cereal. She is requesting a loan to buy corn to convert into sweetened popcorn to sell.

Candelaria is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy corn for making sweetened popcorn that she will sell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has six children and has earned a living for the last 20 years by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy a box of fish to sell to her customers. She joined PMPC earlier this year and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a 48-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him and his dream is to educate his children up to higher levels of education. He has been in farming for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land where he has a banana plantation. His hardship is the dry seasons, which lead to low output and his visions are having high yields and buying more land. Geoffrey needs the loan to buy beans, maize, cotton and pineapples to plant.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, cotton and pineapples to plant

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат трудолюбивая, предприимчивая женщина. Она  замужем, муж помогает ей в бизнесе. Она занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота более 9 лет. В настоящее время  у нее 2 коровы. На 1 гектаре земли она посеяла и собрала корм (траву) для скота. Мамлакат просит займ в размере 5500 сомони для покупки крупного рогатого  скота, так как в запасе у нее есть корм и она может содержать большее количество скота. Она надеется, что вы предоставите ей возможность и благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is married, and her husband helps her in this business.  She has been involved in fattening up cattle for over 9 years.  Currently, she has two cows.  She planted fodder (grass) on 1 hectare and gathered it for the livestock.  Mamlakat is requesting a loan in the sum of 5500 somoni to buy cattle because she has extra fodder and can keep a larger quantity of livestock.  She hopes that you would provide her with this opportunity and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last 11 years, he has been selling timber to earn a living. He also operates a transport business to increase his savings. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. Peter is able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become a good saver. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber for resale.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Ergie

texts.en:
Ergie is 24 years old and is married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ergie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ergie has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and re-sell vegetables.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old, and married with two adult children. Merlie is operating a business raising crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlie has been in her business for over 11 years and earns 11,637 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it.

In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and have the ability to engage in business activities. Merlie is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Merlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old. Teresita is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Teresita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and many other things. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately PHP 3,600 a month for these activities.

Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to buy additional products to sell. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ferney Alonso

texts.es: El señor Ferney a sus 28 años de edad es propietario de un bar el cual reabrió hace dos meses luego de haber tenido que cerrarlo debido a dificultades familiares. El señor Ferney tiene este negocio con el fin de obtener ingresos adicionales para apoyar a su familia. El señor Ferney trabaja los fines de semana en su negocio y los días hábiles trabaja en una empresa. El señor Ferney requiere de la compra de surtido tal como licor, snacks y gaseosas, sillas y mesas para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Con lo anterior, el señor Ferney podrá mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales podrá costear sus estudios y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ferney at 28 is the proprietor of a bar which reopened two months ago after having been closed due to family difficulties. He owns this business in order to earn additional income for his family.  He works weekends in his business and weekdays for a company. 

Ferney needs to purchase supplies such as liquor, snacks and soft drinks and chairs and tables so he can offer his customers better service. With a loan, he will be able to improve his income and thus finance his studies and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tables and chairs

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong is a 39-year-old mother of 3 single children. Mrs. Kong and her husband are in same business, cultivating rice crops year-round for their livelihoods. As shown in the photo, living in a longstanding thatched house causes the whole family experience many difficulties. Mrs. Kong has saved some money to purchase a finished house but until now her capital has not been enough to buy one. By chance, a nearby villager would like to sell his land and house because he will move away. Therefore, Mrs. Kong is applying for a loan from Kiva to supplement her capital to buy the house. She hopes all lenders will not reject her loan and kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a house.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hentii province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two children are college students. He started his carpentering business in 2002. Over the years, he has gained many customers and experience. His products are smooth and high quality. Now that his children are college students, Ganzorig has to work to his full capacity in order to support them. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy timber to make chairs, tables and doors. He already has several orders, but  due to lack of funds, he hasn't been able  to buy raw materials.

loans.use: To buy timber to make chairs, tables and doors

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "QAPAC QOLLA"; El banco esta situado en el Distrito de Iscuchaca en la Provincia de Anta perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yoni; ella tiene 23 años de edad, la soica es conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijos; su conyugue es mototaxista y el le lleva  al socia a la feria de Inquilpata a vender chicharron todos los días de feria, la socia solicita en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos y de sillas para la venta de su chicharron, ella compra chancho, cebollas, hierba buena, maíz, papa para acompañar el rico potaje; la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y de sillas de platico para sus comensales.

La socia agradece el credito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Yoni, 23, belongs to the “Qapacqolla” communal bank located in Iscuchaca District in Anta Province belonging to Cusco Department.  She has a spouse and two minor children.  Her spouse is a mototaxi driver and he takes her to the Inquilpata street market to sell chicharrón [fried pork skin] every market day. 

On this occasion, she’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients and plastic chairs for her chicharrón sales.  She buys pork, onions, spearmint, corn and potatoes to accompany the delicious stew.  She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients and plastic chairs for her patrons.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a business lady, who runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her employment. She is also married and has been blessed with one child. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 4 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Naziran  to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.  Naziran  is 49 years old; she is a married woman.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro Quiñónez, originally from Columbia, has lived in Guayaquil, Ecuador for 10 years. He is a 56-year-old married man with 3 children. His business sells household provisions and treats. Pedro’s venture is run out of his home and he has been in this business for 5 years. Clients from the neighborhood can buy goods there from 9:00am until 11:00 pm. Sr. Quiñónez woul like to take out a $475 loan to buy more inventory and purchase special order items from his regulars. Don Pedro is a hard-working entrepreneur that wants to grow his small business and advance his family’s situation.

loans.use: Purchase more household items for mini market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START TOMATO FARMING

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is married with five children, all of whom are in primary school. Michael runs a small shop and a video entertainment facility at the back of his shop where he shows movies, etc. This is his second loan with PEMCI but his first with Kiva. His first loan enabled him to stock his video library thus improving his business. With the proposed second loan of $225, he intends to register his business with DSTV, a cable TV provider in the region. This will enable him provide quality films and games to his customers, especially during soccer seasons. His wife is also a small-scale business lady. As this is the only video shop in his neighbourhood, his business has good potential for growth.

loans.use: Video show room

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 37 years old and is married, her husband is also 37. They have two children, a 14 yr old son and a 4 yr old daughter. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband rents out work frames to building companies and she raises chickens and makes and repairs clothes. Many of her chickens died due to a strange disease (not bird flu). She wants to buy new chickens to create more income for the children's education. At the moment her income is $62.50 per month and her husband earns $125.00 per month.

loans.use: To invest in a bamboo work frame for hire, and buy chickens

loans.name: Dorita

texts.es:
Dorita O. is 28 years old and married to Guillermo Benítez, who is 30 years old. They both come from very humble families. They have a young son who studies at the public high school in the city. They live in their own home that they obtained with much sacrifice.

They both work in a warehouse where they sell all kinds of important primary ingredients like sugar, meat, flour, noodles, etc. They are dedicated to selling poultry since it's a very profitable product, which has already helped improve their families daily quality of life.

For lack of capital, they left this business and now are thinking of returning to the business by raising and selling chickens. They have been contracted by a big, local supermarket to provide a constant supply of chickens. They are already prepared to sign a contract for their first year. This is why they are requesting a loan of $500 that they will invest in buying birds to fatten and begin to fulfill their contract with the supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Dorita O. tiene 28 años, ella está casada con Guillermo Benítez de 30 años. Ambos provienen de una familia muy humilde. Tienen un hijo menor de edad que estudia en un colegio público de la ciudad. Viven en una casa propia que adquirieron con mucho sacrificio. Ambos trabajan en la despensa donde venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, carne, harina, fideos, etc. Ellos se dedicaban anteriormente a la venta de aves, pues es un rubro muy rentable que les ha ayudado a toda la familia a mejorar cada día el nivel de vida. Por motivos de falta de capital, dejaron ese rubro y hoy día tienen pensado volver a iniciarse en la cría y venta de aves (pollos). Han sido contactados por un supermercado grande de la zona para que les pueda proveer de los pollos de forma constante, y están en tratativas con la empresa para firmar contrato, de esta forma proveer de pollos durante un año inicialmente. Por este motivo, solicitan el crédito de $ 500 que los invertirá en la compra de aves para el engorde y así empezar a proveer al supermercado que los contrato.

loans.use: Buy chickens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is a flower vendor in the cemetaries of La Paz. She also manufactures cow's milk and thus supplements her income for one that can keep her. Lilian lives in her parent's home in the community of Rio Abajo - Palomar (two hours outside of the city of La Paz). The loan will be used to purchase a medium range cow to increase her production of milk and try to improve her income. This is her first loan with Impro and her evaluation allowed her to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Lilian es comerciante de flores en los cementerios de La Paz; también es productora de leche de vaca y así complementa sus ingresos con los que se mantiene. Lilian vive en la casa de sus padres en la Comunidad de Rio Abajo – Palomar (a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito será utilizado para comprar una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar su producción de leche y tratar de mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de vaca lechera

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mr. Pisey S., 42, is married with four children, ages 3-14. He and his family live in a modest home south of Phnom Penh along National Road 2. For the past 17 years, Pisey has been a construction worker. His work entails traveling to various building sites, usually residential homes, within his commune (a collection of 3 villages). His wife, Vanno, stays at home taking care of their children and farming rice. Vanno has been a farmer for almost 20 years and grows the rice both for the family's personal use and to resell.

Pisey is requesting a second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US$ 400. He will use this loan to purchase a refurbished motorbike-scooter to allow him to more easily get to and from work. Currently, Pisey rides with a co-worker, but having a motorbike of his own will allow him more flexibility with his work schedule. There are no other realistic options for transport in this rural area.

Of their four children, two currently attend local schools and one attends a private school where he is learning English. In the future, Pisey hopes to continue saving money to ensure their children are able to pursue higher education.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike-scooter for transport to construction sites

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Sra. H., with the support of her father, started working as a street vendor selling sweets all over Leon's La Terminal market. However, because she needed to improve her economic situation and because she was a single mother, she moved on to establish a business selling men's and women's clothing in one of the market spaces across from Leon's bus station.

Today, 20 years later, she's benefited enormously from the credit that Ceprodel has extended to her for the past three years, funds that she has used to maintain her humble household and to support her school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. H. con aporte de su papá inicia el negocio de de forma ambulante con la venta primeramente de galletas en todo el mercado La Terminal. Sin embargo, por la necesidad de mejorar su situación económica y además de ser madre soltera logra establecerse en un tramo ubicado frente a la estación de buses de León vendiendo ropa para damas y caballeros.

Hoy en día tienen 20 años de tener el negocio de ropa del cual desde hace tres años ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel los que le han servido de mucho beneficio para el sustento de su humilde hogar y el apoyo a sus hijos que son infantes que ya están en el proceso de estudio en el colegio.

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
"I am Shamim Akther. I am married and a mother of six: four daughters and two sons. One of my daughters is married while the others are above 13. I have been embroidering clothes for fifteen years. Earlier, I used to embroider on order from a middleman and earned little for my labor. Now, I and my daughter together want to start our own business of embroidering clothes.

There are several other women like me who are in need of loans. Basheeran B. buys and sells goats. Anweri B. wants a loan for her clothing business. Wazira B. will invest her loan in her shoe manufacturing business. Abida B. wants a loan for her embroidery business. Above all, these women are my friends and reside in my neighborhood."

loans.use: Start her own business embroidering clothes

loans.name: Rosa Yda

texts.en:
Rosa Yda sells a collection of necklaces, bracelets, earrings and trinkets to women of the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. She has two boys and a girl; they all attend school.

Rosa dreams of having a small shop where she can operate her business. That way, she won’t have to walk along the streets offering her products, and customers will be able to make purchases more easily.

With her loan, Rosa will buy more goods in order to expand her stock and attract new customers.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry to move a small business forward.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Agaselim

texts.en: Agaselim A. is a 63-year-old farmer who has run his dairy and poultry businesses in the small village of Imishli region since 1995. He is married and has two children. He would like to expand his business by purchasing 2 additional milk cows to expand the sale of his dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum M., aged 48, is a mother of nine children and owns a plot of farmland where she has been growing rice since 1979. She makes less than one dollar a day. Her husband, Van Nie, aged 50, has a business selling ice-cream in the village. He has a small cart to transport his ice-cream and sell from door to door to earn approximately two dollars of profit per day. Of their nine children, three are married and live away from home, while another three are garment factory workers, earning around $2.50 each per day. Moreover, one another is a construction worker building houses, and normally makes $2 a day. The youngest children are students.

She would like a loan from Kiva to make the ice-cream in large amounts and resell in the village. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To make more ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is requesting a fourth loan to invest it on improving her house, in this case to build a bathroom in her house. She has been working as a nurse assistant for the last 16 years.

Dionisia has two daughters, the oldest studies 1st year of high school and the baby girl is 5 months old, she also has the help of her husband who is also a nurse assistant.

Dionisia got a scholarship for her specialty, and she is currently studying, she works very responsibly, she is a humble woman with high spirits of personal improvement, is a woman who has fought for her family so her daughters do not lack the basic things in her house, her dream is to be healthy, have work stability and that her daughters one day would be able to go to college and be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Dionicia esta solicitando su cuarto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es terminar de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa. Trabaja como Auxiliar de Enfermería desde hace 16 años.

Dionisia es madre de dos niñas, la mayor estudia 1 er año de educación secundaria y una bebita de 5 meses, además cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien se desempeña tambien como auxiliar de enfermeria.

Dionicia logró obtener una beca para una especialidad, la cual está estudiando actualmente, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, es una mujer humilde y con alto espiritu de superación personal, es una mujer que ha luchado por su familia para que a sus hijas no les falte lo básico en el hogar, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que su hijas logren llegar a ser profesionales.

loans.use: To build a bathroom in her one room house

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mireille C. sells fabrics, bags, shoes and cosmetic products among other items. She has opted to allow some of her customers to buy on credit and she makes nightly rounds to their homes to collect the money. Being very experienced in her particular field, she is in contact with many customers and often asks them what their needs are so that she can try to satisfy customer demand. She makes her purchases primarily in Togo or in Ghana. Born on July 22, 1967 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married and is the mother of three children, only one of which is in school. She lives with her husband and they are currently asking for third loan through this program. She is responsible and is well loved in her neighborhood.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Dame C. Mireille est spécialisée dans la vente des tissus basin, sacs, chaussures, produits cosmétiques et autres. Elle a opté pour la vente à crédit et passe tous les soirs chez ses clients pour collecter les fonds. Très expérimentée dans cette activité, elle a le contact facile avec les clients et se renseigne très souvent sur leurs besoins afin de pouvoir les satisfaire au mieux. Elle se rend généralement au TOGO ou au GHANA pour faire ses achats. Née le 22 Juillet 1967 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du BENIN, elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Elle vit avec son mari et est à sa troisième demande de prêt. Elle a un bon comportement et est très aimée dans son quartier.

loans.use: To purchase 20 rolls of fabrics of various quality.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 30 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are currently in school. She treks to the farming communities to purchase her products and retails them in the town market. She says the price of commodities is on the rise and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more yams and rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travel. She hopes to increase her savings to help her husband pay the children’s school fees.

Comfort is a member of the group called “Ebe ba mu Trust Group” (It shall come to pass). Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh yams and bags of rice

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila has owned a photography studio for the past five years. Previously, she worked independently photographing events for which she was hired. Nevertheless, she then had her son and decided to open her photography studio in her home.

Lila also offers photocopying services to the public and sells rolls of fim, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products. She also films events and parties on video.

She has invested the loans that she has received in her camera and the computer that she uses to edit photos. Lila would like to increase the stock of products that she sells in her studio. In addition, she would like to hire an assistant who could stay in the shop while she goes out to take pictures and video.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lila tiene un estudio de fotografía desde hace 5 años. Antes, ella trabajaba de forma independiente fotografiando en eventos a la que le llamaban. Sin embargo, luego tuvo su hijo, por lo que decidió abrir un estudio fotográfico en su casa. Lila también ofrece al público servicio de fotocopia y venta de rollos de fotografía, cosméticos y artículos de bazar. Eventualmente, ella trabaja filmando eventos y fiestas en video. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en su cámara filmadora y en la computadora que utiliza en la edición de sus fotos. A Lila le gustaría aumentar su stock de productos que ofrece en su estudio fotográfico. Además, quisiera contar con un personal de trabajo que pudiera quedarse en la tienda mientras ella sale a hacer sus fotografías o filmaciones.

loans.use: To increase her stock and hire an assistant.

loans.name: Maria A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Maria M..  She is widow and has four children, aged between 10 and 16. In 2002, Maria established her rice-selling business. Working 2 days a week, and 9-12 hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. Maria has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional inventory of rice. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy additional inventory.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome sells charcoal in Dodoma, Tanzania. She does so by purchasing large bags of charcoal at wholesale prices and then breaking them down into smaller quantities to be sold at higher prices. She has been earning approximately $5 each month but by taking out this loan she hopes to increase her profit so that she can pay her children's school fees and get more food for her family.

Salome is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Santina, Dolisia, and Somoe.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Katebo Business Group2

texts.en:
Juliet N. is the chairperson of the Katebo business group in Buwama. She is 52 years old with nine children, four of whom are still at home. She also caters for six grandchildren.

Juliet is a farmer of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. She mostly sells them to customers in and around her village, in addition to using them for home consumption. On top of farming, she also keeps animals like goats, pigs, and two cows for milk. She is proud of where she is right now because she started from zero after divorcing with her husband.

This being a rainy season, Juliet plans to use her share of the loan to employ helpers on her farm to clear the bushes for fresh plantations. The profits from the high quality yields will help her pay school fees for her children come next term, as well as catering for her family upkeep.

loans.use: To employ labour on her farm to clear the bushes.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Yann V., 22, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. This couple together has two young children. All of them are not attend the school yet. She is a grocery vendor who generally makes $2.50 of profit a day, while her husband, Sok Thai, 25, has a business breeding cows. On average, he makes $6 a day. Every month, she spends $60 on foods and $10 on utilities.

She is asking a loan of $1000 to purchase more cows for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more cows.

loans.name: Zubaida Khursheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a 53-year-old married lady. Her husband's name is K. A. and he is a daily wage laborer. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a fruit seller selling seasonal fruit. Another is a daily wage laborer. Her youngest son is reading 6th standard. Her daughter is also reading 6th standard.

Zubaida baji is a seamstress. She has been sewing clothes for the past 4 years. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her eldest son’s fruit-selling business.

Zubaida baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shamim baji wants a loan to buy utensils and flour to re-sell. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Jesus Es Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Cecilia V. C. is the leader of the Bank of Hope called "Jesus es Nuestra Esperanza" or in English, "Jesus is our Hope."  Cecilia has six children, whose ages range from 17-37.  She lives with her husband Monserat who is 61 years old.  Some recent problems she has faced were the deaths of her father and a sister.  Her dreams for the future are to make progress in and expand her business and continue to live with her family.  

Thank you for your interest in Cecilia!

loans.use: To replenish supplies and grow business

loans.name: Segundina Lucila

texts.es: La sra. Lucila es una cliente antigua D. la institución, trabaja desD. el año 2005 en su restaurante, muy conocido en la zona y en donD. trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, el sr. Adalid. Tienen 3 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, gracias a su buena actitúd frente a la vida, ellos se sienten jmuy óvenes y con muchas ganas D. trabajar. Son clientes puntuales y trabajan en la institución desD. que iniciaron su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucila is an old customer of the Emprender Microfinance institution and has worked since 2005 in her well-known restaurant where she works with her husband, Adalid. They have three adult children who are independent; thanks to their good attituD. towards life, they feel young and are very excited to work. Lucila and Adalid are very punctual in their payments and have worked in the institution since they started their business. The loan will be invest in the purchase of ingredients for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Née vers 1964 à Porto-Novo,Capitale administrative du Bénin, H. Pierrette y demeure. Pierrette est mère de quatre enfants(4) dont trois (3) sont scolarisés. Tisserande de profession, Pierrette est aussi vendeuse de farine de manioc localement appelée gari et de glaces sucettes ; une activité qu’elle exerce pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenu,Pierrette vend également de charbon. Malgré ses efforts pour se faire plus de revenu, le rendement demeure toujours insuffisant. Pour ce fait, Pierrette sollicite un crédit  pour renforcer ses activités afin de mieux les développer et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Pierrette H. was born circa 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, where she lives now. She's the mother of 4 children, out of which 3 attend school. A trained weaver, Pierrette also sells tapioca (locally known as "gari") and ice pops to support her family. To diversify her income, she also sells charcoal. Despite her efforts to increase her income, her profits remain insufficient. Pierrette is therefore seeking a loan to strengthen her business, in order to bolster his activities and provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal and tapioca

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El señor Fausto es originario de Veracruz y  vino a radicar a Piedras Negras desde hace 15 años, buscando un mejor futuro para el y su familia, el es pensionado y aparte tiene un ingreso extra económicamente muy bueno como empleado de un centro comercial, en una área donde le brindan trabajo a personas pensionadas, y con capacidades diferentes, su esposa la señora Eduarda también es pensionada, ellos tienen 5 hijos los cuales todos están casados y son personas muy responsables, pero que también contribuyen al apoyo económico de sus padres; don Fausto y la señora Eduarda están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de un portalito en el frente de su casita  y pasar las tardes viendo juntos como un matrimonio estable y unido el atardecer.
texts.en:
Fausto is originally from Veracruz, and came to relocate to Piedras Negras 15 years ago looking for a better future for himself and his family. He is retired and also enjoys a good additional income as an employee at a commercial center in an area that provides work for retired persons who have different skills. They have 5 children who are married and are also very responsible individuals, but who also contribute to the financial support of their parents. Fausto and Eduarda are requesting this loan to build an entrance in front of their home; from there, they can spend their afternoons together watching the evening approach as a stable, unified married couple.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front entrance for his house.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak H. is a villager living in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia, where he has been settled with his family members for years. He is currently providing for his family by driving a motor taxi, with which he can generate a stable income of $3 a day. To help meet the family's needs a little better, his wife is raising pigs for sale. Chak H. and his wife have eight children who are of school age. Chak H. sees his wife's business of raising pigs as a profitable one because pork is now commanding high prices. Therefore, Chak H. would like a $600 loan in order to purchase extra piglets for his wife to raise, and also to build more pigpens. (Chak H.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase piglets for his wife to raise.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 4 hijos, vive en la Av. binacional y cuenta con estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años  e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de venta de comida.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, para comprar insumo para la elaboraciónde comidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is member of the Bank Manuela Ramos from the district of Mazocruz, Province of Collao, Department of Puno; she is 39 years old, she lives with her partner and has 4 children, she lives in Av. Binacional and didn't finished high school. Mrs. Olga has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 7 years and her first loan was for 300 New Soles, that helped her increase her business selling food. Currently she is requesting a new loan for 3000 New Soles to buy products to prepare the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to prepare food

loans.name: Vahobzhon

texts.ru: Год назад Вахобчон получал займ КИВА и полученный займ положительно подействовал на ход его бизнеса. Оборотный капитал увеличился и расширился ассортимент товаров. Сам Вахобчон нашел хорошую работу и в торговле занимаются его жена и дети. Для расширения своего бизнеса Вахобчон собирается и дальше получать новые займы и так как его планы вполне реалистичны то он надеется получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить условия своей жизни.
texts.en:
The loan Vahobzhon received from Kiva last year has had a real positive impact on the development of his business. He has increased his working capital and expanded inventory. Vahobzhon found good work, and his wife and children are also working in sales. He plans to continue to take out new loans to expand his business, and as his goals are quite realistic he hopes to earn a good income and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 28 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Judith owns and operates a business selling alcoholic beverages including beer and wine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Mujeres De Parracan Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres Parracana son originarios del Municipio de San Cristobal Totonicapan, ellas vienen trabajando mas de diez años en la cual han adquirido mucha experiencia atravez de las formaciones o capacitaciones, en la cual ellas se han fortalecido en las artesanias principalmente en el bordado y tejido de trajes para damas, hoy necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderias la cual necesita de mucho capital, ya que se tiene un pedido porque ya se aproxima la feria del municipio.
texts.en:
The Parracana group of women is from the county of San Cristobal Totonicapan. They have been working for more than 10 years and have acquired a lot of experience through training or courses, where they have strengthened their arts and crafts skills, mainly in the embroidery and knitting of woman's clothing. They need a loan to purchase their materials, and they need a lot of capital since they already have an order because of the upcoming county fair.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Rosa Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 06 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Vilcanqui Sector Carancani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra de lanas para artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana vegetal para elaboración de artesanías,  además comprará ovinos y chanchos para engorde.

Su deseo es  poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Molino-Juli Community Bank, which is located in the Centro Poblado of Molino, Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 42, married, and has six children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Vilcanqui community, Carancani sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost ten years. With her initial loan for 300 PEN, she bought wool for handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy wool to make handicrafts. She will also buy sheep and pigs to fatten. Her wish is to set up a grocery store. She likes the savings and the training talks she gets at her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and wool

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Martha R. tiene su propio establecimiento de cafetín donde vende café, bebidas gaseosas, jugos y productos comestibles.

Ella es muy trabajadora y ha logrado salir adelante gracias a su constante esfuerzo en su negocio. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de todas las bebidas y los productos comestibles para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así lograr su satisfacción para obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha R. has her own small café where she sells coffee, carbonated drinks, juice and food products. Martha is a very hard worker, and she has been able to get ahead thanks to the constant effort she puts into her business. She has now come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy lots of drinks and food products to offer to her customers. The customers will be satisfied, and she will get better earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks and food products

loans.name: Mwajuma's Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 21 years old woman,she is single .

Mwajuma started her own cafe business selling food 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwajuma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities to her food business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Mwajuma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Martha is another member of the same borrower group she also requested the loan in order to expand her charcoal business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for food

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 5-year-old daughter in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He currently operates a flour and rice trade business out of a shipping container at the local food market in his town. Byambadorj purchases goods for his business in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Byambadorj started his flour and rice business in 2008 with the help of his wife. Since then, his business has grown steadily, and today his working capital exceeds 2,500,000 Tugrugs. He attributes his success to his good selling and communication skills. Since his work place is not very comfortable, Byambadorj hopes to one day have his own store. He works hard everyday to achieve this goal. He requests a loan of 3,000,000 Tugrugs to purchase more supplies for his flour and rice trade business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Chasenei Small Marketing Group

texts.en:
In the Chasenei Town Community, Foyah District, Lofa County, Esther lives with her two children, aged 3 and 5 years, both of whom attend daycare.

For about four years now, Esther has run a business selling foodstuffs from a table. With the income, she caters to her children and supports them in school. Her challenge has been a lack of finance but she is successful in attracting her customers by providing for their needs with reasonable and affordable prices. She dreams of a bigger business to adequately support her kids.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lorenza Catalina

texts.es: La señora Lorenza  Catalina C. , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja y el apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo , todo estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle una mejor condiciones de vida , ya que ellos no tienen privacidad , por que la sala abarca la pulpería y ellos se siente un poco incómodos , desde hace cinco años con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su esposo logro establecer una pequeña pulpería , pero por la alza de precios no a  incrementado su negocio , agradece por la buena aprobación de su préstamo ya que con esto va a diversificar mas sus productos para poder tener mejores ingresos, comprara granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, cosmético entre otros. A futuros es poder comprar materiales de construcción y hacer en la parte de afuera de su hogar una caseta y trasladar su pequeño negocio a parte.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorenza Catalina C. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. She and her husband work together and support one another with the household expenses. They have four dependent children who all attend school. Their plans include providing their family with better living conditions since they do not have any privacy. The living room currently houses Lorenza’s business and the rest of her family feels a bit uncomfortable.

Five years ago, through her hard work and assistance from her husband, Lorenza was able to establish her small grocery store. However, increases in prices have prevented her from growing her business. Thanks to the approval of her loan, she will be able to better diversify her products so that she can generate better earnings. Lorenza plans to buy basic grains, candy, dairy products, cosmetics, and other items.

In the future, she would like to purchase construction materials to build a structure to contain her small business that is separate from her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, dairy products, cosmetics, and other items

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has been in the motorcycle transportation business for one year now. He is 59 years old, married to Jane Wambui, and has four children who have all finished school and are employed.

Jackson was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. With this loan, Jackson plans to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one he has been using as a taxi.

Jackson hopes to move into the real estate business in the future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a new motrocycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes in bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and she runs a cooked food business which is growing by the day. With proceeds from this business, she is able to meet her family's needs. Doris' greatest joy in this business is that she does not need to sell on credit to her customers, as they pay in cash. Doris hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Chroeb's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb N. is the group leader for six members who all live in Ta Soeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding.

Mrs. Chroeb N. is a 36-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Another group member, Mr. Chhin K. did not come to take the loan but his wife was there, so she is presented in the picture in his place.

loans.use: purchasing more piglets

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn F. is 28 years old and a young farmer. She lives in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She started her business since 1998. She was interested in rice farming, because knows how to grow rice and people are buy it as a commodity. 

Roselyn needs additional capital for her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures inc. to buy farm supplies. The loan will improve her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Tako

texts.en:
Tako A. is currently in the business of selling sugar in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar to sell. Tako is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags sugar to sell.

loans.name: Kadessa

texts.fr: Kadessa T. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est marie et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demi et a été 17 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait la préparation et vente de bouillie de mil. Son activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadessa T. is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and mother to two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for eight and a half years and already received 17 successive loans. She prepares and sells millet porridge. Her work generates profits which provide financial support for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finance her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita G., 54, makes rugs and recycles curtains. She works to ensure that her family has enough income for their daily needs. She is married to Romeo G., a construction worker, and they are blessed with five children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  

Agapita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buying equipment so she can expand her rug and curtain business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow because she wants a simple life for herself, and she wants her children to have the best life she can possibly give them.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia D. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Ofelia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a motorcycle transport service. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional vehicle for the business

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en:
Bisi sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this drink business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. 

She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her children are doing well in their school. She is also happy because her children attend school. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and stronger. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Geneviève Aline

texts.fr: H. Geneviève Aline est née le 09 Septembre 1978 et est mariée à ASSOGBA Séïbou, un soudeur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Geneviève Aline vit depuis neuf ans à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Geneviève Aline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis six ans environs, Geneviève Aline mène comme activité, la vente de diverses articles de mercerie dans sa boutique située à son domicile. Geneviève Aline s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et à Dantokpa, marché international du  Bénin. Geneviève Aline avait bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but d'élever davantage le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Geneviève Aline sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Geneviève Aline H. was born on 9th September 1978 and is married to Séïbou ASSOGBA, a welder. The couple has three children in their care, two of whom are their own children. All the children are at school. Geneviève Aline has lived for the past nine years with her family in Cocotomey in the municipality of Calavi. The couple shares the various family expenses. Geneviève Aline left school during secondary level. For around six years she has sold various haberdashery products in her shop which is based at home. She gets her supplies in Nigeria, which borders Bénin, and in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Geneviève Aline has already benefited from one loan from ALIDé which she repaid in full. With a view to expanding her activity and to be able to satisfy ever increasing customer demand more readily, she is applying for a second loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 50 rolls of poplin, 70 packets of sewing thread, 30 dozen zippers, etc.
