loans.name: Ervin

texts.es: Don Ervin habitante de Nueva Guinea es casado, tiene 2 hijos, labora como guarda de seguridad en una institucion de este municipio. Está solicitando su 1er crèdito a la institución de AFODENIC, con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda cambiar el techo de la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y las puerta y de esta forma garantizar la seguridad de su vienda y su familia. Ervin se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador responsable, honesto. El mayor sueño que tiene es mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia, y que sus hijos estudien y logren tener una profesion, pues es de esta manera sacarian adelante a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Mr. Ervin lives in Nueva Guinea; he is married and has 2 children. He works as a security guard in an institution of his municipality. He is asking for his first loan with AFODENIC (Kiva’s field partner) to improve his home by changing the roof of his home that is in a bad state and the doors so that he can guarantee the safety of his home and that of his family. Ervin is characterized by being a hardworking and responsible man as well as honest. His biggest dream is to improve his quality of life and that of his family, and that his children be able to study and become professionals since in this way they can make his country better.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof and doors.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah K. is a married woman and an entrepreneur. She runs a foodstuffs shop at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food products including maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, rice and other small shop goods.

Dorah’s business plan is to run a wholesale shop as her business income grows. She is requesting a loan of Tsh 800,000 to buy more business goods so as to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand on her poultry project

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S. est âgée de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants ; un garçon et une fille. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINYHIANG HOULATA depuis le 03 mars 2006 et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et fait aussi la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide depuis plus de 4 ans. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et augmenter son niveau d’épargne. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Aminata S. is 31 years old, married and the mother of two: a boy and a girl. She has been a member of the Sinyhiang Houlata Banc Villageois lending group since March 3, 2006 and has received 8 successive loans. She is a vendor of fabrics and has also performed the conversion and sale of peanut butter for 4 years. Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business in order to achieve greater profits and expand her savings. She supports her husband in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her revenue-generating activities

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela U. is from the village of Nacional Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Adela runs a general store selling shampoo, soap, canned good and more. She has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Adela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: B. Dilbar is 47 years old. Together with her husband, Adolat, she has raised three children. Dilbar has been running a drugstore for 5 years. She sells only certified medicines. The drugstore is located in the center of town which allows her to have many clients and customers. Now Dilbar is requesting $3000 US. With expansion of the business and consequent increase in income, Dilbar is planning to provide all her children with higher education. Being a very accurate person by nature, Dilbar is sure, and would like to ensure the lenders, that she will repay the loan without any delay. This money will help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 60-year-old woman from Jenin, a city in the northern part of Palestine. Latifa is the mother of four sons. One of her sons works in the Ministry of Education, one at the the Arab bank, and one at the Arab Specialist Hospital. Her fourth son is a college student.

Latifa and her sons started building their own house after her husband passed away. Her sons were helping with funds from their salaries. The house is now completely built and just needs finishing work.

Since the sons have been helping with the house for a long time, they cannot pay any more, so Latifa came to FATEN and took a $3000 loan.

Latifa, whom you see in the picture with her son, Omar, is a well-respected woman in Jenin and with a very good reputation.

loans.use: Finish house construction

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi B. is married and has five dependants. She has been through junior high school. Esi operates a food joint where she prepares fufu with various types of soups to sell at Takoradi. Her husband is a train driver.  Esi uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills.  Esi will use the loan to purchase more and different foodstuffs to cook to bring variety into her foods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more and different foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Gultan

texts.en:
N. Gultan is 46 years old. She is married and has one child. Gultan sells clothing and toys for children. She rents a place for her sales which is located in one of the local markets. 

Gultan has been running this business for 13 years. Having only a couple of competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. Today she is requesting 6000 Somoni to purchase new goods to expand the range of her goods. Gultan thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing and toys for resale

loans.name: 050401 Phong My-Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
Quyet L. T. (1) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Quyet is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050401 Phong My-Hoang Phong (050401 phong my-Hoang phong).

Quyet is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Quyet operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for saL..  Quyet has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Quyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quyet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Quyet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Huong (10) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Yen (9) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Hieu (3) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  C. T. Thuy (2) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quyet L. T. (1) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Quyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 050401 phong my-Hoang phong (050401 phong my-Hoang phong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Quyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quyet kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Quyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Huong (10) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Yen (9) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Hieu (3) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  C. T. Thuy (2) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has been living with her family for over 16 years.
 
She is a 39-year-old lady who owns & operates her embroidery business from home. She started this business three years ago to supplement the family income. She gets orders from her neighbors and receives a good income after completing their orders. Her income allows her to pay for the family's utility expenses.
 
She is the mother of 3 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are getting an education, except the eldest one, who didn’t have any interest in education. That is why he helps his father in his dairy business. 

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo to increase the milk-productivity of his business. Currently, he has a buffalo at his home and it gives him around 8kg milk. He sells 1kg milk for 45 PKRs, which has become a standard amount in every city. He gets almost 360 PKRs every day. By adding another buffalo his income will double and he will be able to sell milk to more customers.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 3rd loan cycle. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting.

Note: "In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Sakina".

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with two children, ages 2 and 5. He has been selling clothes for 3 years. He was previously employed before he went into this business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. 

Joseph has been a registered member of Faulu Kenya with the Green Tree Group. Through the group, he had previously received a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has requested another loan of 80,000 KES to buy clothes for resale. Joseph sees himself opening more outlets for his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 21 años, vive en casa de sus tíos en compañía de ellos y de sus primos. Es una joven muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante. El día esta joven empieza muy temprano, pues labora como cajera en un centro comercial, desde 9 de la mañana hasta  las 9 de la noche durante 6 días a la semana y solo descansa durante 1 día. Sin embargo todos los días debe hacer un largo viaje hasta su trabajo, continúa adelante ya que tiene muchos proyectos en mente. Aunque no tiene mucho tiempo libre trata de continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa, pues tiene algunas clientes que le sacan la mercadería a crédito, y ella se abastece de ropa al por mayor en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad. Dice que ambas labores le generan considerables ganancias que le permiten mantenerse sola y para el futuro quiere instalar su propio negocio, pero aún no decide a que rubro se dedicará. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Sara tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en ropa para la temporada veraniega que ya se acerca, ya que quiere ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sara is 21 years old and she lives with her aunt and uncle and cousins. She is a hard working young woman and she is endeavoring to come out ahead. Her day starts very early as a cashier in a shopping centre, working from 9 in the morning until 9 at night, 6 days a week. She only gets a 1 hour break all day.  She needs to travel a long way to get to her work but she keeps it up because she has many plans in mind.  Although she doesn't have much spare time she plans on continuing on with her clothing business. She has some clients who buy from her on credit.  She purchases her clothing in wholesale from a large outlet in the city. She says that both of her jobs generate considerable income for her which allows her to support herself. In the future she wants to set up her own business but she doesn't really know in what field exactly she wants to specialize.  This is the first loan she accesses from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is compromised to the terms of this loan. She doesn't want to cause any hardship to all those individuals who made this loan possible. This will permit her to keep working and progressing. Sara plans on investing her loan in the purchase of a large quantity of clothing for the upcoming season, wanting to offer her clients a large variety.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the coming season.

loans.name: Editha Ampara

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Edhita,  ella tiene 26 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta linda  relación tiene dos niños de 4 y 1 año. Su marido trabaja en un taller de cerrajería.

Ella realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo ya que es así como toda la familia sale adelante, mientras ella atiende el hogar y a sus hijos él trabaja en un taller de cerrajería que tiene en su casa, aquí realiza muchas obras como: puertas, ventanas y cubiertas de casas entre otros trabajos que se realizan con el metal. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8am hasta las 17h00.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para su trabajo. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y está muy a gusto por los créditos y la facilidad de pagos que brinda la institución. Su sueño es darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, there is a gathering every two weeks in the communal bank "Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes."  This is a city known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

In this place we find Señora Edhita. She is 26 years old and is married.  The fruit of this beautiful relationship are two children, who are 1 and 4 years of age.  Her husband works in a metal works workshop.

Señora Edhita handles the loans for her husband's business, which is how her family can get ahead.  While she takes care of their home and their children, her husband works in the metal works workshop that he has in their home.  He makes many things, like doors, windows, porch covers and other items made of metal.  He works from Monday to Saturday from 8am until 5pm.

This loan will be used to purchase work materials.  Señora Edhita has been with the communal bank for three cycles and is very happy with the loans and the easy payments that the institution offers.  Her dream is to give her children a very good education.

loans.use: To purchase metal works materials, like iron, paint, metals etc.

loans.name: Alain

texts.es: El Sr. Alain vive en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz es  casado, su esposa es empleada, su actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, también esta estudiando en la universidad lo cual alterna el negocio con los estudio, con el fin de darle un futuro mejor a su familia, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería, por fin de año desea surtir su tienda con refrescos, dulces, galletas, chocolates, etc. , hace unos dos año que tiene el negocio,  viven en la casa de su madre a quien ayuda también con algunos gastos de la casa, es muy trabajador y su deseo es el de terminar sus estudios, esta muy agradecido con la institución con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Alain lives in the el Torneo area, 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz.  He is married and his wife is employed.  He sells staples and is also studying at the university, alternating his work and his studies, with the hope of providing his family with a better future.  The loan is to purchase merchandise.  For the new year, he would like to stock his business with sodas, sweets, cookies, chocolates, etc.  He has had his business for two years.  They live in his mother's house who they assist with household expenses.  He is a hard worker and wants to finish his studies.  He is very grateful for the institution and the support it provides.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Auxiliadora tiene 60 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad .Trabaja todos los días desde la 6 mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, nos cuenta que su tienda la tiene ya hace 5 años y que empezó por la necesidad ya que tenía que sacar a sus hijos adelante a pesar de estar sola. Los productos de su tienda las compran en el mercado y también recibe en su local ciertos productos. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, 60, is a grocer.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items.  She is open for business every day from 6am until 9pm.  She tells us that her store has been in operation for 5 years already and that it started because she had to support her children despite being alone.

She buys the items for her store in the market and also gets some of the items delivered to the store.

The reason for the loan is to buy stock items like sweets, beverages and basic grains among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta B. is married to a mason. She sells fresh and smoked fish at Takoradi and has been doing this for five years. She assists her husband to take care of  the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy additional fish for sale to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her additional capital.
In this photo, Atta is cleaning the fish to be smoked.

loans.use: To buy additional fish for sale

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza O. is a 62-year-old widow with four children. She worked as a nurse at the local hospital for 25 years and now she is on pension.  In order to find an additional means of subsistence, she decided to start her activities in cattle breeding and land cultivating with potatoes and wheat. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts.  Roza managed to increase the number of cattle to two milk cows and one bull. Also, she had 5 tons of potatoes to sell. 

Now Roza is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase one cow and two tons of potato seeds. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to pay for the education of her grandson. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and seeds

loans.name: Rosemar

texts.en:
Rosemar A. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old. Rosemar is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Rosemar owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Rosemar has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Rosemar is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosemar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has a mixed farm in Nkubu Town, eastern Kenya that produces milk, maize, potatoes, and cabbages. He has been in the farming business for fifteen years now and sells his products locally.

Edward is 44 years old and married, with three children aged five, ten, and 22. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 47,250 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from milk sales will enable him to pay school fees for his children. He plans to acquire five more dairy cows and a generator in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma S. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Anselma is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anselma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, junk food, spices and vegetables in the local community. Anselma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anselma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anselma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anselma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anselma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: T. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 35 years old and married to a tailor with eight children. All of her children go to school. T. borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia A. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Antonia is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Antonia makes and sells coconut oil and coco charcoal in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Antonia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase coconuts for making products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Antonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for making products to sell

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 30 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Connie runs a sari-sari (variety) store and cafeteria in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Connie has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store and cafeteria for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (mini-restaurant)/eatery.

Connie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Asliya

texts.en:
K. Asliya is divorced and has one child. She trades in the market of Sakhovat in the sector of Ganjina. She works very hard because the future of her child depends on her. She sells woman’s clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000, which will use to purchase new fashionable clothes and to increase the assortment of goods for expansion of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Tiene más de 34 años en este negocio, a pesar de que no ha sido fácil la situación de Rosa ya que algunas veces tiene encargarse del hogar y del negocio al mismo tiempo. Trabaja todos los días ya que tiene que salir a vender sus productos y algunas veces la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cal, maíz, leña, comal, bolsas plásticas, servilletas entre otros. Se siente agradecida por tener un apoyo económico como lo es su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa Amelia works selling tortillas.  She has worked in this business for more than 34 years even though it has not always been easy as she is sometimes managing the home and the business at the same time.  She works every day and has to go out to sell her product, and sometimes the majority of her customers come to her business.  The purpose of the loan is to buy lime, corn, firewood, a comal (tortilla skillet), plastic bags, napkins, etc.  She is thankful for the economic support that will help her business.

loans.use: buy lime, corn, firewood, a comal, plastic bags, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 37 and widowed with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Narangerel’s oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest daughter is a year old. On days that she works, Narangerel leaves her youngest child at her partner’s home. She is responsible for taking care of her daughters. 

In 1992, Narangerel began operating a hair salon in Bulgan province. In 2007, she moved to Ulaanbaatar and began operating a hair salon in the center of the city. Narangerel is an experienced hairdresser who has been operating a hair salon for more than 12 years. She is popular in her area and has many regular customers. 

Narangerel is a responsible and honest person who cares about her children’s future. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay three months rent at her hair salon which will enable her to secure her workplace.

loans.use: to pay three months rent for her hair salon

loans.name: Willium

texts.en:
Willium is 38 years old and married, with four children. He is a fishmonger in Marereni Town in Malindi and has been in the business for the past two years now. He makes a monthly income of about KES 6,000 from the business.

He has been loaned KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his first loan from KADET. He plans to use a portion of the loan to expand his business by putting up a wooden structure to serve as a business premise. The rest of it he will use to add stock into the business.

He will use the anticipated profit from his business to take care of his family and he will save some of it for future investments.

loans.use: to build a wooden structure to serve as a business premise and to add stock into the business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene como principal actividad económica el servicio de transporte, trabaja en el radio taxi por mas de 2 años, gracias al préstamo de una institución financiera pudo comprar un taxi con el que trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche casi todos los días, su esposa ayuda con los gastos familiares con el ingreso que tiene con la actividad de trenzado de mantas para señoras de pollera, viven en la ciudad de el alto con su hijo que aun es pequeño, en un futuro piensa comprar su domicilio para dar comodidad a su hijo y a su esposa, por el momento ambos  trabajan todos los días para poder reunir dinero para un anticrético de un departamento por esto solicito el crédito para aumentar para el anticrético.  Don juan trabaja con la institución desde el año 2010 demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juan's main business activity is providing a transport service.  He has been working in the radio taxi business for more than two years.  Thanks to a loan from a financial institution, he was able to buy a taxi which he works with from morning to night, almost every day.  Juan's wife helps cover the family expenses with the income that she makes braiding shawls for 'señoras de pollera' (women who wear traditional outfits).

The couple live in the city of El Alto with their young son.  In the future, Juan plans to buy his home so that he can provide his son and wife with more comfort.  At the moment, both he and his wife work every day in order to be able to put together enough money to pay the 'anticrético'* on an apartment.  They are requesting this loan to increase their 'anticrético'* payment.  Juan has been working with the institution since 2010.  He has shown responsibility and punctuality in making his payments.

*'Anticrético' is a special type of arrangement in which property is 'loaned' to a tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment.  The rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period.

loans.use: to increase his 'anticrético' payment on an apartment

loans.name: Enrique Alexander

texts.es:
El Señor Enrique Alexander se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, este negocio le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Este negocio lo inicio por su padre quien le enseño este medio de vida pues ha sido con mucho esfuerzo que ha logrado seguir adelante. 

Enrique conoce muy bien a estos animales, pues conoce que les gusta estar en un ambiente en donde se encuentre lodo o agua y tenerlos amarrados porque son muy inquietos. El señor aduce, que gracias a Dios su negocio ha estado muy rentable, por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que ha enfrentado. Actualmente, su sueño más anhelado es tener su propia granja de crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Enrique Alexander's business is buying and selling pigs.  This business has helped him to make profits that he uses to cover the needs of his family.  He is requesting this current loan to buy pigs.  He started the business through his father who taught him this line of work.  With a lot of effort, he has managed to get ahead.  

Enrique knows the best way to raise pigs, and as such understands that they like to be in a cool environment near mud or water. It is also best to have them tied up or they can get uncomfortable. He claims that, thanks to God, his business has been very profitable.  His only problem has been the illnesses that he has faced.  Currently, his biggest dream is to own his own pig farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a married man. His wife is a farmer and they have 4 children between 15  and 2 years old. Onesmus runs a bookshop and his major customers are teachers and parents of school going children. He has been in this business for 6 years and has four employees. Onesmus hopes to use his loan to buy stationery to resell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business, open other bookshops in the area and possibly become the major supplier of stationery to the local schools. Onesmus describes himself as business like,charismatic, prudent and social.

loans.use: To buy stationery

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 24 years old, single and hardworking.  For three years, he has been selling wallets, belts, caps and bracelets.  He operates his business without a permanent business premise. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access business loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loan.

Alex hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wallets, belts and caps.

loans.use: To buy wallets, belts and caps to sell.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 47-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her two children. She specializes in preparing delicious homemade food, which she sells to customers from her community. She has been involved in this type of business since 2006. In parallel, she works in a local hospital in order to earn superior income. She has been working so hard to support her family, especially after the death of her husband. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven and renew her cooking tools. In the future, she would like to rent out a small space to sell her popular homemade food products.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and renew her cooking tools

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipolito nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 45 años de edad. El tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos y todos viven en la ciudad del Cusco. El tiene un puesto de venta de mariscos y pescados en el centro comercial el Molino II de la ciudad Cusco. Lo pueden encontrar desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche en su puesto de venta. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Hipolito requiere el préstamo para comprar pescado como por ejemplo jurel, caballa, pejerrey y otros más. Su sueño del socio es abrir una cámara frigorífica. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hipolito was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 45 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and three children in the city of Cusco.

Hipolito has a seafood and fish stall in the El Molino II shopping center in the city of Cusco where he can be found from 6 o'clock in the morning until 8 o'clock at night.  He has been in this business for six years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  On this occasion, Hipolito needs a loan to buy fish such as horse mackerel, mackerel, pejerrey, etc.  His dream is to open a cold storage facility.

The 'El Molinito II' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is a very touristy and commercial area.  It is known for its traditional 'Inti Raymi' fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machupicchu).

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Nambasamba A Group

texts.en:
Robert is the facilitator for Nambasana A Group.  This group joined One Acre Fund in 2010. Robert says that he joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best prices, grow enough food to feed his family, access fertilizer and hybrid seed. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Robert and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In his most recent harvest, Robert reports that he was able to get 9 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.  By his measure, this was an excellent harvest.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Robert was only able to get 4 bags on 1/2 acre of land.  

With the profits from his harvest, Robert plans on sending his children to school, repairing his home, saving for the future, investing in livestock, and perhaps investing in a business.  

In total, Robert's group will plant 6 acres of land in 2012, each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre.

Robert's  Field Officer Josephine is in front of this picture.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su madre, es soltero, administra una granja de pollos, este negocio lo inicio hace varios años su madre, crían los pollos y salen a ofrecerlos ya alineados, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer la venta. Por lo que Solicita un préstamo para comprar pollos y concentrado la idea es aumentar la granja de manera que le produzca más ganancias.
Las proyecciones de Juan son que su negocio continúe creciendo, conocer más clientes, proveer las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his mother, and is unmarried.  He manages a chicken farm, which his mother started several years back.  They raise the chickens and sell them when they're ready; they don't have a fixed schedule for when to sell them.

He is requesting the loan to buy chickens and concentrated feed, as his plan is to grow his farmyard in a way that will generated more earnings.

Juan's plans are for his business to continue growing, to gain more customers, and to earn the money necessary to help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed for his farm.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 34-year old hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last two years, she has been managing a beauty salon to support her family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care, she has retained her business because of her good reputation. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 38, is married with three children. She owns a general store selling beans, rice, maize, sugar, etc. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m until 6 p.m every day except weekends. She currently employs two people to help her.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase the stock in her general store, such as beans, rice, maize, sugar, etc. With the profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food, such as rice, beans, maize, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Jeanne has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns more income from food vending and charcoal and firewood retailing.

Jeanne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila es casada  con el señor Jesús Mizrain y con quien procreo cinco hijos quiñes ya todos son dependientes de sí mismo, ella vive en un barrio pequeño en donde celebran la fiesta de trinidad.

    Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz  para tostarlo y venderlo en pinol, tascalate, y polvillo, en esta actividad lleva trabajando hace  un año y cuatro meses en la que le va bien ya que con ello ha logrado mejorar sus  ingresos.
 
   Quien la inspiro en esta actividad fue ella sola para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así salir adelante.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella valla mejorando cada día más su actividad y tener como sostenerse mas adelante.
texts.en: Lucila is married to Jesus Mizrain and together they have 5 children who are still dependent on them.  They live in a small neighborhood where the people celebrate the fiesta of the Trinity.  Lucila is requesting this loan to purchase corn, which she roasts, grinds and sells.  She's been working at this for almost a year and a half.  So far it's been going well and she's been able to increase her income.    This business was Lucila's idea, as she wanted to help her husband with their household costs, and help improve their quality of life.  What she wants most is to continue to grow this business each day, so that it can help sustain her in later years.

loans.use: to purchase corn than she roasts, grinds and sells.
